description:
One of my very favorite spots on my trip to San Francisco about a week ago. I was craving sushi (and still need to try a sushiritto) but this place was magically right in front of us as I said, I want some sushi in San Francisco.

Located on Pier 39 - overlooking bustling shops and seal calls, right by the water - the vibes are AHMAZING. Truly open space with a view of Alcatraz - such a gem in this city! For sure, and I haven't even gotten to the food yet. The server was awesome. An Irish guy with an accent and green eyes and attentive to our sushi needs after day drinking on the pier! 

The sushi!! I love tuna rolls and because they are so basic, the fish really needs to be fresh for it to taste good - and this fish was fresh, tasty and the rice was great. My friend is a vegetarian so we ordered all the other veggie stuff we could. The veggie roll was delicious, the tempura veggies were delicious too. The edamame was a little cold but it was fine because Fireball was $5. 

I will be back in San Fran and I will be back here for sushi too.
author: Josi H.

description:
Worst sushi place ever. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY HERE!

Ordered hamachi mama and it wasn't cooked all the way. Had to send it back to the kitchen to have it cooked more. 

Then ordered crispy rice spicy tuna and it was the worst one I've ever had. The crispy rice wasn't even crispy. The spicy tuna looked old. 

Ordered the dragon roll and it was SOAKED in unagi sauce that you couldn't even taste anything but the sauce. Then the shrimp, cucumber and unagi was cut so small that you wouldn't even know it was on the roll.

Lastly, I got the spider roll and I don't know how to describe it, but it just looked old and bad. 

I WILL NEVER GO HERE AGAIN! 

They should re-evaluate their chefs because the food quality is LOW!
author: Jessica M.

description:
Had a horrible time here! Went to get some sushi here a couple weeks ago with a friend. We also had 3 middle school age kids with us who were very hungry. Originally we wanted to go to Bubba Gump but since the kids were so hungry and lines were long, we found this place and thought it was perfect.

They told us it would take 5 minutes to get a table but took ~20 minutes, only after we asked again, did we get seated. It got worse. After we ordered our food, it hadn't come in almost 50 minutes!! The waitress didn't even come back to make sure everything was okay. We complained twice, still no customer service. We were brushed off over and over. The kids with us were almost crying from hunger! 

After we finally got the food and ate. We wanted to speak to the manager. He apologized and said there was a shortage of chefs that day. Then why seat more and more people and take their orders?? We were on a time crunch and it took way too long to get our food. If they were short-staffed, I understand that happens. 

It would have been best to tell customers they were running late, and even if they can't control that, some customer service would have been appreciated! Never going back here.
author: Runa M.

description:
We came in for lunch and were pretty hungry. We sat in the bar area for happy hour. We ordered our entire meal at around 2:50. 2 appetizers and an entree. Come 3:30 (a whole 40 minutes later) our entrees arrive but no appetizer, and still no silverware either. The bartender told us that he had dropped our appetizers at another table. We witnessed this and the table mentioned to him they this couldn't be theirs but he left them anyway. About 10min later our appetizers come out. 

The only time our table was visited was to take our order and drop off food. The service was poor and you often saw the staff standing around talking to each other. We were never even brought water until we asked for it when the check came. 

Would not recommend this place to anyone.
author: Tyler G.

description: This place is at the very end of Pier 39 upstairs and it has great views. That's about the end of the good news though.  Thank God they had happy hour when we were there because the prices were ridiculous.  Yes,  it is in a major tourist zone, but $7 for a small hot sake?!?  There were a few happy hour food items. We tried the garlic fries and they were okay. The serving was small and there wasn't a lot of garlic.  My main problem with this place is the music that they play.  It's for really OLD people.  Think smooth jazz + Karen carpenter.   Oih.   So bad.
author: Michelle R.

description:
Walking down the Pier makes you hangry so we decided to grab some sushi! My friend wanted to try their HH menu and at first the hostess didn't even know they had a HH. But once she figured it out we were sat at the upper level of the restaurant because the lower level next to the windows do not serve HH. 

Service was ok. Our first waitress took 5-8 minutes to come because she was in a rush to leave. I'm my opinion, it was unprofessional. It looked like the owner or manager was there right behind us and didn't even offer us waters. Poor customer service on their part. When you've been walking all day you tend to get parched.

Once our real waiter came, he was kind and attentive. Poor guy had to wait on the entire restaurant and tend the bar. Not sure if this place was trying to save money or what but 1 server at this time doesn't seem feasible.

My friend ordered the crunchy California roll and there was no crunch so she was disappointed. I ordered the Lion King (3.5/5) the seared salmon on top made this roll tasteful. I ordered the Lychi Martini and it came with cranberry? It was different but not my fav mix.

I would recommend this place if you're looking for cheap and basic sushi.
author: Trinh V.

description:
First off I just wanna start off by saying the food was good. My family and I were roaming through Pier 39 for a nice restaurant to dine at when we happen to see Hana Zen. We saw the the wonderful view of the bay and decided to dine here!

There was a fifteen minute wait for our table as the restaurant was busy and full at the time. I have to say the problem started with our waiter. I'm not sure if she was having a bad day or not but she didn't start our mood in a right way. She seemed to have an attitude and looked annoyed when taking and serving our order. I have to note she rolled her eyes a few times before which I noticed. 

The food came in great to say the least! We had two of their chicken bento box's and a few sushi rolls and fried chicken. What probably destroyed our mood was that a random lady came to our table to take random pictures of us and I felt a little uncomfortable after that. Later that lunch she came back and solicited some of those pictures to us and I felt " pressured " to buy the $22 postcard. I don't think this is appropriate for guests dining at a restaurant. If I wanted my picture taken I would have gone to a photo booth or something. 

I really don't like giving bad reviews but this one had to be yelped for the record. Don't even get me started with the men's restroom!
author: AJ P.

description:
I come here because my boat is here at pier 39, but I think this is my last visit.  The sushi chef has no idea how to make a roll, assume it's because this place deals with volume and countless number of tourists who maybe have no idea what sushi is supposed to be like.

I ordered an easy roll - rainbow and this is what I got.  Tiny scraps of fish thrown on a pre-rolled roll
author: Kristine K.

description:
Great view of Alcatraz!  

Use to eat at this spot some years ago when it was an Alcatraz-themed restaurant.  View still as I remember it.  

Sushi was nice, good veggie options.  Not rushed and happy to take our time for dinner.  The pomegranate mojito was pretty good!  

Price was good for SF, especially considering it has such a great view and is in such a touristy area.
author: Michael T.

description:
The happy hour deal is very good, but the food is just alright. I understand probably most tourists come here thinking this is good Japanese food since it is one of the few around there. However, the food was just basic. It wasn't anything special to me. I would go just for some of those happy hour bites.

Plus one more star for the view.
author: Allyson L.

description:
Gordon Ramsay review
It sucks that I even can have to give this place a one star because it does not deserve that

Sushi !!! Really my grandmother can make better rolls and she has no arms no legs and she's had a lobotomy

Please if you're telling me this is the best place in San Francisco then somebody is lacking a pallet

Be very worried and very concerned if you go to this place it's a guaranteed food poisoning
The tuna had a color that I have never seen before and I have caught an eaten a lot of tuna in my time

The garlic noodles. Hmmm   Lacking originality basically they suck I Mean if you will just grab a noodle out of the bag with a piece of garlic and eat it that would be basically what you would be having it was horrible and when I mean horrible I mean absolutely horrible

The Ahi tuna salad was a joke you could grab a bag of lettuce have a drop on the floor out of your fridge raider and accidentally have the tuna land on top and that's basically what you would be getting 

Spicy tuna where was the spice very plain Jane horrible you could get better flavor is out of Jennie Craigs dinner plates
  

The service !!!! Hmm !!! It f----ing  sucked bid donkey you know what  

 
The drinks to blue Hawaiians I don't know what they did to make it blue maybe they got some water from the Porta potty but all I can say is they either are used like something you put in your holding tank in your boat with a little splash of alcohol where was the pineapple juice I have no idea had to ask the waiter to bring us a glass of pineapple juice because the lady forgot to put it in and by the way we didn't get our drinks until after we were halfway through our dinner. 



If there is justice in the world they would credit our card back so if you're reading this you stupid restaurant please write the review hear back to me and then we have will contact you and you can definitely credit our card back we would highly appreciate it because I'm sure we just took a bunch of laxatives that we did not know that's pretty much what we feel about your food that's probably what it will do to our stomachs it's just hasn't hit yet but I'm sure we will be up all night filling up my holding tank 

If there is any good management out there hopefully they read this review feel sorry and stupid for even serving food like they do this place out to be shut down and get better food at Jack-in-the-Box and that's not saying much

Actually if I went to prison I can probably get better food

Anyways enough of my crap talking I just wanted you guys know how bad this place really is and hopefully somebody reads this review I am not that picky the person I am truly letting you know that this place is pure crap do not eat there there's so many better places in San Francisco to eat get an Uber and go don't eat here
author: Mike V.

description: Amazing sushi. Amazing service. Amazing view! I would recommend the Cherry Blossom roll, the Lion King roll, and the eel cucumber roll! The edamame and potstickers were fantastic appetizers as well.
author: Shane H.

description: This place is located on Pier 39 on the second story right by the water you can see nice views from there. I like the location because whenever you eat you can also enjoy the view. This place has five stars customer service. Prices in this restaurant are very affordable I would have to say that this is the cheapest restaurant on that food court or shopping center or whatever it is. They have very cheap prices on happy hour which I believe from 12 PM to 5 PM from all the stuff I liked crunchy California roll. Honestly that Bento box with teriyaki chicken was not the best. I don't know if there is folks that live chicken with skin but that's what they serve And teriyaki chicken Bento box. Fried vegetables that comes in a Bento box was not the best taste either they tasted like they were outside for a long time I would have to say that all sushi rolls are very delicious
author: Ivan A.

description:
Ordered the Crunchy Spicy Tuna Roll and got catfood-grade tuna. They obviously think  they're catering to foolish tourists who won't notice being served trash. I pulled out the "tuna" and ate around it.
Wife had a very average teriyaki chicken.
author: Randy H.

description: This place is mediocre at best. Their menu is pretty simple, not very choices I felt like. I had the Kamikaze roll and the mussels, my husband had the dynamite roll and the spicy roll. The dishes lacked flavor and everyone (party of 6) was unimpressed with their food. It took 30 minutes for our food to come out even though the place was pretty empty. The views are amazing and that's why they got two stars but food was a disappointment. Won't be back.
author: Rosyli T.

description:
The food was very bland and watered-down. But the view and service was really nice.

The miso soup was like a bowl of water with tofu and seaweed chunks. I have never tasted such bland miso before. I suspect they were running low on it, because it wasn't served until we were well into our entrees, when it should've been served as an appetizer. The tempura sauce and sake also tasted like bowls of water. The tofu steak was too gooey, but the mushrooms and onions on top were everything. The avocado rolls looked like they were made for a baby but tasted fine. The salad was good and so were the veggie rolls. I would only go here again to experience the view and maybe a cocktail.
author: Monique' M.

description: Worst experience ever!!! Would give zero stars if that was an option, food was below average, server lied about being the manger and promptly did that there was no manager. Then told us we had to pay full price for everything and we still haven't gotten all of our food. Charged for wrong dishes. Zoy was our server and was extremely hostile. I have never experienced a restaurant like this before. Such a negative experience.
author: Alexa L.

description: The hostess, Danielle, was terrible. From the minute we sat down, we received nothing but a passive aggressive attitude from her. We felt we were being rushed. She emphasized that they were closing soon. It was 9:30pm, they close at 11pm. Will never recommend this place to anybody just because of her.
author: Russell M.

description:
Terribly slow service. Zero seasoning on edamame beans, the tempura battered shrimp just had normal batter, not tempura. Ordered the seared Tataki Tuna, it smelt off( it was so bad i was nauseas from the smell) and sent it back. We gave up and walked out!
The manager handled it well, but our evening was ruined! To be avoided.
author: Greg M.

description: Beautiful view overlooking the water and Alcatraz.  Food was on point and waiter was awesome!
author: Brenda R.

description: Food was okay. We went because of Happy Hour prices - however, we were unaware of the 18% mandated gratuity. 1 star for that, especially since we only had a party of 4.
author: Liana Christine A.

description:
My Friends and I decided to have a Saturday outing in San Francisco on the record hottest day ever recorded in San Francisco. It was literally 100+ degrees outside. 

After walking around San Francisco and finally deciding to go to the Pier for dinner, we struck out at HardRock and Bubba Gump because of the crazy long wait (1.5-3 hour wait!!!). We found this restaurant and luckily they had no wait. The restaurant  was nice inside, and there was surprisingly not many people inside. Although it was really hot that day, they too like the other restaurants we went to had no air conditioning. Being Bay Area locals, we figured they never needed it because its SF and its ALWAYS cold. 

The restaurant looks fairly new. The staff at the front was helpful and was able to seat us almost immediately with a nice dinner view of Alcatraz and the Bay. Before sitting down at our table we sat the bar, near the entrance for a little bit and ordered some drinks. The bartender, didn't seem at all happy to be working. Even though there was only 2 other people at the bar. It wasn't as if he was super busy. To our surprise, he didn't know how to make a midori sour.. He even asked us if it was on the menu and asked us for the recipe. Ummm.. you're the bartender, 1. shouldn't' you know the menu and 2. shouldn't you know how to make a midori sour? come on, if you can make an AMF I'm sue you  can make a midori sour. That was a big let down for us. 

When we got to our table we forgot our ordeal with the bartender and got distracted by the gorgeous evening view of the Bay and Alcatraz. We had ordered our food, but the service was slow. It took awhile to get  hold of the waitstaff and one of my friends orders came out really late, probably they forgot the order? The server kept saying that the kitchen was backed up. 

The food overall was good and the price decent. If only they had better trained their bartenders and waitstaff. 

Would I come back? Maybe if the other restaurants at Pier 39 aren't packed. But, I wouldn't come to the Pier and immediately want to eat here.
author: Rochelle M.

description: NEVER AGAIN WILL I EVER EAT HERE AGAIN! Service was horrible because we waiting for over 45minutes before we could even get our drinks! Sever was rude and was rushing us to hurry and order. I asked for a lemonade was brought to me and after halfway drinking it my husband notice there was a lipstick stain on my cup!!! Absolutely unacceptable! When brought to the servers attention he said oh okay I'll take it off the bill! EXCUSE ME?? you just gave me a used cup! I asked for the manager and he stared at our table and never came to talk to us until my husband went up and asked if he was the manager! He offered to do nothing! DISGUSTING PLACE AND SHOULD BE CLOSED DOWN!
author: Crystal B.

description: Read some shotty reviews, but when we went it was all really tasty. Move view on the Pier too. Our server wasn't the best, but he was young and I don't think there were any other servers at that time. Mai Tai was good and strong, but smaller than most Japanese places I've been to.
author: J J.

description:
We were lucky to have dinner on the spring firework day. Because all restaurants need to wait 1.5 hour at least. The receptionist is busy but stil very quicky to get us a table. 

The sushi looked unique because the chef add the orange on the sushi and it tasted delicious and amazing. 

The lava rock is unique and scallops & praws are fresh. We also order their special cocktail and it is good. Hot sake is too much  for a  person. We can't finish a hit sake.

The female receptionist was very nice and detail-oriented, we enjoyed her service a lot.

I definitely recommend anyone can go to this place to enjoy the delicious dinner and have a amazing ocean night view.
author: Christine P.

description: We visited Pier 39 on a weekend, so crowds were heavy.  Hana Zen seated us quickly.  Servers were friendly.  Recommend the Lava Plate and Dragon Roll.
author: J T.

description:
Sushi is mediocre at best. Waited 45 mins for 4 rolls in an empty restaurant. It's on the END of pier 39 which also the most congested with tourist!... 
there has to be better local sushi joints than this one.
author: Bart B.

description: The sushi didn't taste fresh. The tuna poke is served in a small martini glass with 5 pieces of fish for $14, no wonton chips or anything to go with it. The rainbow roll consisted of not so fresh fish. The happy hour drinks are not so happy hour-priced. Only good thing is the view is gorgeous, pretty much panoramic. Then, we witnessed an altercation between employees, one of the gals ran out screaming. And, we carried on.
author: JeffSeda V.

description: Food was basic and not special at all. Don't come! You can definitely get better Japanese food elsewhere. Here it is overpriced and not authentic at all. The teriyaki chicken bento box came with just veggies, A LOT of chicken, and a bowl of rice. There was just too much meat and the veggies were cold? I couldn't finish the chicken and barely ate half. The rolls were good at least.
author: Sabrina L.

description:
This placed seemed good upon arrival..... little did we know.....

When we got in first red flag was that we didn't receive water until about 15 mins after arrival. Had to ask for water and the waiter simply laughed like he forgot.  Then we ordered out food and had to wait about 45 mins to a hour to get our main entree... The waiter "accidentally" gave another party our order.. He said that there was a mix up but we know it wasn't true.... All in all I really wish I could rate 1/2 a star... I wouldn't come back. Food was bad, service was worse. I am surprised being that we are in SF at Pier 39! Major Hotspot. You would think it would be up to higher standards... won't be back.
author: Taylor J.

description: Tasty food. Super nice staff. We watched the sunset in our window seat. It was a nice Saturday evening. So, I don't understand all the negative reviews.
author: D. X.

description: Went here last night for the first time, and I will definitely be back. When you walk into the restaurant, the first thing you notice is the amazing of San Francisco Bay, that includes Alcatraz, Angel Island and the Golden Gate Bridge. The service, it was outstanding, as I was with a small party of five. Brought you your drinks immediately. Now for the appetizers, the Calamari is outstanding, and the dipping sauce, had a nice spicy chipotle taste to it. Also ordered an appetizer of Sweet Chicken Wings with a Ranch Dressing. Finally, to my meal and I ordered the Lava Plate (you cook the main course yourself) with Chicken, Fried Rice and a nice assortment of Broccoli and Carrots with a dipping sauce. As for dessert, I had Fried Bananas with vanilla ice cream and I was so full, that I brought the bananas home. The owner/manager Angie is a sweetheart.
author: Jeremy K.

description: The server was good, he was able to help select a menu item and he gave a few suggestions. It's a bit pricey for the selection we had, chicken teriyaki but they offered a kids meal that had plenty of food for the price.
author: Mrs. B.

description: Never been here before but our friend group thought we would try it. Patrick was our server and had only been there a month. The fries and gyoza came out first and took 30 minutes, the rest of the sushi rolls came out 15 minutes later. Apparently they only had one chef making everyone's food. And a party of 7 came in 10 minutes after us and got they're food first. He split the checks wrong and put shrimp with our other roll. I have a shrimp allergy and had to move it to another plate. Long story short we'll never be back and tell everyone else to avoid this place, it sucks. Also gratuity is included so you can't decide the tip on really bad service.
author: Nick D.

description: If I could give 0 stars I definitely would worst place ever. We had Patrick as our server and he took forever. We didn't get our food till 40 minutes later and the customer service was terrible. Never did he ever fill up our cups with water nor ask if we wanted more drinks. He said he was new and it for sure showed. Not only that but it was dead there was only one other family and they got our food before us. Also gratuity is included otherwise I wouldn't have tipped. Don't recommend to anyone.
author: Emily C.

description: They are in the heart of the tourist trap that is Pier 39, so they get away with charging insane prices for TERRIBLE food. My SO got the crab - which we think was fried? Never heard of crab legs being fried before- wouldn't recommend; they were very tough and dry. I got a special that included 3 pieces of sashimi and a chef's choice sushi roll (he chose the California roll) The sushi was sub par, but edible because they did use real crab instead of imitation. The sashimi tasted as if it was frozen before- unacceptable on the coast. Service was crappy too, and they weren't busy for a Friday night. Not worth the $90 + tip. Overall, please choose a different restaurant if you're at Pier 39 or craving sushi in SanFran.
author: Alexis J.

description:
Worst service ever. An old Asian-looking male server doesn't know how to serve. First of all, we had to wait for long to order. There was no beef, so we had to change our order, which was totally fine. We asked the server to let us see a menu again. I'd describe he almost threw the menu, and he left without saying any words. He could've say ''there you go'' or something? We were very offended. 
It is a Japanese cuisine restaurant; however, it
does not carry Japanese spirit or whatever. His attitude clearly stinked. 
I'm also offended with the fact that some people think that it is a Japanese restaurant whereas it isn't. Being a Japanese, I'm very ashamed.

Lots of factors to complain. NO recommended. 
Burger king would serve better. Go to Burger King.

50代ほどの店員さんの態度が非常に悪かったです。アメリカに来て1年半、一番最悪のサービスでした。席へ案内された後、長い間飲み物も出されないまま待たされました。注文した後に牛肉のストックがないと言うので、まぁそんなこともあるかと思い、メニューを見せて下さいとお願いしたところ、メニューを投げるように置いて、何も言わずに去っていく。まるでテレビ番組のドッキリかのようでした。
author: Ogawa H.

description:
The food quality at the restaurant was really sub par. The view is nice and the place is clean.  

The sushi size and amount was really weak. The Crab size was very good though. 

The only great thing about the place was the bartender and our waitress. The bartender on 5/6/18 around 2pm made the drinks perfectly. Our waitress Myly (sp?) was very helpful and nice. She did a great job of taking care of us and providing excellent service. 

My bill was close to 200 and I was still hungry.  The sushi size was just too small.  Each piece was so small that I couldn't get the actual taste of the fish.
author: True Critic X.

description: AMAZING nigiri!!!! My husband has a gluten allergy and our waiter Victor made sure the sushi chef could make a GF roll!!! The caterpillar roll was to die for! The cut of fish they used for my Smoked Sake & Hamachi was SO SO GOOD!!!! Coming back for sure ! Thank you!
author: Ashton K.

description:
Mediocre food, slow service. 

The restaurant was huge, with lots of open tables. I came with my cousin after a day of hiking, we were on our second dinner to reward ourselves like normal people do after overexerting their bodies. 

To start we ordered pomegranate mojitos because they sounded delicious. Then the tuna poke, and two maki rolls, lion king and spider roll. 

The mojitos took FOREVER. I flagged our service down after 16 minutes to ask what was going on. He said he'd be right with us and then never came back. The bartender finally brought the drinks over and made a snarky comment about how busy she was. Yeah, we can see, we don't need the attitude. 

The mojitos were a disappointment. I was expecting pomegranate floating around in a refreshing, fruity, minty drink. Instead there was thick pink syrup and then a couple of mint leaves. The food came and it was okay. The tuna poke was my favorite dish. I could have done without the maki rolls. 

There are better places around here.
author: Vee V.

description:
If you're in the mood for sushi and find yourself at Pier 39, this is a solid choice for it. They have all the staples that will take care of your craving. Are they "super fancy" and have a large selection of rare types of sushi? No. But the place is clean, passably modern furnishings and a great view. Do they fly in their fish and ingredients from Japan? No. But the sushi and entrees and apps are prepared with care. And is the menu diverse enough for folks in your party to find something that isn't necessarily sushi? Yes. 

Our experience with service was nothing like what the reviews are mentioning. Is it the best service I've ever had anywhere? No. But our server checked in on us several times, always had a smile, and was prompt and communicative. 

Added bonus? They have San Miguel draft!! Visiting from Colorado (where no restaurants really carry San Miguel) and being Filipino, it filled me with pride and made my heart happy :)
author: Jem C.

description: I was walking the Pier 39 with my grandkids when we bumped into the restaurant Hana Zen, thinking it was going to be amazing. The food was good, however, the customer service lacked in several areas. First off, after waiting 15 mins to get a table, our server glared at us. As she took our order, she rushed my granddaughter and I to order and did not even finish taking my granddaughter's order. Secondly, as we are waiting for our food, a random lady comes up to us to take photos, pressuring us to buy them when they turned out horrific! I honestly was not impress with the service we were provided and most definitely will not return. A word of advice, do not make that lady solicit unnecessary things at a restaurant! Thank you.
author: Zeta A.

description:
Something left to be desired here.  I was expecting really good sushi since it was right in the middle of a tourist trap and is actually a bit more expensive than normal sushi places in the Bay.

Wasn't very impressed with the nigri and the rolls though.  You could tell that the texture didn't seem as fresh as it should be right in the middle of the Bay.

They didn't carry Takana unfiltered flavored sake even though it was on the menu.

The only cool thing from here was the decanter that the sake came in.  Very cool way of keeping something cold without getting it watered down.
author: Ben H.

description: Well, view is great. Service was awful. I liked tge sushi, it is just super slow service. 1 bartender for happy hour,  not good. Go elsewhere so you don't have to flag people down to get service
author: Sean D.

description:
Don't waste your money or time here!!!!

Went on Labor Day and sat at the upstairs bar. Asked the lady bartender there how much the market price was for uni. She said $8.97 and that it comes with 2 pieces. I, along with my 5 other friends there, all heard the same price. We ordered 6 orders. Ended up getting charged $20 each order when the bill came out. Cheap and dirty trick that they played. JUST TOO FOUL!!!

Don't go here. Service was awful as well. We ordered those uni, has 2 large sake and a round of sake bombs. Ended up waiting a very long time. And there were no other customers upstairs. 

Don't waste your money or your time.
author: Amy T.

description:
Amazing sushi.

Food was good. Location was good. Service was dismal.

Service was very slow...Made mistake with order once..
Did not show desert menu. Bought the check instead... 
Did not ask for drink refill even once during dinner...
author: Irshad K.

description: Of my vacations in San Francisco this was the most horrible place I sat, do not leave your money here is not worth it. very bad attention!
author: Hedi H.

description:
First time visiting San Francisco and I decided to check out Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. I needed to charge my phone and I wanted a chill a spot, and there was Hana Zen. A little hard to find but it's sort of tucked away towards the back of the Pier because of its great view. 

Anyways, SHOUT OUT to bartenders ZOY from Serbia and CILLIAM from Ireland for being friendly bartenders towards travelers like me. I worked in the restaurant industry for 6 years so I very much love this type of culture and attitude. 

If I ever come back to visit (San Fran is beautiful and so is the Pier), I'll definitely stop by this restaurant here again. Hope to run into Zoy or Cilliam again. HEY BOSS, GIVE THESE PPL A RAISE!!
author: Bryan C.

description:
Avoid avoid avoid. 

Off of pier 39 there are countless choices for you San Fran experience, not to mention even more in the city. 

One would assume a sushi place literally over the ocean it would be breathtaking, or at least satisfactory. The presentation of the food was pleasing to the eye, but that's all I have good to say about this place. 

It took FOREVER when we didn't order much, and our tempura veggies had a piece of squash that was brown and tasted rotten. 

Lastly, I'm sure you've heard the saying, "clean bathroom, clean kitchen." Their bathroom was disgusting.
author: Tawni H.

description: Don't order shellfish sashimi here. The menu shows there's sweet shrimp, they gave me cooked shrimp; there's ika(squid), they gave me tako(cooked octopus). This is not right, I can totally sue this place if I want because they are lying on the menu! For what they gave me, I should be paying half of the price. Oyster is not fresh. WTF?! Extremely over priced for a bento box+shellfish sashimi (about $70, uber eats)!
author: Momo W.

description: The phone just keeps ringing. No customer service
author: Arnel A.

description:
Mediocre food and slow service.

Came with a group of 5 and waited 15 minutes for someone to come seat us even though half the restaurant was empty.

Ordered the sushi combination which came with 3 pieces of nigiri (salmon, tuna, shrimp), 3 California rolls, and 3 spicy tuna rolls.  It took a while to come out, and the waitress gave our plates to a different table and didn't realize her mistake until we said something. The sushi was edible but far from outstanding. The rice was dry and fish was subpar. 

The salmon and beef teriyaki plates also looked unappetizing and came with one small piece of each. 

Would definitely not come back.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Great service from Patrick the bartender. The guy knows what he doing. Great job. 
My wife & I will come back. 
Thank you.
author: Sauza M.

description: Alway go here when at Pier 39! The views are spectacular and the food is always fresh delicious and fast to arrive at the table. We love going here and bringing people to it! If you find yourself strolling through the famous Pier 39 make sure you stop by for their sushi and green tea ice cream!
author: Karlos G.

description: Beautiful place with a view, the only reason I'm giving it a four stars. My party mainly came here for the drinks, and I have to say bartender disappointed us. Service could have been better. We told our bartender who was on each tab and didn't listen. Yikes man. Listen to your party. We ended up having to spilt the bill amongst ourselves since he didn't knew who got who. Very low communion skills and problem solving on his part.
author: Gio G.

description:
My family and I had dinner last night at Hana Zen on Pier 39 and although the food was decent, the service was amazing! Victor was probably one of the best servers we have ever encountered. 
Victor was prompt to take our drink orders, he was patient as we were still deciding on menu items but tried to keep him from leaving our table until we spit out our orders, he also was very observant and refilled drinks and brought extra forks even though we did not have to ask. 
It's extremely challenging to go to dinner with a baby and sometimes we become impatient and stressed as soon as the baby becomes fussy, but Victor was always touching base with us on where our food was. I believe he was the only server on at that time and I could tell he was running around but that did not detour him from giving us the attention we needed all while seeming happy to do it for us. Most of the time we eat out, servers get annoyed and roll their eyes and make us feel as though we are a burden, Victor did not make us feel this way. He was kind and patient, attentive and prompt. 
Thank you for an amazing dinner experience Victor (night shift on 6/28/18).
author: Suzie B.

description: This 5star goes to 1 employee, i watched her walk around an never lose composer ,Bartending Bussing,Taking order from customer, Waitress, an did a FANTASTIC JOB , im in the bizz so the owner needs to step up here. Ive yet ever to see this from any employee at this business an i frequent a lot for yrs, Great Job to this Beautiful Person an Dam Good Employee that i saw
author: Robert G.

description: We came here tonight after being on a mission to locate a new sushi spot. We just moved into town and this place looked nice from the outside. We decided to give it a try and I'm SO glad we did! My wife and I obsessed over the food. We gave the filet mignon cooked over the hot lava rock at your table a try and it melted in your mouth. The quality of the food here was just top notch. We also ordered the crispy California rolls which my wife said she could eat every single day from now on. The gyozas are also ridiculously delicious. 5 stars. We are new regulars. Thanks for a great dinner!
author: Edward D.

description: Hands down the best California rolls I've ever had! The San Francisco roll and pot stickers were amazing too! Great view of Alcatraz and the rest of the pier. The only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars is the service. The card machine wasn't working so they could only take cash, so I understand that could be a contributor to the slow service. The food was out quickly, but after we ate it took about 15 minutes to get the waiter over to bring the check. Maybe the service was just an unfortunate consequence of the out of order machine, so I wouldn't let that stop you from checking this place out. In fact, I decided after the first California roll I had that I would definitely return in the next 5 days. I'd say the best sushi in the San Fran area!
author: Cara H.

description: Great food. Decent service, felt a bit rushed, at the same time it took them 25 minutes to get soy sauce to the table, after rolls were served.
author: A. P.

description:
Bleh should've gone with my instinct and checked out the reviews before coming here. Worst service I've ever experienced in my life (no exaggeration here) Came in and it wasn't busy at all, literally less than 5tables were seated. Im not from this area but idk every restaurant usually asks if you want something to drink // automatically brings out water. Eh at first, so no biggie so I just asked for water after like 20 min of noticing she ain't coming out with any. You would think she would come out with water enough for the whole table but she only brought out one glass?? It wasn't until 30 mins after we received our food a busboy noticed we had like one glass of water shared among ourselves  (lmao even he was surprised). Food was whatever nothing spectacular, would rather go to mitsuwa or some Japanese market with a food court for better quality and price. After receiving our food, didn't even come back to check up on us.. so I had to wait an additional 15 min for the check after going up to the cash register myself. Damn and alright I was gonna be generous and tip like 10% but WAT THA FOK LOL 18% automatic gratuity bitch BYEEEE
Oh yeah the 1 star is for the view
author: Debbie D.

description:
I stopped by here because my party was still hungry after eating clam chowder bowls. The food is very pricey for small portions but is nonetheless very flavorful. 

I ordered ahi poke which came in a martini glass. The presentation is unique and pleasing despite the obvious small portion. The greens added a nice layer of crunch to the well seasoned fish. However I don't think I'll be coming back here to spend $16 on poke in a little martini glass.  

Overall the food is delicious, just very expensive like most of the food options on the pier.
author: Jessica W.

description: The service here is terrible. The waiter just served us water and not offer any other drinks. When I ordered calamari the waiter also forgot to tell the kitchen. The sushi rolls were also small.
author: Nicole A.

description:
DO NOT FUCKING EAT HERE. 

Would give this place a zero if I could. 

First off, this place was nearly empty when my boyfriend's family and I first walked in. The hostess asked us how many people and we said 14. The hostess told us that we're gonna have to wait Bc they didn't have a table for us. The wait was 45mins-1 hr long. We decided to wait anyways. 

Second, while waiting, some of us got a few drinks front the bar. IT SUCKED. All the drinks tasted funny. The bluemoon was VERY watered down. The blue Hawaiian tastes like water and orange juice. 

Third, while sitting at the bar, we noticed a group of 10 that came and got seated right away. Which surprised us because they said they didn't have seating a for a big party but that group had no reservations either and still got to sit.. then came a group of three.. then a couple groups of twos and they ALL got to sit before us. Curious, we asked the hostess if we could split up into small groups of 2's or 4's since we all came with our significant other anyways. She told us no. the wait would still be 45 mins to 1 hr. (Yes, we're literally confused at this point Bc there were so many empty tables at the front next to the bar and so many other empty seatings in the back.) 

Fourth, we finally got to our table. We were literally left there for almost 10-15 mins without any service provided to us. Someone finally came to take our orders. FINALLY. Funny, first restaurant ever that I've been served guest water without ANY trace of an ice cube. It was actually a little warm, not even room temperature. Which is odd. No straws were given to us by our waitress bc she seemed to be in a rush, so we asked another waitress walking by for some straws. (The girl with the blonde hair and black roots) literally gave us the FUCKING DIRTIEST LOOK I've ever been given by from a waitress my entire life and she didn't even respond to us. The whole night, she kept giving us dirty ass looks whenever we tried to get any fucking attention from anyone who fucking works there. We did eventually get the straws tho. 

Fifth, the waitress ASKED us how many miso soups we want. The way she said it was basically a fucking offer (sushi places tend to give free miso soup) which we ended up paying for. But fuck it.. they should be more clear next time. 

Sixth, the guy who brought out our food was ridiculous!! He held the food and called it out.. we couldn't even understand WHAT THE FUCK he was saying!! He literally mumbled everything. 

Seventh, the quality of the food.. yeah. For the long wait? Definitely not worth it. Go spend your money somewhere else. The quality sucked. And for the price of the food? Not worth it.

Eighth, the check came. Nearly $500 for shitty service and shitty food. 18% gratuity tips?? for what?? Ice without water?? A waitress that stares you down?? Everything was just fucking ridiculous. Also, we couldn't even split the check?! Bc apparently "a party can't split checks". 

In conclusion, worst fucking restaurant I've ever been to. This place need to mortgage for whatever they can and close their doors before they go bankrupt. Will never return here again. Don't recommend it. Save your money.
author: Jolene X.

description:
Probably one of my best places to go for Sushi. Friendly staff who remembers you and makes sure you and your guests are taken care of. Sushi is always fresh and served quickly. 
I recommend this place to those looking for quality sushi with creative menu items.
author: Xander C.

description: Really wanted a great view for dinner and that I got.  The restaurant is nicely decorated and upscale but the food is very average especially for the price. Should have read reviews before going in. Has huge potential but was disappointing.
author: Andy C.

description:
The location of this restaurant is nice. You get a very nice view of the ocean. My friends and I were outside looking at the menu and we decided to come in and try it out. I will admit, visiting San Fran, it's maybe not the best to go. I'm sure there better places. Overall the food wasn't too bad. It wasn't the best in the world but it wasn't that bad either. The service was decent. Could've been better. The  manager gave us a 20% discount which was very nice. It made the experience pleasant. Overall not a bad place to try out. 

-I got the chicken bento box and the chicken was really good. The tempura was a little bit oily and heavy.
author: Johnny C.

description: The food was delicious and the service was excellent. Ruben and Kayla, our waitstaff, made us feel so welcome and comfortable. Kept us smiling as they kept checking if we needed anything. I would recommend eating here anytime.
author: Jr D.

description: No wait when we walked in, awesome sushi! The fish tasted delicious and fresh. They were very accommodating when it came to a gluten intolerance issue I have. I would highly recommend making a stop here.
author: Dj K.

description:
I went with my family today. Service was little slow. Tempura udon was really not tasty compare price. Sushi was okay. Quick question! I asked a bill and she said she would close it for us so I gave my credit card. Weirdly, she already charged 18% tip when  I tried to sign on the bill. I asked her who served our table. She said this is normal custom that they do for New Year's Eve. Is this true? 
I never had this experience before. It may true but it would be better if they announce before I order food then I could understand because today was special day( New Year's Eve) This was uncomfortable either me or my family. I do not think I will go this place again.
author: Hane S.

description:
Terrible, cold food. All of our "hot" food came out cold, told our bartender/server and she took it back to get us "a new one" but watched her basically "heat it up" and I think their microwave was broken because the calamari was still cold. The bartender asked us how we were doing and we were honest in telling her it wasn't up to our expectations and we received no apology or attempt to get better service/food quality. 
Definitely our last! Not worth it at all. 
To end on a positive note tho, the place had a great view of the bay!!!
author: Ue Y.

description: For the price I wanted and expected so much more. Freaking tourist trap "Japanese" place peddling craptastic bento boxes, $9 glasses of basically boxed wine and sushi with flavorless rice. And to top it all off..they are expensive as hell, even for the touristy Pier 39 location.
author: Sean T.

description: Ok food but terrible service. It was not even busy. I didn't even the server's name. No greeting. Just a "ready to order?" Brought our food and then didn't ask if we were done or if we wanted a desert menu. Came by and dropped the check, said thank you with no eye contact. He talked to the other table just not us. Tip is already included in the check so maybe there was no incentive of being nice. Second time here. Our first experience was was way better.
author: Ashwin P.

description: You pay too much money ! It didn't worth it at all! The view is nice but the fish not fresh and the waiting is too long, not tasty and don't worth the money!!! Pay  attentions they  add automatically gratitude!!!!!
author: Natali S.

description: This sushi joint was okay. The food was alright, but the service was just awful. We had 4 people and they couldn't split the check 4 ways. Very inconvenient. The server also hid in the back the entire time. No refills or anything on our drinks. Will not be back.
author: Savannah B.

description: Food wasn't very fresh or tasteful, service wasn't very good. Rolls were mostly rice. Soggy rolls.
author: Evan D.

description: The food was fine. Typical sushi prepared fairly well. The real problem was lack of service. Through understaffing or incompetence, the service was SLOW!  Especially towards high school students with vouchers. After being ignored for 45 minutes and confusion over what the voucher provided, I and another teacher had to intervene (we had been eating separately). Just unprofessional and rude.
author: Sarah O.

description: Ate lunch on weekday here on Pier 39 to test where we might eat with future visitors. Hana Zen needs to improve their food quality for the price. Sashimi and Nigiri with rice. Both items tastes okay, similar to that of Japanese buffet restaurant (previously frozen fish?, un-vinegar rice, plain round grain rice?). Not in same class as Japan town restaurants or Hana, Hawaii. I think the table views in Hana Zen at the end of pier 39 is what one comes here for and not for the food. Service was a little slow, but maybe okay so one can enjoy the view of the bay.
author: Clifford W.

description:
We were in town and originally going to eat at the restaurant next door, and when we went in, we were completely ignored. So we tried Hana Zen. 

It was about 1 pm on a Saturday, and we were one of only a couple tables. We were seated immediately, with a wonderful view of the bay and the bridge (as my boyfriend had never been to San Francisco before and our trip was short) - it was perfect. We ordered some sushi, and split the hot lava rock appetizer/entree - we chose steak. It thirty dollar, but the steak that came out was a decent size, and neither of us had eaten anything of a lava rock before, so we were excite for the experience. When the steak came out, it was nicely seared on one side, raw on the top, and it allowed my boyfriend to eat steak rare as rare can be, and me to eat my half dead and cooked (medium well). The lava rock steak was delicious. Our sushi was good, and on par with other sushi we've had here at home - delicious and tasty, and we had no problems with the quality or the ingredients. 

Our waitstaff was prompt and incredibly nice, and we loved the experience here so much that we found and purchased lava cooking rocks to use at home. We tried them, and I'm not sure how our process was different than Hana Zen's, but my half of the steak was much more difficult to get to the desired done-ness (it could be that their rock was hotter than my home over gets - as most home ovens max out at 550, and the directions were to heat the stones to 540 - 650 degrees). 

Eating here helped make our short 12 hours in San Francisco much more memorable and enjoyable. I'd definitely return the next time I'm in town.
author: Karyn S.

description: Hope I can give 0 stars ! They just care about the tables & pax. Me & wife went on Sunday evening they have approve our request for sea side/ window facing table. But once we settled there waited almost 20 minutes just wondering some one will help us with food/drinks. No one showed up !!!! To my surprise 3 people were continuously helping opposite dinner !!!!! Really pathetic. Disappointed better go with Pax of 10 they will be happy help you on weekends. Don't know about weekdays, but service is pathetic .
author: Ankik B.

description:
Wonderful!  I was alone on Pier 39, having just had a delicious bowl of soup in a breadbowl, and I realized it had somehow become 1pm and I had yet to have any alcohol--how does that even happen!

I ended up Hana Zen and it was perfect! Beautiful views of the golden gate bridge and alcatraz, so I felt like I was being a good tourist. Plus, their house chardonnay was $6 and superb.

I should add that by the time I was ready to eat, I decided to order one of the happy hour bites. I ordered fried edamame, which I thought would be like regular edamame with a little panko topping or something.

It was these deep fried dough nuggets--wayy too heavy for what I was looking for. If I wanted 5,000 calories in one sitting I obviously would have gotten the garlic fries. Oh, well, that was my bad.
author: Marissa K.

description:
While hanging out at Pier 39, stopped to check the menu outside and decided to try Sushi role. View is great, service was fine, but the sushi roles....what a disappointment. I would not recommend anyone to try sushi here. They looked dry and old and tasted the same. My wife went with Hot Lava Rock - Asian Chicken. It was a raw Chicken breast served on 500 degree stone. You have to cook it to your taste on the stone. Interesting concept and but not something I would try again. We had also ordered the Goma-ae  (spinach salad), was ok but not worth coming back for. The two stars are for the view and the service, no star for food.

#onetimer ; #touristtrap
author: Ash A.

description: Ok so imagine how disappointed your parents are in you that's how disappointed I was in this restaurant. To start if I could give zero stars I would. My friends and I arrived at this restaurant and another friend group from our school and we were the only ones there.  The lady seated us after like 5 minutes but refused to just simply push two tables together for 8 people.  It took 20 minutes to just get water. The other table got there order taken while we had gotten there first and was neglected. They only had one waiter, but there was no one else in the restaurant and the hostess, bus boy, bar attendant, and various employees were drinking coffee and doing nothing but talking to each other. I had to get up and ask, finally we got our order taken after 30+ minutes of waiting then it took over and hour to get my food a, sloppy salmon avocado roll and just white rice.  The food tasted ok, not great.  Would not come here again. Was the worst thing about San Francisco. For such a nice view of the ocean (end of peir 39) the food service, and overall atmosphere was atrocious.
author: Lisa R.

description: Delicious sushi options, made fresh, with an incredible view of Alcatraz and the Bay. I recommend going at sunset.
author: Sara R.

description: Service was terrible, mainly because they were understaffed and the kitchen couldn't get their act together. We had a group of 5 and the half Dungeness crab I ordered ended up coming out AFTER my entire group has already eaten. Again, this is nothing on the waitress because she kept following up with the kitchen on why the food wasn't there; this is the fault of the kitchen. Don't go here if you want expensive, mediocre food.
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
We waited an entire hour after ordering for our food to come. My friend and I ordered a chicken bento and salmon bento. About 30 minutes in, I asked the waiter the approximate waiting time, he asked what our order was again (had they forgotten?). About 40 minutes in, I asked when the food was going to come and the waiter said it was coming soon. About 50 minutes in, I asked again. They said they had a problem with their kitchen. They wait until we've waited almost an hour for the food to tell us this when we could have left and went to a different location.

The food finally came. The chicken of the chicken bento tasted bland and possibly microwaved. The tempura. Wait, there was no tempura. There were boiled vegetables. If you look up any Hana Zen bento, you'll notice fried tempura. However, when I questioned the waiter about this, he said 'that's how the bento is made'. Sure.

Here's the bento they served us. No more words needed.
author: V L.

description: Restroom was filthy with no toilet paper at all.  Food took about 25-30 minutes and somehow came out cold. Only the rice was warm.  Waiter never once checked on us.  He passed us several times, and never asked how we were or refilled our drinks. He asked about the drinks when we asked for the check. When I told him about him passing us over- not once did apologize.  Terrible experience.
author: Andrew B.

description:
There was no wait to be seated right at a window that had a view of the Golden Gate Bridge & Alcatraz! The service was a tad slow because it was busy during fleet week and pretty understaffed. However, the server kid was super nice & very accommodating!

It took a little while for our rolls to come out, but they were worth the wait. They were very fresh & tasty, and although they were small, I would definitely come here again!

The view is awesome, and it is a tourist area.. Well worth stopping in to check it out!
author: Denise F.

description:
Super bad service , we ordered wine , and there was something inside the glass so we asked to replace it , guess what sever replaced the wine but this time someone's lipstick was on the glass , we asked server to change the glass , he was jumping like monkey here and there couldn't understand our ask , may be he got frustrated on himself , like how many times he is going to screw this , since he didt understand our request to change the glass so we were waiting and waiting and after 20 mins we asked for bottled beer , because at this point that would be the safest option , food came super late , and again server served without proper silverware , overall me and my gf had horrible experience , I actually apologized my gf to bring her to this horrible restaurant , won't come here again. But I still
Gave the sever 5$ tip out of kindness .
author: Pradeep K.

description: Despite many unfavourable reviews, I thought we would try this place for our part dinner in San Fran. The family had already said Sushi is a must and we were in the area. I liked the scenic location at the end of Pier 39. Service was excellent and the sushi was great. My son and I had the lava stone dinners. My wife and daughter loved their sushi.
author: John E.

description:
Vegan review: 

Since bubba gump had a long line around 5pm on a Saturday, we chose this spot. 

We were able to get a window seat and had a fabulous view of the golden gate and Alcatraz. People watching was fun too since you're on the second floor. 

I ordered an avocado roll, mixed veggie roll and miso soup. I liked it, but honestly it's hard to mess up a fresh veggie roll. The veggies were fresh and the portions were on the average size. 

Parents ordered the chicken teriyaki plate while my brother had speciality rolls. 

My moms chicken was cold and had it sent back. My dads chicken was lukewarm, but he was too hungry to wait for a new plate. 

Our server was polite, but we had a hard time finding her when we needed help or a refill. 

And price wise, for 4 we were looking at a $100+ bill, but its pier 39 so it was expected.
author: Kimberly M.

description: The sushi here was definitely amazing. Some of the best ever. The food gets a rating of 5 but the customer service is what brought it down to a 4. We were seated at the bar (which was fine) because the downstairs was full. No one came to offer us drinks for 10-15 minutes after we sat down. Our food took a little longer then expected, but once we got our food no one came over to ask us how we were doing or to give us drink refills. Once we were finished eating, no one came over with our check until we waved someone down. Not impressed with the service at all but the food was so freaking yummy.
author: Rebecca W.

description: We came here because they said they had uni, they told us it was one price (~$9) for nigiri (2 pieces per order), and we were already on the pier. So we decided to stay to get appetizers before our main meal at Crab House. When the check came, it was another price... DOUBLE what they said. So our appetizers and drinks, after they grat'ed us, was as much as an entire meal. Never again.
author: Adrienne T.

description: Not worth what I paid. They added more money on the the total and you weren't allowed to write your own tip. Would not recommend
author: Anna N.

description: Went here for New Years Eve. Service was bad and food was mediocre. The music/band was pretty good.
author: Kyle D.

description: Terrible place to eat. Except for the view, terrible service- waited on the table for 10 mins for someone to come over, found a piece hair on my place, fish were not fresh, and sushi rice was not done appropriate. Don't recommend at all.
author: Nicole S.

description: The only redeeming quality of this place was the food. The sushi was very good. Sushi shop seemed experienced and the product was delivered as advertised. Unfortunately I can't say the same for any other aspect of the experience. Service staff was slow and clearly had not been trained on proper service etiquette. The hostess spent half her time sitting down on her cell phone, and the bartender spent most of his time back by the waitstation/dishwashing area and service staff. Such a waste of prime real estate - beautiful views of the bay and of Alcatraz but not worth the price of admission. There are far better sushi restaurants in the city. Find one!
author: Ric O.

description:
Good place for a beautiful view.
Don't expect much in service. Food was meh-
For whatever reason the fried stuff was super oily. Leike dripping in oil.
Honestly I would return again but maybe only for a beer if that.
Service was painfully slow.
author: Yvonne C.

description: Bubba Gump's wait was over an hour and we didn't want to wait so we tried this place. Bad decision. It looks nice inside and the view was nice but the food was horrible. We order a Philadelphia roll, ahi tuna steak, and garlic noodles. The rice in the roll was hard and undercooked. The tuna steak was really dry with no flavor, and the sauce it came with on the side was watered down. The best dish was probably the garlic noodles but even then it was way too garlic-y. For the price of this place the food wasn't worth it; even if it was cheaper it still wouldn't be worth it. Both tables next to us also had their orders mixed up. Try a different restaurant on pier!
author: Kimmy L.

description: Awful service! If you don't want wait your order for infinity and then get not what you ordered you shouldn't go there. We went there only because Bubba Gump waiting line was for 30 min and we'd rather wait then spent money and time at this "restaurant"
author: Maria M.

description: Wonderful Sushi. Overlooking the bay, fresh and delicious. Try the Lion King roll, you will enjoy it thoroughly.
author: Diane S.

description:
Amazing Japanese food and the most stunning views on the Pier! I love coming here, especially on a beautiful clear day, to take in the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz while I eat and relax. My favorite things to order are the Hamachi Kama, Fresh oysters, Martini Scallops, Agedashi Tofu, any of the teriyakis and the Sunset Strip roll. The food is always hot and delicious and the sushi is fresh and spot on. The menu has great variety, so I can always find something that I love. 

In addition to the amazing views of the bay, the restaurant itself is very spacious and open. Great for a casual lunch with friends, but it can also accommodate large parties for a special event. The entire side of the restaurant is lined with large windows to let the light in, so everyone has a sweet seat in the house.

Whether you're a tourist or a local, this is a must see stop on the pier!
author: Erica L.

description:
I don't even know where to start! Service is terrible! Do not go here unless you want a pretty view! You will wait for anyone to acknowledge you for a long time, and the food will take triple that amount to come out! There were 5 of us who went here and we were all starving! San Francisco is supposed to have some of the best food around let alone sushi! This place is mediocre at its best! My mother in laws rice had a long hair in it and she didn't realize it until it was in her mouth, yuck! My sushi rolls -Safeway makes better! It seems like they are very short staffed! 
But the view is pretty however not worth the headache!
author: A E.

description: We came at a really good time because it was a weekday and we were the second ones there. Have been here once before and I remember liking the food. Got a great view of the bay. Everything we ordered was fresh and really good portions. I had the chicken bento box and it was very filling. Also ordered the lion king roll which was really good too. Our waters were always refilled. It can be a little pricey, but it's Pier 39. I would rather spend the money here and get great tasting food than pay the same price for mediocre food. Would definitely recommend and come back again for a first class view and tasty food.
author: Sherille S.

description: Just dined here, literally 5 minutes ago.  Waited 15 minutes after we sat in the "bar area" until we had to wave down a server/bartender.  The restaurant was borderline empty.  We didn't even have a happy hour menu yet.  But we are a patient group, so we stuck around and had he host get us a menu.  Had to re-wave down the bartender to order our food.  She was in the midst of some other responsibility, and began to "explain the situation to us...?" until the owner of the restaurant came up to us and offered to take our order. And this was after another 10 or 15 minutes.  Food came out promptly.  Food was great.  However, once we were about to close out, my card was charged to another table...so I was charged about double what I owed + gratuity.  I noticed the bill was off, so I pointed out to the bartender that I was charged wrong.  I waited another 10 minutes for the charged check to be voided and then re charged the appropriate amount.  I was patient.  I understand these things happen.  Because of the inconvenience, the bartender told me that she took off the "required gratuity" we were originally being charged for parties of 6+.  I thanked her, signed the new check, and I walked outside while waiting for the rest of my party to meet me outside.  It should have ended there.  She had the nerve to approach my group, have them call me back inside, and re-apply the "required gratuity" (which was like $2 more dollars to make it a complete 18%) with the justification that "it covers the real estate of groups of 6 or more."  And that's why I am giving 1 star.  This was unprofessional.  It was a horrible experience from the beginning, and we had tried to be understanding of the situation, but pursuing a customer and going back on your word to get about $2 out of them?  Re examine your staffs morales or ethics. If we had been comp'd any items because of these inconveniences, delays, poor service, I would have tipped more because that's what is considered a "create & keep" customer scenario.  We do not plan on coming back.
author: Kris E.

description: Came in because today is super hot we figured fresh sushi would be good. I must agree with other yelpers that service was super slow. Other people around us were also complaining. Place was almost full and they only had like 2 people working. Food was average nothing special. We got rainbow roll and dragon roll and a few sushi pieces. Management needs to plan labor batter and work on speeding up service to increase sales. It's has great potential but service is just terrible. Won't be back and I'm sure I'm not the only one. Tourism is only thing that will keep it open.
author: Juan S.

description: Exceptionally slow service. It took 20 minutes before being asked what we wanted to drink and that was the pleasant part. Further, food was decent at best. At least the parts of our meal we received.
author: Auralina B.

description:
Went here right before the airshow was going to begin for Fleet Week.
They weren't that busy when we got there, 12:15, prime lunch time.

They have a bar just FYI since they don't have drinks listed on the menu outside.
You walk in & the hostess seats you.
We requested to be seated by the window.

I saw several TVs but none were on.

The view is right at the waterfront so it could be romantical! Sure.

we ordered an Anchor Steam.
We also ordered the Yasai Tempura Moriawase which is pretty much vegetable tempura with some sauteed vegetables. Tempura - sweet potatoes, carrot, cucumber, squash.
It was good but how can you go wrong with tempura, I mean let's be serious.

I felt really rushed by the staff.
By our waitress & what looked like was the owner. She was dressed in an actual dress as oppose to a waitress looking apparel. Just sayin'
It takes me a long time to drink a beer, especially when I'm trying to avoid getting bloated, LADIES, you feel me?!

The woman in the dress (I assume the owner) went to our table & looked at the bill that was on our table but we weren't ready to pay yet.... then rudely asked for me to hand her the menu that was by me. Verbatim; "Can you hand me the menu?" RUDE! Can't even squeeze a please in there? SMDH.

I didn't even finish my beer because I felt like they were just trying to get us out of there.
When we were leaving, the owner or whatever she was asked if we were helped. I didn't understand it until my friend told me that the only reason that lady asked us that was because she probably thought we were dining & ditching. PLEASE! I can afford to pay for my food. 

If you ask me, if it wasn't for their waterfront view location there wouldn't be any traffic here.

I would suggest getting yourself a pretzel downstairs. You'll be plenty more satisfied with less interaction with rude staff.

Negative rant OFF.
author: Camille C.

description:
Everything was fresh, dishes looked well constructed but portions were very small for the price you pay. Servers are poorly trained and it takes forever to get your food. We were about ready to walk out right as they brought our main dishes. 

I had the Tonkatsu, it was good, just disappointing over the portion size. 

I also had the Tempora Dynamite Roll, it was small and overly seasoned with the spicy sauce soo much that I couldn't taste the actual roll. 

The only reason this place is getting two stars is because the food was fresh (for my dishes) and the view was nice.  

My dining partner ordered the Salmon Bento Box and his salmon was awful and dry.
author: Sarah M.

description: First time here and I decided to order the Hana Zen Roll. It was pretty bomb from my first try having tempura style salmon in a roll. My honest opinion is that it's a bit pricey and they wait is unbearable! it took about an hour for my party's food to all come out and have there were only five of us. would only come back if it was a last resort.
author: Justus T.

description: We stopped in for lunch, and with it being so empty we should have known to move on. Our party of 5 waited more than 15 minutes after being seated and no one stopped by, even just to check on us. We were in a bit of a hurry so, after waiting so long without any service, we stopped at the sushi bar to check if we could get a few pieces for our daughter, to go. They said they were way too busy (though less than 20% occupied) and were too far behind to prepare 6 pieces of nigiri to go. Move on, even if you see they have room for you.
author: Sean M.

description: Nastiest place would  give negative stars if I had too!! Please do yourself a favor and don't eat here. Staff is horrible. Lady with the blond hair and black eyeshadow was rude and didn't let up order two calamaris
author: Cindy S.

description:
My boyfriend and I were here twice on Sunday (during fleet week) and we enjoyed it quite a bit. Mind you, we only experienced the bar area and 1 bartender. 

First time around, was a quick visit actually. My BF ordered a cucumber martini (might have a different name on the menu) and I actually didn't order anything. The drink could have been a little stronger! And the poor bartender had to run off to the kitchen to pick up a cucumber. Took a little while to get it done  but it was an OK drink. 

We came back after the Blue Angels flew and we ordered a round of sake bombs....4 rounds later we figured we'd close out tab and continue our day. Low and behold, 4 was the perfect amount because we both got pretty buzzed! Haha. $80 tab though! Eeks, wasn't expecting that and I'm not sure how $8.95 sake bombs compare to other restaurants. Regardless, we didn't mind paying because my BF and I rarely drink like that alone and we were truly enjoying our weekend off. 

Didn't catch the bartenders name but he was quite friendly and made small talk with us. Oh, even took pictures for us when I asked. Young, slim guy. Thanks!
author: Sherly M.

description:
This is restaurant is really good for parties, a great view of Alcatraz, and is deep in the heart of Pier 39! Although all of that sounds good, I'll go into more details below:

LOCATION:
As mentioned the location is great. In the back of Pier 39, so while you're on your wall to the restaurant you can stop inside of shops of the greatest tourist attractions in SF. While you're eating you have an amazing view of Alcatraz. 

RESTAURANT:
The restaurant looks amazing once you're inside, great ambiance to it. I made this a tip as well, but make sure to bring a jacket because it will definitely be cold on the inside. So have something to bundle up in. 

FOOD:
I'm a really big Sushi fan, and this sushi is very delicious, rolls are rolled tied with some very strong sticky rice: but the rolls are just small for what you're paying for. Luckily I had a 20% discount or my tab would have been $61.52 but it ended up being around $51. The rolls are very small, but are very good and is rolled perfectly. 

I'm not sure if I recommend this place or not.
author: Andre L.

description: The view here is spectacular. Looks out over the water at Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz. The ambiance is awesome. What truly makes this place a gem is the staff and the sushi. I have had sushi 3 times this week. My girl and I consider our self Sushi-aholics. This place is up at the top of this list. Do yourself a favor and go to the end of pier 39 and find your Zen.
author: Joshua K.

description: I waited for 45 min only for the asian hostess to tell me that we couldnt eat here. On top of that she gave us an attitude talking to us. Ill never come back.
author: Cella S.

description: We went here on a Sunday night around 8pm. Tables were available, but a decent amount of patrons. The bar tender was also the only waiter. He was literally running at times. Because he was the only one, service was slow. He was very polite though, and apologetic at times. He got our drink order wrong (just two beers), but we got the incorrect drinks for free in addition to the corrected order. The two sushi rolls we ordered were good, but nothing on the menu (or the taste of the rolls we ordered) really stood out from any run of the mill cheap sushi restaurant. Honestly, our grocery store sushi in Michigan is better. I wouldn't eat here again considering how many other options there are on the wharf.
author: Christopher W.

description:
Take away the view of this restaurant and it will be average which is why I'm rating it average. The restaurant itself is nothing special. Customer service was okay and the food was average as well.

I got the spicy tuna roll and salmon & avocado roll and it satisfies me. There was no "wow" factor whatsoever. I'd suggest dipping your sushi in soy sauce mixed with a bit of wasabi! Also don't forget to eat ginger between sushi so that it doesn't taste the same. That's why the ginger was placed there - to cleanse your palate so they all don't taste the same.

If you park in Pier 39 parking garage, make sure to validate your parking ticket from the host/hostess!
author: Aj C.

description: Definitely one of the worst sushi places I have ever been. We waited 2 hours and no ones rolls had arrived. The sushi was all rice and rice was overcooked. The waitress was rude and everytime we asked for something the waitress would ignore it. People were so fed up that they were just getting up and leaving after their drinks arrived. Horrible service.
author: Chris T.

description: The view is amazing, but food wasn't very good at all, bad service, you can tell edamame is from the freezer, we waited 15 minutes just to get our drinks when the place is empty. Will not be coming back.
author: Shelley C.

description:
1. Took my reservation but when I arrived they said I didn't make a reservation...what?
2.Slow waiters who ignore you even after making eye contact
3. 20 minutes in and didn't even ask for drinks
4. Practically empty when we arrived so I don't know why it took forever
5. Rice and chopsticks on the floor that no one took care of  before seating a party
(*We left before ordering anything)
author: Lydia Z.

description:
Total time from entering and exiting- 90 minutes

Waiting on waiter to input order: 30 minutes

Waiting on food to arrive (2 sushi rolls): 30 minutes 

Time in eating food: 15 minutes 

Waiting to pay for food: 15 minutes 

Overall Food Quality: Worse than Panda Express

Total Amount with tax and tip: 40$ (2 rolls and tea)

Will you come back again? If I was gunpoint and forced to.
author: Toan C.

description:
Where do I start? We were in SF for the 4th of July weekend and wanted to go back to a place we have gone before. Hana Zen Sushi was on our minds. Our last visit with them was amazing, the food was great and the service was spot on. 

Monday late afternoon we decided that sushi was going to be our dinner. Upon arriving to this establishment there was a line of a few people. Good sign to see people wanting to eat here. Waited our turn and was seated at a tiny little table. In my mind I'm thinking where were we gonna put all of our dishes as we like to order everything on the menu to try. Ok well not everything but more than any normal human should. What can I say we are foodies and we love to try stuff. 

We sat at a table made for a party of one for a few minutes and I decided to ask the waiter to see if we can move to the table behind us since it was much bigger. We ended moving to the bigger table. Waiter came and asked for our order. Everything still copastetic until we get our "food."
I ordered a 15 piece sashimi meal and my GF order beef teriyaki with a side of sashimi. 

Food comes out and I look at it, this is a $35 plate of sashimi? Where's my rice, miso and salad? Well guess what? My "meal" doesn't come with any of those side that normally come with it at any other Japanese establishment. Ok it's SF and you pay top dollar for mediocre food, but at least give me what should be defined as a meal. Asked the waiter for some miso and rice, I also asked him if a salad comes with the meal. He said no salad comes with any meal. Ok fine I guess I should have expected, what was I thinking? Soup annnnnnnd salad? 

The quality of the sashimi was ehhhhhh. Some pieces were fresh some were not. The salmon tasted like it was frozen, thawed, frozen, then thawed again. I know what fresh salmon should taste like because I have eaten so much salmon I could literally poop it out and reconstruct a whole school of them. Tuna seemed much better as was the scallops. 

Seeing that my meal was incomplete I decided to order a beef teriyaki meal to give it a go. 
Take 1:  Disappointing, beef was like something out of a movie prop. Looked tasty but inedible, I've had beef jerky more tender than this. When did they starting make beef teriyaki flavored gum? Waiter asked if it was ok and I expressed my disappointment. He takes it back and a few minutes later another server brings out another order.  

Take 2: See Take 1 - Yup it's that bad

Well to make this long story short we finished what we could and ask for the bill, hmmm a SF healthy charge? Nice, we eat, we give you money, then we give you more money so you can pay for YOUR employees' health benefits. How about giving them more pay so they can actually live in the city they work. Food for thought mini ramble. What has this city become...

Well me being me I pull up the health inspection of this place. I was pretty shocked at what I saw. Here a little bonus for the curious minds....
author: Truth H.

description:
My last visit was a while ago, and this review is way overdue haha.

The view here is absolutely stellar, and make sure to get seated by the windows for prime spots! I like to bring my visiting friends over here occasionally to catch up and drink as well. This place is definitely a casual venue with a plethora of seating and plenty of space to relax. 

My top choices are the tempura udon and I always make sure to ask the supervisor, Victor Tellez for the best sushi options.
