He's extremely knowledgeable about japanese cuisine and takes the time to understand what you would like the most out of the rolls served here. He is attentive and has the best customer service! 
Many people don't understand the stress of being a server or working in the customer service industry, and I swear, Victor never fails. Thank you for being so great :)
author: Helen C.

description:
Ripped off!

My husband is of Japanese decent and we have patronized many restaurants throughout California. The view was nice but the food comparable to a food court. 
There were four of us - three ordered Chicken/Tempura Bento boxes $19 and I ordered a Sushi Tempura Roll $12.
The chicken was undercooked thigh meat with fatty skin and the salad was mixed greens with a dressing that was undesirable. 
I was expecting my roll to be spread out on a sushi plate with a presentation but it was a half of a roll that were the size of a nickel.
author: Annie H.

description: Very pricey, Very bad Japanese food. The Sashimi combination was ok, the fresh oyster had a weird taste so I guess they were not that fresh. We also ordered two sushi rolls which were absolutely terrible.
author: Zesi C.

description: I should have read the reviews before me and my husband came here. The sushi is POOR. The meals for the prices are ridiculous. The bento box had the price of $14.95 but had been written over in pen to say $19.95. I ask the waitress what the real price is she says uuuhhhhh $19. I'm like really ... my husband ordered a roll for $15 and it only came with 4 pieces and it tasted like nothing! The soy sauce even tasted like water. Don't eat here! It's too high and you get bird portions of food. There's better sushi places in frisco. This place sucks ass.
author: La'Tia S.

description:
There are few times in life where you can enjoy delicious Sushi, friendly staff, and a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge and the Alcatraz together under the same roof.  

I ordered the LionKingRoll and a Lemonade; 
Sushi was perfect, great taste and a delightful presentation. The Lemonade was on point not too sweet and not too bitter, it was just right. 
Price; within budget! What else can you ask for !??
author: Luis S.

description: Very disappointing this place, that's perhaps why there was a lot of open tables during the busiest time of the year (39th Anniversary of Pier 39). Our waitress was very aggressive and was quick for us to order. She first told us that the kitchen was going to take a long time to get out hot items so that we should probably order sushi, but she said it in the most round about way that it kind of threw us off. The food was satisfactory but pretty over priced seeing as it was Pier 39. I had regular rolls with fresh fish and it tasted pretty salty (no soy sauce was on the rolls). I would not suggest this restaurant unless you're really hungry.
author: Moriamo S.

description: Got seated quickly, Had Great service, & really good sushi ! Recommend the philly roll and the fried calamari. Also the window seating is amazing, my boyfriend and I had the perfect view of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge
author: Kaila B.

description:
We stopped at Hana Zen to kill some time before taking the ferry back to Vallejo. We were walking around the 2nd deck of Pier 39 when I recognized the place (from Viewpon.tv..kinda like Groupon). I will say what really caught our attention was the happy hour from 2pm-6pm! We looked at our watches and went inside. 

The bartender was really friendly and attentive. She provided us with happy hour menus and left us alone to decide (instead of annoyingly hovering). We ended up getting a strawberry margarita ($6), beer ($4), calamari ($5), & spicy tuna roll ($5). 

While our order was being placed, we just sat back and stared out the window! The view from the restaurant is fantastic and you have a great view of Alcatraz! The drinks were great and margarita was potent! The food followed shortly behind.. The calamari was different (yet good) because it has some diced dried seaweed on it! The spicy tuna roll was tasty and fresh! 

Overall, this is a great hidden happy hour gem on Pier 39! I'd definitely go back again!
author: Kory R.

description: Very slow service although it wasn't busy at all. All the food that came out was super cold, even the deep fried sushi which it's supposed to be sizzling out the frier. (We literally saw the server carry our food around to other tables THREE times went back to the kitchen and finally gave it to us, no wonder why it was so damn cold) The chicken was gooey, the tempura veggies were soggy and cold and the sushi was not fresh.  The prices are way too high for such sucky service and mediocre food. I do not recommend this place at all.
author: Chelli I.

description: Waitress was amazing Camila the food could have been better but it was a good experience
author: Jesse G.

description:
Upon entering, I wasn't expecting a host of vegetarian options, but asked for a menu anyway and was surprised when I saw quite a few.

The atmosphere is nice and full of variety, representative of its eclectic Pier 39 surroundings. Even for what should have been a busy lunch hour on a Saturday, the place wasn't too crowded, and I didn't see out-of-control kids running around all over the place. From where my wife and I sat, we could see the golden gate bridge, which was a really nice treat.

I ordered the tofu steak as an appetizer (which was DELICOUS I might add), and enjoyed garlic noodles afterward. Normally I'd do with a bit of cheese on noodles, but these were flavored just right so I didn't need cheese.

The prices weren't cheap, but neither were they terrible, especially for such a spacious, touristy place with great views of the bay. I'd visit again!
author: Andy H.

description:
Thank goodness we walked all the way to the end of pier 39! 

We were very hungry on Sunday and all the restaurants on pier 39 were at least 30-45 minute waits. Just as we were about to give up, we decide to see what was on the second floor. At the very end we came across this empty, Japanese restaurant. It was a sign.

We were seated immediately and at a window right next to the ocean. You really can't beat a view like that while you're enjoying your chicken teriyaki and sake. 

The pricing was a bit higher than most Japanese places I'm use to, but it was delicious. The space is very open and bright. Our waiter was awesome and of course I forgot his name. :(
author: April T.

description: 1) very warm beer 2) under cooked, hard sushi rice 3) the fried rice was fishy 4) the tempura was soggy 5) ponzu tasted like water 6) one of our meals came after the rest of us had finished 7) kids drink served in a coffee cup 8) girls restroom no toilet papet 9) mens restroom toilet paper roll on floor
author: Lee R.

description: Have never been such an awful Sushi bar where ur order is placed when u come to pick up it!!! Now i see why they have three stars!!!
author: Navfal A.

description:
Terrible food- 

sushi rolls: literally tasted rancid- one person at our table said the sushi at raleys was better than that:

half crab + garlic noodle: poorly presented, cold, and didn't taste great 

kids bento: tempura shrimp soggy and soft. asked for a replacement which they happily obliged- still lacked crunch. 

teriyaki chicken entree: look, the chicken was nice... but for $20 it was such a basic meal, it looked like something you would get from a mall food court or an airplane. 

The servers were nice but reallllly lacked personality, and just seemed a bit slow. 

This place is in such a great location, but either lower your prices, or get some new staff.
author: Emma G.

description: Went there this afternoon after my grandsons baptism. We had a party of 20 and Angie took very good care of us! I had family visiting from Orange County and they loved it! Everyone was pleased with their order and our server, Mylee took everyone's orders without writing anything down! She did not make one mistake on any of our orders, I am so pleased to have chosen Hana Zen! My family is already talking about our next visit here! Thank you for making our blessed day complete!
author: Robin O.

description:
I ordered an ahi tuna salad.  Menu said it came with rice noodles but they said we didn't know how to read the menu.   

We finally got rice noodles after I finished the half portion of the salad they gave me. 

The kids sushi was pre made,  the rice was dry,  I could buy the same at Trader joe's.
author: Philip C.

description:
Went here about a month ago with a friend of mine. The thought of sushi sounded good to me so I ordered a couple different rolls (I can't remember what they were now). My friend ordered chicken teriyaki and veggies. (Why can I remember her meal and not my own? I guess the beer I had with my meal really messed me up!) Anyway, the place was pretty empty at the time - around 4pm - as not many people eat meals then. We got a seat next to the windows so we can look outside to the ocean and also people watch. 

Our server was nice but I didn't feel like the food was anything to write home about. (hence why I'm writing this review a month later) Would I go again? Maybe so.
author: Wesley H.

description:
I would give this place no stars if i could. I wish i would've checked the yelp page before coming in to be aware of the health conditions. 

My group of 5 friends got seated right away. One ordered chicken bento with a substitute of avocado sushi instead of cali roll and the other got soba. 

The chicken bento sushi substitute was mistaken for extra cali roll so that was the first mistake. The second mistake was the bento coming out with the correct order AND an extra plate of avocado roll.

My friend who ordered the soba did not get his until 40 minutes after everybody else. I had the same order as him with a side of tempura and i still received my first. He even was the second person to order and guess the waiter did not write his order down at all because he looked surprised when he stated he didnt get his order. 

Never trying this place again with the poor food inspection review and the poor service.
author: Vanessa D.

description:
I had a horrible experience here on 12/26/16. First, the restaurant is freezing. 

Second, the service was bad. They brought my girlfriend's meal out 10 minutes after ordering, no problem there. But her meal - garlic noodles with shrimp tempura - was underwhelming. It was basically spaghetti with two small pieces of shrimp. Anyway, she finished her meal (she's a slow ester) well before the rest of us had been served. After about 45 minutes, the waiter finally brought us our sushi. Waiter did not bring out soy sauce, so I gave him a few minutes, let him pass our table a couple times, then finally gave up and walked over to a recently vacated table to grab a bottle of soy sauce on my own. We also noticed the table next to us complaining about the service - sounded like they ordered something and were charged for it despite the fact that the waiter never brought out the food. Manager/owner came to "mediate" but just stood there as the waiter argued with the customer over whether the dish was really served. The customer got tired of arguing and finally just said, forget it, just run the card so we can get out of here. Very uncomfortable. 

Finally, the food was bad. The sushi was tasteless, the rice must have been a day old (stale and clumpy), and the fish just did not seem to be sushi-grade. Oh, and I got FOOD POISONING. Will not be returning here ever and will be surprised if this place is still in business a year from now.
author: M S.

description:
No. No. No. This place is awful. Looks elegant on the inside, has an amazing view, but don't let that fool you! 

First, upon walking in to this tourist trap, their hostess was slow to acknowledge both I and subsequent patrons with a few even walking away in frustration.

Everyone has their own palates, but for me, their nigiri sushi tasted like supermarket sushi that has been sitting out festering for a few hours and now, I'm highly concerned that it could be a long night later..

They also have this gimmick where you cook your own meats on a hot 500° rock, and they tried passing off a skirt steak (fajita meat) to someone at our table for a filet mignon. Can you possibly insult your patrons any more by trying to pull off this scam?? Also, the vegetables that accompany the dish had zero seasoning on it and could be likened to eating tap water with a fork.

On Yelp looking for nearby dinner ideas? Then for the price you're paying here, do yourself a favor and tighten the laces on your shoes and walk a few blocks away from the embarcadero and find someplace else... any place else.
author: Javi D.

description:
The only reason why this place even gets 1 star is because of the view. I don't really write reviews but I felt compelled to do so for this place. 

My boyfriend and I came here for happy hour. Our first impression? It was pretty bad, there were flies everywhere in he bar area. We ordered the spicy tuna roll and chicken karaage, and for drinks we ordered a pomegranate margarita and a lychee rendezvous. The spicy tuna roll was, first of all, mostly rice, and the tuna wasn't even spicy. The chicken karaage was literally just cut up chicken marinated with salty teriyaki dipped in dough and deep fried. Definitely not worth the $6 we paid for the roll and the $7 we paid for the karaage.

The drinks? They were watered down and pretty much tasteless. The pomegranate margarita was just watered down pomegranate juice with cheap tequila and some lime juice, not worth the $7 we paid for it. The lychee rendezvous just tasted like water with a hint of infused lychee...the only redeeming quality was that the bartender muddled one real lychee into the drink - but still not worth $7. 

And as if the flies weren't bad enough, we saw a food runner deliver a plate of fried sushi to a table and the rolls were rolling all over the plate, even into his hand. Ugh. 

TLDR: don't come here. It's definitely not worth it.
author: Daphne T.

description:
Do not eat here guys. Let's begin with the layout: The tables are so close together, that you have to inconvenience anyone sitting between you and the exit in order to get by. There are significantly too many tables per server - which means that the wait time is long enough to make anyone question whether or not they're even hungry anymore. 
Overpriced, way sub-par sushi. Don't waste your time.
author: Peter B.

description: Delicious and affordable. Was really surprised at the quality of the food and service. Will make a point of coming by again.
author: Kodi K.

description:
Came with a large party that I reserved long ago. Opened late so
guests waiting outside for a while.  Tried to get a pre-fixed menu a couple times before the date but never did. Was offered the pre-fix when I got there but I had 20 people who had been waiting and I didn't want to delay the process by trying to decide which menu to go with. Didn't know if I'd like the food on that menu. Bill came out pretty high because we ordered off the menu. Overall the food was good but for the hassle I'd go somewhere else.
author: Rose R.

description: Such wonderful sushi!!! They customized my order and the fish was so fresh and flavorful. Worth going to the end of the pier!
author: Leslie V.

description: First time to eat at this restaurant. Can't believe that bad sushi place open in Sf. The lion king roll is small charge 15. And sashimi just little 9pc, but charge 25dollar and maked it so ugly. I order eel bento box for 15dollars, but only got few 2 pc eel,and the eel are over cook. I won't come back again. And and that is the most bad sushi restaurant I eat.
author: Aaron L.

description:
Went during Dine Around Town... were the only people in the restaurant.  The hostess/waitress was very nice and helpful, and she earned all the stars from me.  May be some for a cherry blossom roll.  
The advertised "Lava Rock" is a tourist attraction - if you feel like grilling yourself, go to Korean BBQ.  
Creme Brulee dessert (very Japanese) was probably my favorite dish for the night.
author: Marianna K.

description: Went there with my friend. We ordered our martinis and appetizer.The appetizer was brought to us but after waiting for about 45minutes we asked about our drinks our server told us that they ran out . Anyways we ordered another drink. Every time we asked our server to get something she would go to the kitchen and disappear. Finally before we left we asked for a bag for our to go boxes. She said I will bring it right away however after waiting we went to the front desk and took it from there. While we were exiting the restaurant our server was coming in from outside I guess she decided to take a break and forgot about us again. We spent most of our time waiting for one thing after another. Mean while people who came after us had already had their dinner and left . Food was good and the view was amazing though.
author: Bhaona M.

description: service was awful. the waitress' name was mylie or something. she messed up on drinks. brought out plates. we asked for teriyaki sauce. she went around and took other people's orders. served them. eventually forgot we had asked for teriyaki. we got the sauce like 30 min later. later came to say our order could no longer be made according to chefs so we had to choose a different meal from the menu. our party got served. and a few of us remained unfed. when we all got our food, the waitress didn't check on us once. she had an attitude when we asked for straws for our drinks or something else. it was not even packed. ON TOP OF THAT, WHEN WE GOT OUR TAB, 18% gratituity was already included. FOR CRAPPY SERVICE. i wish i could have fought the top to maybe even lower it. very unsatisfied. will never return again. go somewhere else to feed you and your party. don't come here. waste of money.
author: Wendy M.

description: Sushi is good, Tempera is good too but use a very small cup for sauce, hard to dip. The chop stick is too cheap for the price they charge for the food. Nice and great view of Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz.
author: Shrabbit A.

description: I would rate this restaurant as poor. Yes, the view is great but without this feature this restaurant would be a 1. My sushi was below average-average, half of the hanging lights in this restaurant are burnt out, chairs are coming apart (wood chunks missing) and just overall I did not feel the restaurant was clean or well taken care of. It's such a shame because they get tons of tourists cominj to check this waterfront restaurant and you can just tell the place is not loved by the managers. It could be so great and sadly it is not. The soy sauce also had something in it. Wish it were cleaner and better taken care of.
author: Nav K.

description:
Amazing view!  Our waitress was attentive and very kind.  These two things helped make up for where the food was lacking.  The hostess seemed confused.  Even after watching her while we were there...she didn't seem to be all there.  Her aloofness was almost concerning.  lol

My husband couldn't palate the soup.  Too much salt.  I had the fried gyoza.  I very much wish they offered steamed.  The philly roll was ok.  The salmon was chewy and I couldn't finish it.  My husband liked his chicken and vegetables.

The drinks were ok.  Overall, again the view was amazing and that made up for everything else.
author: Amy C.

description: If you want unique food and a great view of the San Francisco Bay, this is the place to go! My family and I went here for Father's Day and had a great time. Many of us ordered from the lava rock menu, and it was a fun and unique experience cooking the food on it! The service was also spectacular. When I told one of the waitresses that the bathroom ran out of soap, she filled it up right away. All the servers were very courteous and served us in a timely manner. I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Dianne M.

description: Sublime. Such a welcome relief from the mediocre tourist fare on Pier 39. Excellent service, a great view, and tasty authentic dishes.
author: Matt T.

description:
Ate here while perusing Pier 39
The owner Angie was on site and welcomed my girlfriend and her daughter for her birthday dinner.

We loved the lava rock they made special with Sea bass after a special request.  

Sui Gei sake washed it all down for our pleasant after dinner stroll. 

Will definitely revisit this quality restaurant with epic views.
author: Trevor T.

description: The only good things about this place are the waterfront view and unlimited water refill.
author: Mitch C.

description:
I recently had lunch here on a nice sunny day and the views where beautiful. And food was great hamachi cama that's my favorite one snd Lam lollipops love it. 
And the services was excellent that's they get five stars..
author: Luis A.

description: BAD SERVICE!  We had to ask for a high chair 4 times before getting one which was half way through when our food came out. Next, there are two adults so why wouldn't they bring 2 bowls for soy sauce?...only one bowl came out. We had to wait another 10 minutes after the food came out for that. Furthermore, not enough soy sauce at our table and no one comes to ask if we want anything else, I had to "borrow" a bottle from the table next door. Lastly, our waitress does not look at us when passing buy, and didn't ask for more water even tough it's evident that our glasses are empty.  Someone else came to apologize on the delay for the hair chair and said she's very busy. But the place is slow!  Why even stay open if you can't serve.  My last review said that I'd come back here again and I did. Now I'm saying that I won't.
author: Anup P.

description:
If only yelp has zero rating, i'd give it to this restaurant!
There's so many negative things i want to say don't know where to start!! First, waitress is bad, she's trying to memorize all our orders, but of course efffed up!! Missing food and slow service! Manager was talking to the tables around us, didn't even stopped by ours, maybe bec we where just wearing sweats and nikes, she only talked to the people wearing formal to semi formal clothes! Servings are really small and so much expensive! Food is not that good either! All in all bad rating!! If u wanna eat Japanese food, just go somewhere else worth it, THIS IS NOT THE PLACE!!!
author: marygrace j.

description: The worst Japanese restaurant that i have been. The service was terrible, we should wait for 15 mins to get even  cups of water . And we ask them to move our seat to the window but they refused it saying that's for reservation. However, they gave the window seats to other without reservation. Even worse they served dishes over shoulder!! For food was not good as well. Beef and chicken was burned but they still served.thx god we still alive after pour meal:)
author: Ara C.

description:
We stopped in around 3 on a Saturday and it wasn't very busy, so we were able to get a table right by the window--- the view was INCREDIBLE! We got edamame, a few basic rolls, and some nigiri. It was good but nothing special and overpriced. But honestly it does not matter, the view made up for it. The service was quick and friendly.

Moral of the story: go for the view! That is what you are paying for. And it's worth it.
author: Colleen S.

description: This is exactly what you think it is...a tourist trap.  Not the worst sushi ever, but definitely not a top tier sushi restaurant.  It's probably a classic case of having an awesome location and capitalizing on the foot traffic and view, but eventually losing quality.  There are infinitely better locations all over SF.
author: Dylan T.

description: Kitchen is out if menu items at one in the afternoon. Also the wait staff we had was slow and not knowledgeable.
author: Meera G.

description: Hana's Signature dish. Ahi Tuna Salad. It consists of fresh tuna with a spicy seasoned crust, mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, tossed with pan asian dressing. It was pretty delicious for a salad even tho it's kinda spicy :) The wait was long and busy but worth it. Beautiful view of the ocean. The entree was excellent and the fact that this restaurant has raspberry iced tea, omg. LOVE!
author: Lynh N.

description: We started off in the bar and had excellent service.   However, a different waitress named Myly served us. She made us feel uncomfortable and was less than friendly.  Owners should take notice of those that work hard and provide top customer service, they are the ones that bring people back.   Being from Florida with kids, I was less than impressed with the attitude we received, but the beginning experience with our first server at the bar may bring us back.
author: Steve F.

description: Not bad.  The kids enjoyed their bento boxes.  They were out of applesauce so they subbed it with ice cream so major score for the kiddos.  I had the 49er role which was quite delish and refreshing and my sister had the sashimi with salmon only (cost $3 extra though).  I had low expectations given other reviews plus its location at the end of Pier 39 but I was pleasantly surprised.   Don't get the sake though.  We got the $18 for 9oz of oki-something and it was hard to drink.  Did we drink it all?  Absolutely.  Staff was quite nice and accommodating. We had 3 kids ages 6-8 and they brought out markers from the back for them to draw with since they didn't have any crayons.  Overall?  I wouldn't go to pier 39 for sushi but if you find yourself there and have a hankering for sushi, give it a shot!  Not bad at all.
author: Kareen Y.

description: Nope, not again.  Very nice folks, beautiful view, weak food.  The experience was aesthetically gorgeous, but the buck stopped there.  We lunched in a nearly empty restaurant over the Labor Day Weekend.  For comparison, Pier 39 was packed.  My first red flag!  I tried a spicy tuna sushi roll, potstickers & chicken karaage for my daughter, and I wouldn't recommend any of them.  Honestly, I wasn't expecting great things, but the karaage was the poorest of quality- much of it was fried bits of batter with no chicken inside, my daughter rejected after several bites it and she'll eat almost anything fried.  The sushi was large and saucy but disproportionately little fish and quite mediocre.  Nothing I had compelled me to dine here again when I'm in the area with my daughter.
author: Andy S.

description:
This place is such a joke. The food tastes horrible& customer service is bad. The server over charged us and when we mentioned it, the owner came up and started being ridiculously rude to us. Never ever recommending this place to anyone. 
Literally worst sushi ever
author: Ruby R.

description:
We are seldom in this area of town, but stopped in yesterday afternoon to get a drink and a snack.  They are a completely unorganized.  From the host to the bartender to the "buser" - they are all idiots.  Got the order wrong, brought food before drinks, forgot water, forgot soy sauce (but brought the ginger and wasabi), forgot chopsticks, etc.  How can you forget that much when we only ordered two drinks and two appetizers?  

Watched as many tables sat dirty and unavailable, but guests were arriving.  Buser would start at one table, but then leave to go to another before finishing and then would only partly clear the next.  It was like he didn't even have the sense to know if you don't complete one you can't seat new guests at it.  Was like watching a sad comedy team.  

Trying to flag them down for a check was also time consuming.  Watched multiple groups of people come and go because staff was too unorganized to wait on them.  And this was at three o'clock in the afternoon when they were not even busy yet.  Clearly an example of a place with no one in charge.  If you are an absentee owner and your place goes down the tubes, it is no ones fault but your own.
author: Bryan H.

description: If there was minus one, they deserve it. Food quality: sickening. Service: poor.  I would never come here again, the description of food in the menu is so different than in reality that we had to return almost everything.
author: Marten P.

description: Hana Zen - you had me sick for five days. I only ate two raw sushi an hour before I became extremely sick and had 103 degree fever. I had to go to urgent care three days later and couldn't enjoy my time in San Francisco or Napa. I don't think it was the raw sushi that got me sick, it was your insanitary food handling! Get your sh*t together especially if you're going to serve raw sushi!!!
author: Sya N.

description: I'm a big fan of great sushi, and when it comes to the city it takes a lot if time and effort to find a decent place this is my third time coming back to Hana Zen, I feel like every time there's something new to try, the sushi is amazing and fresh, the service is spectacular victor so far my favorite server yes i am coming back.
author: Specky T.

description:
Possibly the worst waiter I have experienced in my entire life. Wait till you read this. 

I entered on a Sunday around mid day. I was seated with 6 students who I was with as a teacher/chaperone. We had a coupon for California rolls and miso soup and so that was what we all ordered. A heavily tattooed man took our drink order and all the kids ordered Coke while I asked for tea, to which he responded,  "we don't have tea". What? A Japanese restaurant with no hot or cold tea? OK so I ordered a diet Coke. When the Cokes arrived, I reconfirmed that mine was a diet. The waiter responded "yes, it is". well... no it wasn't. Again, OK I'll just drink it. 
Next came four miso soups. Other people from our tour group had come in later and seated near us ordered the same meal were promptly served. When I inquired about the missing miso, I was told "we are busy, you will get them". Well we got them 10 minutes later and interestingly, they were neither hot nor cold, sort of room temperature. 
Next the sushi arrived to the party behind us who had come in 20 minutes after us and then five of our California rolls arrived but not the other two. No small dishes for soy sauce, no soy sauce, it never came. We had "dry" sushi. Finally the other two came and the waiter said that the chefs were "backed up" Still no logic as to why the people behind us got their full meal and we, who had arrived earlier with the same order got only half of ours. 
I later asked to speak to the manager and was told she was "too busy". The waiter saw me speaking to the hostess about our problems and he then came up to me and said "Hey dude, you need to chill, you are all eating off of coupons free and can't complain". (Our vouchers were full-pay).
I would suggest that this "waiter" get into another profession. From his appearance alone, he would be better off in a biker shop but he certainly does not know how to deal with customers and should not be in a place where he works with the general public. Yelling at customers is not a way to keep customers returning. 
As it is in a very touristy area (Pier 39) perhaps they don't care about customer service as they will have a steady supply of new customers however word does spread and I notice that the yelp ratings are rather poor already. 
To top this all off, I now have a stomach ache and have read, here on Yelp,  about numerous food poisoning complaints with this place. Ugh. DON"T GO
author: Mark H.

description: When traveling, I tend to wonder from place to place during happy hour.  I observe the atmosphere and review each menu searching for unique dishes. At Hana Zen there are many delectable treats to choose from.  I had the San Francisco oysters and they were the best I have ever had. The flavor was briny, clean, very crisp, accented with a touch of soy and green onions. I also ordered the Dynamite muscles and they were incredible. I will do my best to capture the flavor.  They were delicate muscles, flavored with spicy mayonnaise and topped with green unions and Roe. Both appetizers were a unique blend of ocean flavors. I also had the lobster roll which was prepared with lobster, mango, roe and a spicy thin slice of jalepenos. It was amazing!
author: Raymond S.

description: Beautiful view on the pier!Obviously a little spendy but you are in the city and on pier 39.Took my sister and family here it was a perfect sight seeing spot.My sushi roll was really good!The kids meal is very fancy!They get a lot of food.the chicken however is fried not like traditional for chicken teriyaki so be aware but still really good.I had the crunchy Japanese bread roll(can't remember the name)Service was lacking a little but I'm a waitress so I understand the ambiance was very nice inside and also very clean.I didn't see a drink menu however for cocktails or maybe it is brought separately.
author: Deidre G.

description: We had a great experience. Got right in, our server was extremely friendly, and the food was great. Unsure why anyone mentioned the pricing being too high as this was not overpriced. Would definitely come back, if we lived here.
author: Marcus T.

description:
It's so terrible and horrible,especially the sunset roll. I never taste such bad sushi. It's sooooo disgusting.
Don't have a try,never!!!
author: Pengxin G.

description:
DO NOT ORDER THE BEEF. 

So... Rewind... Last year we originally ate here and loved it. We went out of our way to eat here again and we sincerely looked forward to returning. Unfortunately we were beyond disappointed. We ordered the seafood salad, 15 piece sashimi, beef teriyaki dinner with 4 piece sashimi, oysters, and another beef teriyaki dinner. Seafood salad was so tiny...good by very small. The salmon sashimi was bad, thin uneven slices that literally fell apart when we took a bite. It didn't taste fresh at all. They were out of oysters! But, what really topped off our experience was the over cooked chewy beef. I managed to get my little piece down since I was hungry and we had limited time to find food elsewhere. But my mans meat was much larger and just as tough! It was like beef chewing gum, no joke. We sent it back twice and eventually gave up. I had to ask for my miso soup and the waiter actually asked if I still wanted it. Uhhhhh yea... It comes with my $36 dinner! No side salads in this place... Nope! You get a side of undercooked crunchy vegetables instead. 100 bucks later and still hungry we left upset. 

Negative stars would be appropriate. This place is surviving off of tourism and constant foot traffic. Locals probably steer clear as we will in the future. You have been warned...
author: Liz P.

description: Decent food here, but the view was spectacular! Went for lunch on a Saturday and were seated by the window. Great view of not only Alcatraz, but you could see the Golden Gate Bridge when the fog cleared! I ate the Udon soup with vegetable and shrimp tempura.
author: Laura R.

description:
To the workers of Hana Zen and President Angie Louie:
On July 30, a total of family members (two adults and one child) decided to give your restaurant a try despite the many negative reviews from Yelp and Google.  We travel all over the bay area and outside cities to find and to support numerous Sushi and Yakitori restaurants.
However, the negative reviews from Yelp and Google did not fail as this will be added as one of the new Disappointment and negative review for Hana Zen.
We called to make reservations for 3 at 9 pm.  Upon arriving at your restaurant at Pier 39, your host (Caucasian female) seemed lost and was disorganized to find a table for us when it was explained to her we have made reservations at 9 pm for 3 parties. After a total of 20 minutes' wait, our server (Caucasian/Hispanic male) finally came, although he was pleasant and introduced himself, he didn't acknowledge the fact why it took him 20 minutes to attend to us.  Almost pissed off, but we managed to control our emotions, we started ordering.  Our server was not ready to take our complete order that we had to call him back to our table and told him we also would like something to drink besides the food.While waiting for our food to be served, we can't help but to notice the lack of attentiveness of your employees.  Where all are flocking towards the back of your restaurant "chit-chatting," few individuals are sitting down, paying great attention on their phones, while the rest of the customers are not being catered.  We scanned around the restaurant, and looked and smiled at fellow customers, and perhaps we were all thinking "what in the world is happening at this restaurant."We had a difficult and disappointment experience dining at Hana Zen for numerous reasons:
-Cherry blossom did not have any aoijiso, kalware and ponzu garlic sauce
-49ers roll did not have thin sliced of lemons and had seeds.  We had to take out the seeds to prevent us from choking
-We requested for water with lemons, we only received 3 cups of water with no lemons
-Child's bento box "did not make sense, the only thing that made sense was my drink, Ramune" per child
-Salmon teriyaki was burnt and was very oily, sautéed vegetables was very dry
-Chicken teriyaki was very salty, cold and raw
We cannot comprehend, even a 9 yr. old could not understand what he tried eating, for what the chef/cook did to the food they had served us.  It seemed that a kid made our food which is a total joke for the price we were charged.
To summarize it all, the nasty foods we ordered, lack of good customer service.
author: Jay R.

description:
Very clean and nice, located at the end of the pier, which offered a beautiful view.

Our waiter was VERY rude. He seemed like he didn't wanna be there. Every time I would ask a question, he would answer back with a sassy attitude

Portions were smaller than average and pricey. 

Garlic noodles were delicious. But as said earlier, small portions.

We ordered one of their special rolls, $13 for about 6/8 pieces? They weren't extraordinary. 

Although we would like to, we will not be back.
author: Julie X.

description:
Good things first:
-Sushi was amazing, they have lot of options and we tried 4 varieties and all of them are nice.
-Service was good

Bad things:
-we ordered Calamari and we got oil instead (oh yeah, it did have some Calamari too)
-We ordered a margarita and cocktail, we felt like literally drinking neat vodka/Tequila.
author: Nani N.

description:
We walked past this restaurant in search for somewhere to have dinner without massive queues. We thought we were pretty lucky to find somewhere with a nice view and not crowded on a very busy Sunday night. But it all made sense why this place had lots of empty tables...

The food is passable, but pretty heavy on the salt all around. Our waitress forgot to bring me my glass for the sparkling water, then we had to remind her we wanted two beers not one... Our sharing plates arrived, we finished eating. Meanwhile we are still waiting for our 4 year old's Bento box to arrive. Our waitress eventually came back to check on us and we told her we were waiting (to which she interrupted "for the bill yes?" and my husband said no, for our son's meal. And she was like ah yes the Bento like she had forgotten to put that through too! By the time it arrived (the kitchen obviously had to make it after we've told her) we have had enough of being there, we asked her to have it to go. Our four year old wanted to leave so we asked him to ask one of the waitresses nicely for our bill and he came back saying that he was told that she doesn't know what language he was speaking and walked off (he speaks with a New Zealand accent but IT'S STILL ENGLISH! If the restaurant wasn't playing such loud pumping music perhaps she would have heard him properly!) not just that but she could have come to our table to check on us if we needed anything! We gave up waiting and went to the counter to ask for our bill, and there was more standing around and waiting for anyone who knew anything about customer service! 

This place has to be the worst Japanese restaurant we've been to in our travels! It is disorganised and lacks flow and communication between staff. They do not care about their diners, very unapologetic which just shows they don't care or just totally oblivious to the terrible service they provide. The music was highly inappropriate for dinner - it's a restaurant not a nightclub! 

The one star is for the fact that I can't give 0 stars. DO NOT BOTHER WITH THIS PLACE!
author: Ria B.

description: Let me start by saying the drinks and the mixed tempura were pretty good and the bartender, Manny, was very accommodating. However, where this place gets stars off is the management! My boyfriend was charged for premium sake during happy hour (which was a misunderstanding by the bartender). The bartender told us not to tip as it'd be the same price because this woman (who I'm assuming was the manager) would not reduce the price from $12 to $7 even though it wasn't customer error. She was vicious to my boyfriend, while the bartender was trying to figure out how we could get the right price. Her attitude is unacceptable for people in the service industry, I just feel bad for that bartender.
author: Nicole P.

description: This place is not recommended. I have been in 4th of July .i had dinner contains sushi Philadelphia, salmon role negiri tuna and nudlless  soup with beef. In the next day I had Bally pains and 4 times diarrhea. I am just on my way to get my money back. Hopefully I get a compensation.
author: Avi P.

description: Very poor service. Took 15 minutes to get menus and take our drink order...after placing our orders we waited 45 minutes and no drink refills, no food... The waitress had the nerve to come by and ask "how is everything going here?" ...pfft. We decided to get up and walk out!
author: Rachael L.

description: Just having a few drinks. Service is poor. They ran out of oysters and basically they can't be bothered. Another strange thing is that they don't have any cash to make change. She said that the wait staff makes their own change. Don't come here.
author: Rose D.

description:
Our visit was on Father's Day because Bubba Gumps was a 2 hr wait.
We arrived at this spot, and there were maybe 4 other couples. We should have walked out then and there, but we decided to give it a try. We ordered: Chicken Teriyaki, Oysters, Fish & Chips, Salmon Teriyaki, and Pot stickers. The menu sounded good, but all of the ingredients were very cheap. The fish and chips consisted of Tilapia, which I have never seen before, and is one of the cheapest fish you can buy, yet they charge $20.The view of the bay was beautiful, but that's the only thing we liked about our time here. We were a table of 8, never got our waters refilled, and were never asked how our food was. The Chicken Teriyaki was very fatty and hardly had any sauce. The pot stickers had hardly any meat and tasted very bland. Overall, I think this restaurant charges way to much for the food that they serve and are very cheap with their ingredients. There bathrooms...quite disgusting and need maintenance. For being on the Pier we were all very disappointed with this restaurant and hope they fill this space with something better!
author: Sarah N.

description: AVOID THIS RESTAURANT!!! If I could give half a star, that's what I would give. I'm sitting in the restaurant currently with three friends and they have two people working the floor as wait staff. Unfortunately, the customers should be called the waiters as we have been waiting for approximately 20 minutes for food. The appetizer has not been brought out, but two sushi rolls and a small miso soup have come. Not sure when we will see food again...and don't get me started on refills of drinks.
author: John C.

description: Had something floating on top of my beer. Amy family was the first people in here but felt like we were served late seeing about 6 tables eating before us...
author: Emil H.

description:
If you make a visit over to Hana Zen at Pier 39, located on the second floor, make sure it's for the ambiance rather than the food. Since I can give 2 shits about how fancy a joint is, this place only gets a "meh" from me.

Ambiance: I have to admit that this place is GORGEOUS. Wonderful interior as well as a stunning glass-wall view of Alcatraz, the Golden Gate Bridge silhouette, and a few boats that go sailing around. The view Hana Zen offers is hard to compete with.

Customer Service: Everyone was so incredibly friendly, though our waiter was a tiny bit socially awkward. He stood a fair bit away from us and laughed sheepishly. It was actually painful to watch because he was so nice. Hahahaha poor guy...

Food: They have happy hour that lasts for 4 hours combined with a large variety of drink options. As far as food goes, the quality didn't really match up to the price.

I ordered Lion King which set me back 14 dollars, which is one of my favourite rolls. It was alright, but Lion King is usually supposed to be heavily filling with its baked salmon and loads of mango sauce. Instead, they went for more of the "classy dining" route and unfortunately skimped on the flavours instead of making it the hearty sushi roll it was supposed to be. I also had the Philadelphia Roll and its usually one of my favourite rolls as well, but unfortunately was only "meh". They overloaded it with cream cheese and had it completely overpower the flavour of the salmon when there normally should be a fine balance.

---

With how pricey Hana Zen is, you would think that they would provide quality as well. I mean, after all it looks like such a fancy dining spot. Needless to say, I left disappointed.
author: Clarissa Y.

description:
Friendly staff, quick service. Solid food, not bad. I'm confused why it's only three stars. We started off with the fried calamari and dynamite mussels. Both of 10/10! The calamari dipping sauce was really good. I ordered the spider roll, which was the soft shell. It was decent. I've definitely had better. 

I recommend the calamari and mussels!
author: Shereena H.

description: I really tried to like this place after reading the reviews but so far I've been waiting for my food for about 20mins. I have never waited this long for some sushi
author: Kevin J.

description:
Truly the ONLY reason I am giving this place only 3 stars is because of #1 service (wait for food) and #2 management.
 Now I totally understand this being a new restaurant less than a year open and on the warf, the world famous Pier 39 it would of course have it's glitches.... BUT, it's a restaurant on Pier 39 that so many people all over the world travel too, to get that 'San Francisco' by the bay meal! Glitches like, wait time for a meal should be worked out one would think.
We (my husband and I) drove into the city for dinner. We both enjoy a night of "playing tourist" and so we decided to try this sushi place on the warf.

Food was awesome and very fresh, and the restaurant layout was nice and large enough to accommodate small intimate dates or even group outing. They have a nice bar area and even a big screen for those wanting to watch the Giants or 49ers.

Other than the service it was a nice night that we enjoyed. Wish that they didn't lie about how the seating next to the window was "reserved" blatant lie as we while we had our dinner folks that we were already eating ask if they could move to those " reserved seats" and they were able to. 

My advice, even if you are a "walk in" which of course they accept and love. Call the restaurant before you walk in and ask for a reservation for a window seat.
author: Dia D.

description: Giving just 1 star for we havent really tasted their food...Me and my husband was at pier 39 today and getting hungry so we decided to go to this japanese sushi restaurant... the host lead us to a sunny table and not even ask if were okay with that...Weve been sitting for long time and not even 1 waiter entertain us...So we just decided to leave...Very POOR Service!!
author: Venus A.

description: Great drinks great view and great food! Sat at the bar and  enjoyed their happy hour. Margarita was on point! Bartender was super nice and friendly.
author: Amanda D.

description: Food was great service was also very good great fun servers and beautiful view but while eating I saw a RAT walking past me and the bartenders pretended not to see it until I pointed it out their response was that that always happens and it's normal I don't think it's "normal" to have a rat crawl next to you while eating in a "fancy" restaurant
author: Paola M.

description: TERRIBLE service! Will never be back, took 25 minutes to even get service and then the waitresses couldn't even understand or put together a sentence to try and talk to us. The food was not worth the price and it took us over a hour to try and have them get our order right. Nice view but not worth the price or time it took
author: Kirsten B.

description:
We stopped here today for a light meal and drinks.  The service was great!  We were seated promptly, our order was taken and drinks were brought out quickly.  Our sushi order soon followed.  Our waitress kept a close eye on us and the owner checked on our status.

We are in town for the week and may go back before our return to Florida.  Great food.  Great drinks and Great service.

I will also mention that the view was amazing!
author: Dale P.

description:
We were able to get a table without waiting on a busy Saturday afternoon.  The view is amazing, with Alcatraz in the middle and a wide section of the bay on either side.  It is fun to watch all of the boats go by.
The downside is that we had plenty of time to watch the scenery because the food service was unusually slow.  It took two hours altogether to have a one course lunch without dessert or coffee.  Our waitress was polite, and refilled our water glasses regularly.  Fish and chips looked good.  The chicken teriyaki bento was also a good choice.
One of the other servers was sitting on the stool in the bathroom texting on her phone.  When someone else questioned her about it, since it was a tiny two stall bathroom with a long line, she claimed that she was there to check on the cleanliness of the bathroom.  Hmm.
author: Karen I.

description:
My boyfriend took me to this place for Valentine's Day because I told him I wanted a pretty view. 

This place was perfect because it was at the edge of pier 39 with a view of the bay. Unfortunately it was night time so I didn't get a chance to experience the view, although I'm sure it is lovely.

We are both SF natives & yes we knew it was going to be packed full of tourists but who cares. Sometimes it's fun to play tourist in your own city. Anyway, for all the comments that say meh it's mediocre... It's because Yall don't know how to order. When you go to a restaurant you HAVE TO HAVE what the restaurant is known for. DUH that's why there is Yelp.

We ordered the dynamite mussels, sashimi plate & the filet mignon lava rock. You guys MUST try the lava rock plate, preferably the filet mignon. Basically it is a super hot lava rock where you place the meat on top and it cooks it fast & to how perfect you want it. You have to watch it because the rock is so hot you CAN over cook your meat. Anyway, the seasoning was perfect. It came with fried rice & vegetables. The 3 dishes were perfect for the 2 of us. We practically murdered it & washed it down with 2 bottles of cold sake.

At the end of our meal the waiter, which by the way gave us the perfect service presented me with a rose for vday.... Secretly requested by my dude!

Had a great experience full of laughter, great company & good food!! Will definitely come back during the day.
author: Jazzmin A.

description: I went here for a date with my girl. When we got our food there was a hair in the sushi so i had the food sent back. I then had got the food back which appeared to have only been transferred to a new plate and STILL HAD A HAIR IN IT and looked exactly the same. I paid for what we ate then we left. Also they have menus all over pier 39 saying they have a variety of bento boxes which they don't they only have a kids bento box. This place needs to be reevaluated by a health inspector. Worst place ever food wise. The waiter really did his best.
author: Jozef J.

description: The view was great and the servers were very hospitable but the food was unimpressed, over priced and very small portions
author: Nina P.

description: Very excellent food, however service was poor. The 5 servers were not very friendly and the hostess did not speak very good English. Prices are average
author: Ethan T.

description: Worst place for happy hour. Warm beers. Not worth your time. Shady bartender tried to keep a cellphone we left behind. #wasteoftime
author: Diggs C.

description:
Came here with my fiance to get some Japanese food and was blown away by the view. They sat us right next to the window and had a perfect view of Alcatraz! We ordered to Sapporos and a hot Sake, and by mistake they brought us four Sapporos and did not charge us. We ordered a side of fried rice, three rolls and edamame. The fried rice was perfect! Had the perfect amount of soy sauce and everything else in it complimented it. All three rolls were delicious but my favorite was the eel cucumber! Highly recommend it!

Only sad part was they did not have Mochi :(
author: Sarah T.

description: When we arrived there was no hostess to greet us. The bartender had to stop what she was doing to go look for the hostess after telling my son there was no bathroom in the restaurant. The hostess showed up and took us to our table.  There were 2 servers running around but neither greeted us.  The restaurant was not even busy.  Eventually a server showed up and took our order. Someone showed up with water but we never got the drinks we ordered.  Eventually some of the food showed up. The server hurried off before asking if we needed anything else.  We had to flag him down for our drinks and flag him down again for the rest of our order.  He never came back to the table until it was time for the bill.  We were charged a healthy sf fee of $2.84 whatever that is and 18% tip for crappy service. I corrected the tip amount but still got charged the 18% tip and a bill of over $100 for mediocre food and bad service.  Very disappointed.  Will never visit.
author: Joselynn C.

description: I'm giving this one star because the view is amazing, that's all. If I could stop people from going in here I would :( just walked out with my Husband and Son and spent 125.00$ on warm beer, crappy service, room temperature sushi, my sons Coke was even flat. The back of chairs are dirty, just please don't waste your money here! I have never left such a bad review on Yelp for a restaurant. Soooo disappointing! Almost gross, sad but so true.
author: Michelle A.

description:
Absolutely disappointing experience. It was my 2nd time here, since I'm local and don't come to touristy spot often. 
First of all, the 5-item HH order took more than 1 hr.  Hot sake came, followed by spicy tuna roll and goyza in the span of 20 mins, and the waitress just completely forgot about the calamari and edamame and took them more than 40 mins to get these 2, which there are only 5 tables of customers in total...
Calamari was extremely heavy-breaded. Edamame had no flavor at all, it was literally just being steamed and served. 
Our bill was suppose to be $23 in total, and we were handed a bill of $60 with a bunch of stuff we didn't order. 
Now go figure! It's def on my restaurant blacklist and Deserves no more visit from me.
author: Fanny Z.

description:
The service was excelent, we started with Edamame was good like always and the sauce on the Dynamite Mussels was the bomb!!! Then I asked for sashimi combination it was really fresh but just 4 kind of fish thats why the 4 stars. My girlfriend asked for noodle soup and it was delicious,

To finish I asked for a sunflower roll this thing was awesome, the best roll ever!!!
author: Guillermo T.

description:
Appears to be a fairly fun place, and probably would be if you don't have high (or any) expectations on sushi quality. We ordered the Omakase sashimi special, which in every other Japanese restaurant means the chef's BEST choice of fish. It's a high dollar way to ensure you're getting the best of the house...the cuts that the sushi chef would be proud to being home to his mamma. However, at this place, it meant tuna, salmon, yellow tail, "white" tuna, yellow tail belly, mackerel, and salmon roe. Really?  That's a typical run of the mill sashimi combination in any half rated joint.  But to charge $75 for that?  I feel we have a very different opinion of Omakase, unfortunately. 

PS. The mackerel was so bad I had to spit it out into a napkin. Very fishy (even for an oily fish like mackerel) and mushy instead of firm as it is supposed to be. 

The waitress was friendly enough and the unfiltered sake was yummy.
author: J M.

description:
I was reading through "Dine Around Town" and this place featured grilling on the LAVA rock, of course I imagined a porous sorta circular thing and was VERY excited. Up until we got to the restaurant. We were the only ones there, and all the chairs were up on the tables.
The food was meh, but the server was very nice.
author: Anna P.

description:
Great location and great interior design - too bad that the food is terrible.

We ordered a variety of menu from rolls to dinner plates, and except for the rolls (which were nothing special), the rest of the dinner sucked. The broth for the udon was too salty, the sea bass had absolutely no seasoning(like...no salt or anything), and the chirashi bowl had barely enough sushi to cover the rice. I had to ask for some sort of sauce for the sea bass and even then it was so tasteless. We ended up eating rice with soy sauce... Especially considering the price we paid, the dinner was absolutely terrible. 

The waitress came by a few times, and after we handed the check, they immediately started cleaning the table which made us get up earlier than we wanted to. It wasn't like they had anyone waiting to be seated. 

I fully regret walking in, thinking that the restaurant would be decent based on its location. I thought anything would taste better when I'm hungry, but this place proved me wrong. Nope, never again.

One star for the interior, another for the rolls.
author: Shelby P.

description: Our food came out at different times, the avocado was rotten, most of us were done eating before one of us received their food.  When we asked to speak to the manager, we were told that there was only 1 manager for the whole store and they were out with the flu.  Service was TERRIBLE!   Our waitress was doing her best but she can't control the kitchen.  Felt bad for her because she was trying.  I had garlic noodles and Cali roll and it was yummy.  They need to get more organized and handle a large group better!  Don't be in a rush to eat here either!
author: Stephanie P.

description: Went on Valentine's day with a reservation.  Waiting an hour and never got our food. The couple next to us gor half their order and waited 30 min before the second half came and that was only after complaining about the wait. We got tired of waiting and asked for the bill and left. We will never come back.
author: Monique B.

description: On a Sunday afternoon with a 10 person party this restaurant only had one chef and one waitress. We were not informed of the short staff until after an hour. We attempted to escalate to a supervisor and were informed that no manager was in the restaurant and they needed to call the manager.  Food for our party came out in 20 minute intervals with the last persons food was not on the table until an hour and a half after we sat down. UNACCEPTABLE!!!!
author: Jennifer T.

description: Youngest had the garlic noodle with beef. Loved it. Two of us had the udon with veg tempura. Noodles good. Soup a bit salty. A few of the veggies were cooked together so not cooked consistently
author: Stuart K.

description:
The restaurant is located on the famous Pier 39, with a nice view of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge.

The place was empty during dinner Friday night.  Even with very few people, it takes a long time to get your food.  Not only did we have to wait a long time, the waiter forgot our appetizer order.

The sushi overall was average.  I would not be back when I'm in the area again.
author: Brian K.

description: Waited for 15 minutes and no one ever came to even take our drink order. Water would have been nice. Then we saw the poor food quality warning from a recent inspection and decided to leave.
author: Jacquie P.

description:
My boyfriend and I stopped in for a drink on Saturday 2/16/13 after a day walking around Fisherman's Wharf. 

We were greeted promptly and decided since we were just grabbing a drink, to sit @ the bar- our bartender Trang was very friendly and as we talked to her, she said that she was originally from MA- where we just moved from.  We chatted for a bit and she suggested some cool bars next to our hotel (Hilton- Union Square) as we wanted to go out after our dinner later that evening at Ruth's Chris. 

I ordered a Salmon Pinot Noir- not overly impressed but it wasn't horrible either and my boyfriend had a Anchor Steam draft .

We decided we would def. stop in again just because of the customer service we received and next time, we would try either an app or entree
author: Kristi O.

description: The food is not that good especially for the price. Bad service and rude staff. Will not come back here
author: Soup C.

description: Food is Metiocre! DONT WASTE YOUR TIME and money!!! Lots of good restaurant around!! Service is pretty bad...Our server keeps rolling her eyes around ...She looks like she really hates her job...nice view of the water though..if you dont mind bad service and below average japanese food then go ahead!
author: Jackie C.

description: This is the worst places ever!!!! I ordered onigiri and what i got inside rice is thum-nail size salmon!! Even feels more small than that. I just ate white rice(even bad) and soggy seaweed. Seriously it was totally waste of money not to mention. The ONLY good thing about this place is that people can see golden gate bridge and alcatraz at the same time, but it is nothing special. i will never come again in my life.
author: Erin L.

description:
Superb service with excellent view and food.  Will definitely be back there again!  

Thank you to everyone involved in making it a great experience!
author: Alan T.

description: Great service! Fast and delicious! Their lion king roll was delicious! It was clean and I would come back.
author: Litcatzin Y.

description: This place has good rolls but there's not that many creative options and it's pretty expensive. I'd come here if I have money and want to treat myself while in the city. Overall, I would come back but not go out of my way to come here tjust to get sushi.
author: Vicky L.

description: Quick and friendly service and the sushi rolls are great. The only reason I knocked it down a star was because the sushi was pricy in my opinion. On a clear day, sitting by the window you get a great view of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge.
author: Julie A.

description:
I honestly wanted to give them a good review.. I wanted to grab dinner here since I was at the Pier and wanted some sushi. There were plenty of seats both at the bar and in the main dining area. Happy hour was from opening til closing and thought it would be a good idea. After waiting almost 10 minutes to get noticed the bartender took our order for some Garlic Noodles (full plate is still really small), some fried calamari w/ spicy mayo sauce (super greasy and salty), spicy tuna roll and some water.... First off the bartender couldn't tell me the portion sizes of the noodles. After taking our order he brings back some water & mind you... there are no utensils on my table. Noodles and Calamari come and still no utensils... I had to get up and go to the bar to ask for utensils and he comes back to our table with chopsticks.. no napkins, NOTHING... just the chopsticks.. We are still waiting for our tuna roll and have already finished our food.. then it finally arrives. Nobody even asked if we wanted any refills on our water.  

Honestly, I thought the service could have been better especially since you are in one of the most visited areas of San Francisco. I thought wrong. The bartender was too busy cutting limes and taking multiple shots of tequila.. (overheard him say he's actually a rum guy... SMH) with the 2 ladies at the other table that he forgot there were other guests to attend to. I don't know if I will be coming back to Hana Zen. Sorry.
author: Melvin G.

description: Yesterday my server who was the bartender was excellent first and foremost. Deanna thank you so much. Now lets talk about the perfect sushi rolls in town. My goodness they were excellent. Our virgin drinks made Deanna laugh and the hostess told me about the rolls so thank you missy. Please please try this restaurant because the ambience is wonderful and the food is a 10 from 1-10
author: Anita M.

description: This place doesn't deserve a star. Came in for late lunch early dinner. Food came out at separate times. One person in the party ordered seared tuna it came out fully cooked. Food wasn't good at all. On top of that they added 18% gratuity on the bill without any warning. I would not recommend this place to anyone.
author: Andrew W.

description: WARNING!!! This place serves warm beer!! They also have horrible customer service!! My friends and I let the server know our beers were warm and he argued that they were not! Last I checked, the servers are suppose to give customer service! So we told the hostess that we were gonna leave. And we did! We walked out without drinking the piss warm beer and without paying! But then my friend left his phone in the bar by accident and went back to get it. The servers then made my friend pay for the beer before returning his phone go him! BS! We didn't even drink the damn beer! They are lucky I have to give a star!
author: Christi M.

description:
Whenever my husband and I have a hankering for sushi, we come here.  We know we are not getting the authentic quality that is found at Ryoko's in Tender Nob, but we love cutting through the tourist traffic to see the sun set on the Bay.  It is truly one of the most spectacular sights in SF, and it never gets old because there are no two same days in the SF Bay.  Once, I was just taken aback by how the Golden Gate Bridge suddenly looked like it was encrusted in rubies.         

Hana Zen service is good, with the right amount of "hands off" attention that we like. Ironically, the conventionally better service at Swiss Louis in SF with constant drink refills and queries about how we are enjoying the food is slightly intrusive because we like to drink in the views quietly.  

Boiling it down, we go mostly for the views and less for the actual sushi, which is OK quality.  I don't particularly recommend the chicken teriyaki (bit fatty for me), but the specialty rolls are not so bad.
author: Miran C.

description:
It's a Japanese restaurant on Pier 39 with a nice view of the ocean and Alcatraz.

Portions are small and prices are steep which is understandable for its location. What didn't make sense to me was the quality of the food. Nothing my party of 6 and I ordered stood out to me as exceptional or even above average.

The waters brought out to us barely had any ice in them so they were not refreshing at all in the hot sunlight. The special rolls are tiny with only around 5 pieces of sushi each. My donburi order was actually pretty large and took a while to finish but did not settle well in my stomach. I felt like throwing up for about 30 minutes after eating it which has never happened to me before even after overstuffing myself at AYCE sushi places.

Service was ok, but overall the prices are just too high for what they serve and I will not be coming back in the future.
author: Vincent D.

description: Overpriced and disappointing. Two stars for the view. I will say the chicken wings and pot stickers were pretty good though.
author: Russell L.

description:
If I could give negative stars I would. The view is amazing, the rest is less than good.  Service was awful, 2 separate people took our order, neither put the order in. We sat for an hour waiting for 2 rolls.
The water we requested 3 times never arrived, the fork for our children to eat their rice with took 40 minutes and 3 requests. To top it off, neither stall in the ladies room was working, and obviously hadn't been for quite awhile.  I could continue, but these are the highlights.

Save your money, go ANYWHERE else.
author: STACEY J.

description: I got the same experience. The hostess look at my friend when she ask excuse me can I have a box. And walk away didn't say a word. Took us 5 times to get one box. We ask for another because one isn't enough. She gave us a large bag because she said we don't have anymore boxes for Togo. What kind of restaurant that don't have enough to go containers. I own a restaurant business and I was stun
author: Lily N.

description:
I would give this place no stars if I could.  We went there on a recommendation from a family member for a quick after party early dinner.  After we sat down a member of the party read the yelp warning about a poor health and safety review by the city.  That made our decision to not order raw easier.   

We were seated in the back corner of the restaurant near the serving station, kitchen and raw bar.  The view was amazing...Alcatraz loomed in the distance and the entire bay was laid out before us.  Boats whizzed by to the delight of my two year old son.  Not five minutes after that, I kid you not, a large mouse or a small rat ran across a ten foot section of floor from the serving station to a nearby cabinet.  A server saw the vermin, looked surprised, but appeared to shrug it off and do nothing about it.  I should have gotten up and left but we were with a large family party and didn't want to make a scene so we collected our belongings up off the floor and ordered food.  

I ordered the ahi steak dinner but decided to have it cooked to medium to ward off any potential food born illness.  What arrived was a cold, clammy pale piece of fish with no flavor served with under cooked (read raw carrots) vegetables. The broccoli and zuccini were cooked ok.  We ordered my son the breaded pork kids bento box.  The pork was too tough and chewy for him to eat and he choked a few times and spit the food out.  We resorted to feeding him regular potato fries (sweet potato fries were advertised), rice and vegetables, avoiding the once again raw carrots.  The carrots were just too raw and hard for him to eat. My wife had the salmon teriyaki dinner and she said it was good enough to eat, but just meh.  (We were starving and hadn't eaten food all day!)  We wound up with a nice pile of raw carrots to feed to the sea lions!  LOL.

On the plus side our server was nice and responsive and catered to our son.  He dropped several forks during dinner and the staff was quick to replace them with what I assume to be clean utensils numerous times, so props to them for having the patience to deal with a two year old.  We ordered a large sake to split between two tables and she provided it in three small bottles across two tables, which was a nice touch that prevented us from having to go between tables to pour drinks.

Dinner for the three of us with a large beer and bottle of large sake amounted to $100+, ridiculous in my opinion for the food that we got and the risk of eating vermin infected food. 

I waited for the next few hours to get sick but nothing happened.  In the end we all ate and nobody got sick.  This place must cater to unsuspecting tourists with its great views of the bay and Alcatraz.  As said before several boats flew by close to the end of the pier during dinner, whipping up waves and providing great entertainment for my son who unsuspectingly loved every minute.  However, being a native I should have known better than to go there anticipating great sushi.  Go there for drinks and atmosphere...not for food.  If you want to eat, avoid at all costs.  If you find yourself there reading this review, drink heavily, order basic chicken teriyaki or stand up and go next door to Bubba Gumps and save yourself the trouble.
author: P T.

description: Food was ok except the avocados were rotten and they were poorly rolled so fell apart easily. We had a large party and half of our table got food 45 minutes before the other half.  They were clearly short staffed and had NO manager on site. Our server was nice but they didn't manage the situation well. It took a very long time to get our food and then for it to be poor to ok quality was unacceptable. When we brought up these issues we were told there is no manager today. Then we finally got them to call the owner/manager for approval to discount our bill and remove the roll with rotten avocados. When I brought up the rotten avocados I was told that they oxidize. These are clearly rotten. Restaurants should have managers at all times and maybe situations like this would be prevented. Also it's poor form to argue with your customers. I will never return here and will tell my friends to avoid this place as well.
author: Audrey W.

description: A friend and I came here late on a Saturday night, very close to closing. The staff was still very inviting. My friend and I sipped mojitos while waiting for our mussels, scallops, nigori tuna, and dragon roll. The dragon roll left more to be desired, being small and underwhelming. However, the mussels were a dream, being flavorful and warm. The nigori was good as well, and I'm not a big fan of raw fish. It wasn't fishy tasting whatsoever. The scallops had a spicy sauce on them so beware, but once you get past that, they melt in your mouth. The view idgreat if you gets table near the window. You'll be right next to the water with a view of the Golden Gate Bridge in the distance. Even if you don't sit near a window, the restaurant is still very pretty.
author: Brianna R.

description: Best sushi ever! I've been to a lot of sushi places but this one takes the cake. Not only is it fresh fish, but it also have a wonderful view of Alcatraz. The atmosphere was delightful and our waitress Deanna was awesome and on top of her game. Had a lovely experience and will definitely make this my spot anytime I'm in SF!
author: Donnie S.

description: Great find ! We were on our way to chart house and saw the Japanese restaurant, my wife said let's try it.. she is a genius! Started with spring rolls that were great my wife had the filet on a stone and I had the dungeons crab and they were both great. Our server mile was fabulous and the view equally as good. Nice change from the normal tourist spot. Highly recommend!! Enjoy.
author: Mark S.

description:
We came here last night craving sushi and an amazing view... We were not disappointed! It's right on the very edge of pier 39 so nothing is in the way of the beautiful bay. Watching the sunset was the cherry on top! It wasn't too crowded for a Sunday.

The sushi was amazing. I got a seaweed salad, some roll with baked salmon on top (I think it was called the lion king?) and an order of smoked salmon nigiri. The boy got a crunchy spicy tuna roll and the deep fried California roll. They were all to die for! 

Our waitress was really nice and the food came out super fast.

This definitely won't be our last time here!
author: Rachel C.

description:
God awful. I understand its July 4th, but definitely worst dining experience ever.

So, we wait for our seats and as we are about to order, we find out that they gave us seats that belonged to another party. That party had not even ordered yet, theyve just used the bathroom. Just shows how organized they are - they dont even know if a party has paid or eaten yet.

The food was expensive and underwhelming. They literally slap a raw filet mignon on a hot plate and serve that to you with some rice and vegetables. Obviously, the plate was not nearly hot enough to cook a filet of beef. 20 minutes later, our beef was still beyond rare and there was no sear on the beef. By the time we gave up and decided to eat our way rare meat, the plate had become cold enough to touch.

Really dont understand why they would have the customer cook their own cut of beef, and honestly i could do a better job at home on a real stove.

Best part was, we were finished for over half an hour before they realized "oh you need the bill, you havent paid yet". By this time, ive already tried numerous times to grab the attention of anyone, which i got the reply "be right there". I even let them have my chair, since they were short on chairs and ive already finished eating. To make matters worse, they couldnt even locate my bill. They tried to hand me someone elses bill, and they had to ask around to find my bill. Wouldve been the easiest dine n dash of my life. Darn my conscience.

Since they took so long to get my bill, i was unable to grab a half decent spot to watch the fireworks. So, i decided to watch from inside the restaurant's lobby. They told me, "you finished, so you need to get out. Right now." What a joke, seriously.
author: Daniel W.

description: Great food!! This place is tasty! They have a beautiful view of the harbor as well as a great happy hour! Give it a try, and remember patient is a virtue especially on the WARF.. Big tourist destination! Can get busy!!
author: Amanda S.

description:
Great meal, although my cousin ordered me the wrong meal so don't go to blitz boba :-(((((((( 
(Hit em with dat fetty wap face .-))))))) )
author: Gabriel D.

description: Owner Angie is the master of hospitality! Expect to feel welcomed and served with the greatest of skill. The food is fantastic and this is a great spot to visit while in San Francisco!
author: Catrine M.

description: Way overpriced. Service okay, not exceptional. Sushi badly rolled and surprisingly not fresh for being so close to the water. Good views, but didn't make up for the mediocre food. Also, strangely decorated...
author: Jacob R.

description: Amazing Hanazen is a place to be! Great service, breathtaking views....love this place...
author: Sherryllene F.

description: Not sure what all the fuss is about. Came here for happy hour on Good Friday and sat at the bar. Had some great sushi for a decent price and was welcomed by Deanna! She was very sweet and made us some delicious drinks. It's near the water so you have a fantastic view of you sit next to the window. I'll definitely be back! Thanks again Deanna for your kindness!
author: Jassy R.

description: The service was horrible the bartender doesn't know his job insulting me in Spanish when I told him that I understand Spanish he didn't care he had 8 shots while we sat there he asked my girlfriend why she was with me cause I was so rude and the owner didn't care
author: Paul V.

description:
A restaurant with a very beautiful layout to it. 

I went here with a friend after going on a Red and White Fleet Golden Gate tour in the early afternoon. We were seated right by the window, which had a great view of Alcatraz and the bridge. 

When it came down to our food, my friend got the chicken teriyaki bento (lunch menu, $15.50) and i got the tamago donburi (lunch menu, $10.00).
