My order consisted of mushrooms, eggs, and fishcake over rice, while my friend had the usual box; chicken teriyaki, salad, rice, california roll, and tempura

Overall, food was pretty good. My donburi was great! Super hot though, so you'd probably wanna mix that baby up if you ordered it. The mushrooms were sliced and had a nice consistency to them, and with the fishcake and rice, it tasted good. My friend really liked his box. The chicken was pretty unique, since it was crunchy, as compared to other chicken teriyaki from other places. 

We then ordered a green tea ice cream for dessert ($3.25) It was so smooth in texture, and it tasted like it was made straight from the leaves! 

They do accept card, pretty awesome! What's not awesome is that the prices were wayyy up there for just a bento. But if the quality of food is exceptional, i suppose the price is alright too.
author: Jerianne G.

description: Ordered the garlic noodles with chicken breast. What was given to me was Barilla thin spaghetti with the light aroma of garlic, and a side of a baby chicken breast that had been overcooked and lightly seasoned in toilet water. I've had poorly cooked chicken before and choked it down, but this was just repulsive. I had the chicken removed from the bill since I could only take a bite, but I did reluctantly finish my plain spaghetti. My girlfriend had sushi that was fresh from the local gas station pre-made sushi freezer, and it tasted as such. View was fantastic, service was acceptable, price was high, and good lord the food was so horrible.
author: Cal C.

description: It was okay. Not the greatest and was very disappointed. We are from Denver and we have had better sushi and service there than at this location. We got the dynamite mussels, dynamite tempura roll, and catapillar roll. The mussels were small. The caterpillar roll was not as colorful as most others, especially when it's suppose to be topped with 5 different fish. The sushi rolls were very thin and small. Just wasn't impressed for it being a sushi spot on the pier.
author: Thuy N.

description: Best scallop cocktail I have ever had in my life! The view is amazing, the food is superb, the waitress service is amazing and the prices are very acceptable for quality food! Overall 10/10; would recommend!!
author: Rob G.

description:
One of the worst food in all of mankind. Disgusting excuse for Japanese food. The beef teriyaki tasted so old. The shrimp tempura was 90 percent batter. 

waste of money period k thx bye
author: Leslie M.

description: Seriously one of the best views in the city combined with a friendly staff and awesome food. I highly recommend.
author: Glenn W.

description: Great positive experience here with my family and the food was great.  Can't wait to come back.
author: Josh R.

description: Great view and location. Angie, the owner, is great and took amazing care of us. Johnathan was our waiter and was prompt and very nice. Can't wait to go back.
author: Jeff C.

description:
Yes - we went to one of the most touristy places in The City... But we were not disappointed. I don't think you will be either. 

This is the last place on the pier and we were skeptical for obvious reasons, but tired and hungry from the long walk from our hotel. Immediately I noticed the prices were reasonable, most rolls were less than $15 and the portions were generous. 

Our server was extremely friendly and attentive. 

We had the Yellow tail sashimi, snow crab sashimi, lion king roll and cherry blossom roll. All were delicious, well portioned and fairly priced. I highly recommend both rolls as they were fresh and flavorful. 

This isn't the most authentic sushi place, but considering the location it is very good. The 3 and a half stars are low considering the great quality and fantastic service.
author: Jason M.

description:
Two stars is basically for the view. I went with a party of 5 the restaurant was fairly empty and we had to wait to be seated. We were seated at a table the was big enough for 4 didnt think much of it till the food came and the table was cramped.

Prior to entering we looked at the menu posted outside. It was late afternoon and we asked the hostess if lunch was still being served. She informed us lunch and dinner was available.

We get our menus and its a dinner menu I told our server I wanted a bento box from the lunch menu he said ok let me ask. He comes back and says they are only serving dinner. So we didn't want to make a fuss and ordered from the dinner menu.

I ordered the vegetable tempura and a california roll. I recieved my roll and was very dissapointed. How can you mess up a california roll? Every piece fell apart and the taste was nothing special. Our server brings out my tempura and the table is full not much room, so as he puts my plate down he drops pieces of it on the table. I just looked up at him and he says sorry and jets away. Didn't see him again till he brought our check. 

He double printed the check of another party and handed one copy to me. I looked it over and it was way more then ours would have been. I'm glad I checked. So I waited till I saw him again to tell him, then waited for him to print the proper bill. Paid and was on my way. Next time I'm on pier 39 I will not be eating there. Food is mediocre at best portions seem a bit small and the service was not good.
author: Julie L.

description:
Wish I knew why a lot of people complain??
I rest my case with the following "AMAZING SUSHI"
author: Juan B.

description: First time here at Pier 39 and tried out this Japanese Restaurant. Overall, it was a great restaurant with a beautiful view! I loved it. Food was good even though it's pricey but well worth it. Also service was great too. 4 stars!:) Will come back next time!
author: Jessie C.

description: The food is comparable  to what you would buy at the supermarket but in smaller pottions. Service was absolutely horrendous, everything was served at different times and served incorrectly never once we're we offered a refill or even if we were ok. We talked to a Manger who didn't seem to care less. Don't waste your time or money at this establishment your better off getting a sushi roll at 7/11
author: Stephen A.

description: Would I come back? NO. Tourist spot and first available Japanese restaurant we saw. Too pricey for what we ordered. There are several japanese restos in SF that I would visit before coming back here. Spent over $200 for 3 adults and 1 infant. Not impressed.
author: Miguel Y.

description: Very fresh sushi, This place has really great happy hour. Every seat has an amazing view of GGB and Alcatraz, must see it to believe it!
author: Vincenzo C.

description:
The two stars are merely for friendly service and the view. 

From the very beginning you could tell this isn't a really great restaurant. They brought the water out with little to no ice in it. Something as simple as iced water was already messed up. 

The sushi rolls were priced pretty high so I was expecting them to look amazing. But I was wrong... They looked like they tasted nothing special. And I must add that the portions were very small. Each sushi roll was over a dollar and close to 2 for the special rolls. (According to my cousins)

I stayed away from the sushi rolls knowing the portions would be too small. I ordered the fish and chips, also a disappointment. Though the fish was crispy everything on the plate was underseasoned. Fries, fish and vegies all bland. Thats the only way to describe it. Bland. 

Avoid this place. Save your money.
author: Evan D.

description: ordered four sushi rolls (did not come as described TWICE) and two appetizers (chicken and spring rolls). chicken appetizer was chewy and tasted gamey. food is inedible. sent food back and still charged us full priced. do not recommend. waiter was very sweet but the owner was greedy and cared more about getting the money than the quality of the food and service.
author: Morgan L.

description:
The views along the windows are AWESOME!, but that is about it, we tried a few bento boxs and a roll, prices are what you expect do to the location, food was nothing to brag about. I think I would return just for the view, happy hour options are really not that great if you think about other spots you have been to that offer happy hour appetizers and drink specials.

Check out the view, great location if you want to see Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge if it allows itself to be seen.
author: Sal M.

description: This place is the worst Japanese restaurant I have ever had my wife asked the waitress if the cooked with msg. And she claimed to not even know what msg was. I find that hard to beieve. And never gave us a yes or know answer.  Then we got our food and the portion was tiny and tasted mediocre.  Very pricey as well. Went home and me and my wife were both puking by 1am. Save yourself from getting sick and don't go here.
author: Mike C.

description: Came here for an afternoon snack after Super Bowl City. Happy Hour lasts quite a while so we got some drinks, gyoza and mixed tempura. I had the lychee rendezvous which was flavorful and refreshing. Hubby had a Pacifico, as usual. The food was tasty, only a little cold. The service was a little slow but I enjoyed my company so all in all, I would call it a pleasant afternoon experience.
author: Megan M.

description: I am a huge sushi fan, and the food here is outstanding! Not to mention the view is breathtaking, no matter where you are in the restaurant. The staff is so friendly and attentive, no matter who you talk to! And they are so accommodating to their guests! I have been here many times, and will continue to come, and recommend to anyone!!
author: Shannon L.

description:
All I can say is that this place does not know customer service and AVOID THIS PLACE if there are any events or when you expect large crowds. They're HORRIBLE and food is not even that good.
 
We were told wait time is an hour. I don't mind waiting but we waited for almost 2 hours for nothing. The girl at the front said they don't list the names and just wait on the side and they'll call whoever is there. People who came after us got seated before us. We only got seated because I was already upset and about to raise hell (I was hungry!). They even asked us to pay another $50 to get seated. When we got seated, table is not even clean from the previous guests. The server spilled soup onto my friend (who is visiting from Texas). The server broke the bowl and didnt event take it and clean it up. Just left the whole mess there. So shameful! Didn't even apologize. Even if we waited for a long time, we still ended up leaving and going next door! Yes, we got seated but there's no menu even after about 10-15mins of sitting. We don't want to wait for another couple of hours for our orders to be placed and another hour before they serve the food. We'd rather go someplace else with a better service and better food. Hana Zen's staffs are very RUDE and inhospitable!
 
We used to love Hana Zen at Pier 39 but this place has gone downhill and we are NEVER going back to this place again!
author: Ahnne V.

description: 2 stars only for the view. Service was okay. However, food was awful. Cooking your food on a lava rock is interesting however gets cold after about ten minutes leaving you with a very rare steak. Stay away unless for some beer or sushi.
author: Matt M.

description:
Went during the July 4th holiday weekend.  My friends and I enter around 11:45am. We could see a few customers dining and we wait by the front. There is no hostess there to seat us.  Looking towards the back, we see a bunch of staff talking and joking around...not professional.  We finally get seated after we get their attention.

Overall,the best thing about this restaurant is the location. Great views of the SF Bay!
We ordered a variety of sushi and bento boxes.  Sushi was fresh and presented nicely. Bento boxes were okay...the best thing about them was the Miso soup (which doesnt say much).

The staff were fair. Ours was pleasant but not very professional and definitely needed some basic training on how to serve customers.

This place has A LOT going for it but it's just not there.  Would I come back?  No.
author: SF C.

description: Unbelievable, first the place was so hot it was unbearable. Then the bathroom was a mess, we had a server who has no idea what fried rice was or the ingredients. The server took forever and never brought our waters. I had to go find someone to get the waters. It was miserable!
author: Corrina E.

description:
We went to Hana Zen yesterday evening ... I know remember why we don't eat at many places on Pier 39. We waited at the hostess desk for 15 minutes while the hostess cleared tables to be able to seat us (we where a party of three). When she took us to the table there was no app plates, napkins anything. When I went to sit on the booth seat it was covered in rice. We waited another 10 minutes for the waiter to even acknowledge us, never asked if we would like water or something to drink. When he finally did come over and take the drink order, we went ahead and ordered our food. I asked a simple question of what the seafood that was listed in a salad was and all he could say was shrimp, well when you think of seafood it is more then just shrimp. So decided to pass. We ordered 3 rolls and some garlic noodles. Thirty minutes later empty drinks and still no food. Ten minutes later food arrive, the 3 separate rolls we ordered arrived on the same plate and he had trouble telling us what was what. Never bothered to asked if we would like anything else to drink. We couldn't even ask because as soon as he said the plates down he rushed away. The place was not that busy there was 10-15 empty tables. The rolls where poorly rolled (very loose) and bland, not very fresh for what you expect in San Francisco. We gave up trying to order anything else to drink as we didn't want to wait another 30 minutes. 15 minutes after we had finished eating I finally asked for the check. 5 minutes later received it $62 dollars for 3 small rolls, a small portion of garlic noodles, a soda, and two beers. Not worth the cost. Sat another 15 minutes waiting for the waiter to take the check, asked the hostess that was yet again clearing a table if she could run it for us so we could leave, she said sure no problem, looked at the check and then went and handed it to the waiter, whom took another 10 minutes to bring it back to us... Slowest, poor service ever. Almost 2 hours for 3 rolls and some noodles. 

This will not be on our to go to list again... I would suggest anyone wanting sushi to go over to Chinatown. Much better prices, quality and service. 

There view is the only thing worth anything and the happy hour menu seems cool but only available in bar which you can not sit at if you have someone under age with you (we had my 13 year old nephew with us).
author: Misty L.

description: Brought my family here for an anticipated nice lunch as my wife and I celebrate our 2nd year wedding anniversary with the kids. What a disappointment it turned out. The host failed to deliver our drinks until we got served our food. My wife had to wait an extra 10minutes because they missed her order and the appetizer never showed. Food is mediocre at the very least .will never return and will not recommend . Very disappointing . Would not have given it any star if I didn't have to.
author: Rowena K.

description: Great food, wonderful staff and the view is an experience you have to add to your list when your visiting Pier 39.  I had the Ahi Tuna.  It was super fresh and satisfying:)
author: Edelith O.

description: We waited over 15 minutes to even be seen by a waiter after being seated. I had to flag someone down to get drinks. Waiters were wandering aimlessly and not seeing to their customers. After finally being able to place our order, appetizers and our dishes all came out at the same time. The calamari tasted like its been sitting under a heat lamp and my baked salmon roll cane out cold. Not only this, but after eating our meal we see that there is a poor food safety warning!!! Stay clear of this place. There are many many other delicious places to eat in San Francisco. Don't waste your time here. Enjoy delicious food, good ambiance, and good service elsewhere.
author: Jess B.

description:
Avoid this place!

When we asked if we could get some of the specials posted at the door, our server replied that it was only for the bar, not the dining area.

The sushi is terrible quality (alot of rice but not alot of meat) and overpriced due to touristy location ($7/roll...typically $5-$6 in other Midwest, East Coast, and West Coast areas).  Not sure if it was a good or bad thing we only got 6 pieces per maki roll (salmon avocado and California).  On top of that, the pickled ginger looked like it was reused...maybe due to slow business?  There was only a hand full of tables in there during a 2pm weekday lunch for a packed tourist location.

One of us ordered the fish and chips but had to send it back to the kitchen because of hair we found fried into the batter.  Server did apologize but it didn't end the awkward moment from then on.  Think he was trying to avoid our table out of sheer embarrassment.

Only thing going for this place is the view of the harbor, Alcatraz, and tourists below.

Should have tried out the Fog Harbor Fish House at the start of the pier instead.  Place looked way busier, had a better interior, and probably had better food for the price.  If you really are craving sushi or other real Japanese dishes, just hop on a Muni bus to Japantown (area near intersection of Post and Fillmore) which is only about a few miles away.
author: Julio F.

description: 3 stars with the help of the amazing view and the ambience. This place is definitely overpriced and without their good location, they probably won't stand a chance compared to the other good japanese spots in the bay. I get that Pier 39 is a tourist spot and everything's expensive in the area but that's not an excuse for their mediocre food.
author: Angel Y.

description: Random trip to SF.  Ended up going to Hana Zen on an a whim.  We ended up "crashing" a 97th birthday party.  It was packed but we were still seated immediately.   Service was awesome.  The owner brought us birthday cake.  Sushi rolls were so good we had to order more.  We will definitely be back!  Felt like family, lots of fun!
author: Terri M.

description: Worst Japanese restaurant ever!! Worst customer service. Took 30 min to take our orders when thee was only four tables. I'll never come back here again!!!
author: Adrian A.

description: Five star Japanese restaurant! Went there last evening for some great sushi and sashimi. Happy Hour prices are ALL DAY LONG. NO KIDDING! Affordable and fresh and tasty dishes. Great service from everyone and the beautiful owner, Angie, even stopped by to say hello. She greets everyone with a smile. The house choice of Chardonnay is unbelievable...you must try it....The views are TO DIE FOR..right on the Bay and you can see forever, even seals swimming near the dock. Go there now!
author: Angel P.

description: Terrible service, food was mediocre at best, ordered a Sierra Nevada Pale Ale and got something that definitely wasn't that, and they argued when I tried to tell them it was wrong, but that's my favorite beer; I know the difference.  Then they completely forgot one of our entrees, and we thought they had forgotten our sushi order as well so we just finished our main courses so we could leave quicker...  and then the sushi showed up, as if it were dessert.  We cancelled that because it had taken too long, at least they didn't argue over that.  Then when the bill arrived they had charged me for a Sapporo beer.  So, order one beer, get a different one, get charged for a third.  The only reason we went in was because it was the only place without a wait; now we know why, should've taken it as a warning.  Avoid at all costs.  Not that it will matter much, I'll be amazed if this place is still there the next time we go to Pier 39.
author: Joshua W.

description:
Nice place. You can have a great view of Alcatraz here. 

Stopped for a quick bite. Ended up getting the spicy California roll and an avocado roll. Both were really well prepared. Would come back again.
author: Kian C.

description:
Food was ok, obviously over priced cuz of the location. The main reason for the one star:  TERRIBLE SERVICE.  Once we sat down, we waited 20 minutes for someone to take our order. What pissed me off more was that I asked 2 different waitresses for help, they both said they had to get my server, both never did!

When our server came, she said sorry. But when she took our order, she didn't offer any tea or water.  Fine, bus boy finally grabs some water for me and my family. Food comes and she didn't give us the miso soup, side salad, or rice!!!  My husband asked for those 3 things and she said they don't come with the entree. WTF!!  She said she'd get a bowl of rice and a bowl of miso. I grab a menu and read that it comes with rice, salad, and miso soup. Then she forgot our sushi order.  Never came, I asked for it and she said, oh yeah and went to put in the order. Freakin terrible. 

The biggest server fail:  I spill some of my water on the table. I stop the first server I see, say I'm sorry but can I have extra napkins, she looks at me, goes to the back and...Nothing!  She walks by our table with food for another table. I said 'excuse me, can I get napkins please' again and she walks right by. Freakin ridiculous.
author: Jen A.

description: I very rarely am on this side of the city, but a friend was visiting from Australia so we were at Fisherman's Wharf. We came around 1:30 and the restaurant was mostly empty, so we experienced no service issues. We ordered: Lion King Roll, Inari, salmon avocado & the Albacore toro. Everything was very fresh, and delectable. I was not expecting such good food from a place at the wharf! And the view ? AMAZING.
author: Ericka M.

description: We were seated very promptly but that was the only efficient service we received. Waited 20 mins before anyone even came to our table. Once order was taken the drinks took another 20 mins to arrive  and the food took 30 mins in total. The restaurant was not busy yet the service was absolutely awful. The food was good but not fantastic. The view is amazing. A very poor experience. Would never go back.
author: Grant K.

description: We had an excellent experience! The bartender was great, as well as the food. We thoroughly enjoyed our whole experience and would recommend it!
author: C T.

description:
Family and I came here this past Saturday for a late impromptu dinner. We came here b/c they have late dining and plus there's space for the nephew downstairs to run around in case he melts down.

Forgot our server's name but he was Filipino and accommodated ALL of our request. Thank you for that.

Food wise: they don't have the yakitori menu b/c apparently they only have that in their main res downtown due to charcoal and grilling. If that's the case, as a suggestion: make a note of it on the menu and or change the menu! 

I ordered their "Hana Zen" special with Beef Teriyaki and Pork Cutlet. Folks, really think about ordering this because it's two meals in one! The portion isn't bento box like and the price isn't cheap as well. 

First came the beef: it was probably the fattest beef teriyaki I've eaten in a long time. I picked right through it. It wasn't tender at all... Wasn't a big fan.

The pork cutlet came a few minutes later and I guess it really wasn't a "tonkatsu" b/c it didn't have the sauce. It was actually just deep fried pork. It was bland. 

Overall... you get what you paid for: a tourist attraction meal. Not sure what our bill came out to be but my Dad took care of it... Thanks Pops! We'll probably not come back anytime soon...
author: Cath M.

description: My co-workers and I dropped by this spot on a whim while walking around Pier 39. The food here is alright and the prices are a bit steep, but that's expected considering the location. The only thing really going for it is the view; on a clear day, the place has a really nice view of the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz. Our hostess was very friendly as well. Overall there's nothing really to rave about or complain about based on my experience.
author: Brian C.

description:
This is a chain, right? It feels really chain-ish.

If you're a fan of sushi, do NOT come here! The sushi was pretty bad. I'd give them 1/5, maybe 2/5 stars tops, if I were only rating the sushi. It didn't taste like it was at the peak a freshness, but it wasn't unfresh either. It just wasn't good. It wasn't made well. It didn't taste great. It was just meh. I've given similar sushi meals higher star ratings because other spots have lower prices. At the prices here, my standards must rise with the price. That's fair, right?

I did love the drinks.
Well, I only had one drink during the happy hour and I thought that was yummy!

I did love the deserts.
I had several plates and I'd easily give them all 4/5 stars! 

I did love the view.
It's Pier 39! Of course there's a view!

Overall, I don't love it. It's a cute place to visit for drinks, deserts, ambiance, and a view. If you're hankering for good sushi, head over to Japantown. It'll be worth the trek.
author: Helen L.

description: Swung on Sunday.  At first I was thinking the place is going to suck, but, I was pleasantly surprised!  The food was yummy and the view was really awesome!   There's plenty of seating, the bathrooms were clean, layout was spacious, the waitress was just ok, but the menu had lots of options, and they had lots of specialty drinks.  FYI... Things add up fast here, so be prepared to spend some $$$.
author: Mike M.

description:
1 Star for the view of the bay and clean restroom.  

Service was terrible with wait staff not getting correct orders taken or delivered to correct person at table. Each time a dish came out, they would ask who ordered it. Over 20 minutes elapsed from 1st entree to last entree being served.
 
Sea Bass appeared to be the best entree. Ordered Zen Combo of Shrimp Tempura and Pork Katsu. Very disappointing. Tempura was cold and soggy. Katsu was also cold. Portions were average at best. Three of us ordered Shrimp Tempura and each order looked different and consisted of different vegetables. 

Deserts of Green Tea Ice cream and  "Too much" Ginger Cream Bur-lee were okay. 

Restroom was clean and tidy.

Too many other dining options in area to go back.
author: Buster B.

description: Location is good. But food not cooked thoroughly and came cold to us. Very over priced for the quality and quantity
author: Baltazar B.

description: Worst service ever!  Our food came out at different times, the avocado was raw, most of us were done eating before one of us received their food.  When we asked to speak to the manager, we were told that there was only 1 manager for the whole store and they were out with the flu.  Service was TERRIBLE!   Don't eat here!  Food was alright but extremely expensive!   Find somewhere else!
author: Cameron T.

description: Came with party of 11.  They sat us quickly but portions were small for a big price. We waited for 1 hour and half for our food to come out and they end up forgetting 2 of the orders. they claimed that they forgot. We will never go back to this place ever again since they failed to do the simplest thing, to get the food out  in a timely manner.
author: Joanne P.

description:
First, let me begin by saying the view is unbelievable.  It's the perfect place to enjoy the bay with the bae :) haha! 
I ordered the mango mojito which was good but tasted a little watered down.  For my meal, I ordered 3 special rolls: SPICY TUNA ROLL, SUNSET STRIP [wrapped in cucumber], & the LION KING.  The food was good but I was really impressed by the customer service here.  The waiter was extremely kind and was attending to all our needs.  Definitely, a cute place to take a date and gaze at the beautiful view.
author: Diana S.

description:
Sadly, Hana Zen at Pier 39 has gone downhill. The last two times I've been there, the sushi was just mediocre at best. It certainly isn't worth the prices we paid, which is disappointing considering just how good it was the first couple of times we went.

Definitely likely to skip Hana Zen from now on.
author: Kristie L.

description: This place honestly has the worst service ever. The sushi is alright, but it's way over priced. They charge you automatically 18% gratuity, and they made us wait a long time for seating, even though there was no one in the restaurant. You also have to eat a minimum of $20, and most of their rolls are only $12. I will never ever come back here, especially with their terrible service.
author: Dani Y.

description:
Went in with a group of friends for sake, as I had gone there before and had a good experience with their sake flights. When we got there, we were seated promptly, but given one menu to share among the six of us. When we started asking our waitress about the drinks, she mentioned that being a very busy weekend, they were out of one or two of the sake that was in the flight we wanted to try. She went back to the bar to inquire what sake was available, and she came back with a bar menu that had only four types of sake on there and said this was all they had. But it had no prices. So we asked for more information, but she came back with two bottles, and told us this was all what they were going to give us. We understood that it was a busy weekend, but regardless, the waitress didn't feel it important to give us the list of options we wanted to purchase, and pretty much forced mediocre choices on us. It seemed that as our inquiries progressed about getting sake, the options they allowed us to purchase became fewer, until finally we pretty much had no choice at all. Never got a straight answer as to what was actually available until they told us "this is all we're going to serve you."

These place leverages their good location and don't really care about hospitality or the service experience. We decided to avoid the food, as their health score was poor and for a sushi place, that seemed a little unbelievable that it's not been closed down. Between their service and quality of food, their location would be better served as a parking lot. We need those more in SF, not shitty sushi places.
author: Hannah L.

description: I'm a native to San Francisco and I enjoy the wonderful restaurants SF has to offer even at the tourists traps. This is NOT a good restaurant. My friends and I went on Sunday and were extremely disappointed. An empty restaurant that couldn't accommodate 6 people by the window which is fine but we couldn't enjoy happy hour cause they wouldn't seat us in that designated area. The sad part of this is the service and food. They were out of certain drinks (all IPA and corona and some mango drink) the ones we did order had more ice than drink. They were out of ribs and sea bass. We waited 45 minutes for some food to arrive. They served 2 people first and the rest of us waited quite some time. That is poor etiquette specially for the prices they charge ($271). I've visited many Japanese restaurants and for this place to try and fit under that umbrella is a farce. No class or hospitality. I don't mind paying at all but not for this. Then of course they include the tip in the bill ($38) which if I could have it would have been $0. They take advantage of tourists apparently. To close they try and sell us a post card of a pic they took of us. No way! We asked them to use our camera to take a pic of us and the lady said she didn't know how to use it...guess what she was using the exact same camera! WTH! Zero Stars. Don't visit.
author: Roger H.

description:
AWFUL service
Edemame was literally frozen when they brought it out, and when we spoke to a woman about it she took one off of the plate we were eating it from and tried it herself!The waiter walked away when I was talking to him. 
NEVER COMING BACK HERE!!!!
author: Tasha B.

description: No stars! Terrible service! Over priced food for such little proportions! Can at least reassure their customers if their really that "busy" (there were a lot of empty tables!) Need to be taught on how to do perfect customer service!
author: Angelina L.

description:
I got a gift certificate to this place and really enjoyed the experience.  It's a bit of a hassle to get to, because it's at the very end of pier 39 but once you've made the trek, you won't regret it.  They have great views of Alcatraz, the GG bridge and the sailboats in the bay.  Surprisingly, the place wasn't so packed with tourists either (although that's obvious variable).

I'm vegetarian, so options in a sushi restaurant are already limited, but lo and behold! They had a vegetarian bento box with generous portions of inari, cucumber and avocado sushi, salad, tempura and rice.  Also ordered a lychee cocktail, it was just right - not too sweet and not to strong either.  

I highly recommend Hana Zen, great food, great views, great service!
author: Lea F.

description: What an amazing atmosphere!! We just had happy hour appetizers in the bar with an amazing view of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate bridge.. skip the restaurant's in the front and enjoy the harbor!! Service was spot on....and they don't only serve fish!!
author: Shawna S.

description:
This place had some of the best sushi I've ever had. The sushi was rolled to perfection and was very delicious. I highly recommend the Lion King which had crab meat, and baked salmon and the spicy tuna roll.  The views of the pier and bay are awesome from inside of the restaurant. 

I would definitely visit here again whenever I am in San Francisco.
author: Corey E.

description: Everything about our visit here was on point. The fried calamari appetizer was hands-down the best we've ever had.  We also ordered sushi and the volcanic rock chicken.  Both tasted amazing!  The views of the bay are spectacular, and our server was wonderfully polite.  Wished we lived in SF so we could visit again and bring friends!
author: Jason C.

description:
We came here on a Monday afternoon for my best friends birthday.  We didn't have reservations but the place wasn't busy at all. 

We were seated right away, but noticed a table open up by the window and asked our waiter if we could move and he said yes, he just needed to inform the hostess. We moved and were then confronted by a sour-faced hostess who said "Next time, you need to let me know when you move to a different table, I have to enter it into the computer"... well if I was planning on coming back, I probably won't now because of your RUDE comment and TONE. 

Our server was friendly but busy. We had a flag him down to get a refill on water/ soda. 

The food was really good, you can order any sushi with soy wrap (but there is a $2.00 fee for that). It's fresh, made on the spot, can't beat that. 

Views were beautiful, well worth it. 

Personally I won't be going back simply because of the rude hostess, if it wasn't for her, this would be a 4 star review with a definite yes on attending again, shame she had to ruin it for us.
author: Meghan L.

description: Fantastic sushi. Easy to get reservations. Loved sitting by the windows and looking at bay sunset.
author: Jennifer N.

description: Hubby and I stopped by for lunch while vacationing in San Francisco. We sat at a window table with an awesome view of the bay. The restaurant was surprisingly empty considering the view location on pier 39. We ordered the teriyaki chicken bento box with tempura, California rolls, rice, and a salad with no dressing. The teriyaki chicken was terrible. So bad we couldn't eat it. We should have sent it back. The tempura was sub par, the California rolls were sub par, and the salad had no dressing. We had to ask the waitress to bring a side of dressing. The service was sub par. Our water glasses were never refilled. Not worth the $17.95 charged for each bento box. This is actually the worst Japanese restaurant we have ever been to, and we love Japanese food. To top it all off we were charged a Healthy SF fee of $1.88. I asked the waitress what this was and she said it was for health insurance and that all the restaurants charge this. I told her that we had been to many San Francisco restaurants during our stay and this was the first one that charged us this fee. What a crock. Why is it our responsibility to pay for someone else's health insurance. We did not appreciate them charging this to us without our permission. It should be our choice whether we want to contribute or not. It's not a lot of money, but it's the principal. I also wonder if the money is actually used toward health insurance, or pocketed by the restaurant. All that set aside, we had terrible food and terrible service. There are so many exceptional restaurants in San Francisco with a view, I would not recommend this one. This restaurant is not fit for us foodies and our foodie friends. We will never return.
author: Sue C.

description:
Had a dinner with coworkers couple of days ago. Great restaurant with beautiful view, delicious food and perfect customer service!   We ordered rolls and salads, we basically tried the whole menu! Can't decide what was the most delicious one because everything was too good! 
Again, very friendly personnel, great food and incredible view!
author: Veronica T.

description: Food was mediocre at best. View of the bay is stunning. Overpriced for what you get, but I guess that's expected at the Pier. Would not come back, unless just for a drink.
author: Neda M.

description:
If you want to be a tourist for a day, craving Japanese food with a Fantastic view of Alcatraz and Golden Gate Bridge, then this is the place to be. You will be paying for the view for sure but once in a while this is a great escape. It makes you appreciate how beautiful San Francisco really is. We reminiscence about our childhood playground, Pier 39. The high diving act behind the merry go round, the video arcade area that is now the Hard Rock Cafe, Mrs Fields cookies, and Boudins all brought back those fond memories. 

The quality of the sushi here is surprisingly good. You figure you come to a tourist trapped area like Pier 39 and you don't expect the food to be good. I was wrong. I have been to the Hana Zen in downtown and they have always been very consistent. Also, you gotta understand that coming to Pier 39, the price is going to be higher than your typical Japanese restaurant.  If you can accept that, then this is not a bad escape from your everyday mundane life. 

What to get? 

Grilled rack of lamb............came with a nice crust and cooked perfectly 
Spicy tuna...........it's your average spicy tuna roll, but I liked it. 
Salmon sashimi.........fantastic, fresh, and presented very well 
Lion roll............this was amazing. I'm a sucker for these types of rolls 
Hamachi Kama.......It was the star of the night. Must get!!! 
Uni.....................fresh and creamy 
Beef tatake..........the ponzu and pepper really worked with this dish 
Toro belly.............It was very good and again, I was very surprised of the quality 

Overall, a very impressive dinner!!!
author: jason g.

description: Stopped by to ask for reservations at the window.  My wife's birthday. When seated, no window.  Either provide what you promise or don't bother promising!
author: Mitchell T.

description:
Overrated, clap clap clap clap clap

Seriously, this place was a disappointment. Came here with the bf for dinner on a Saturday night. We got there at 7:30 and the place was practically empty. Over the next hour and we begrudgingly ate what they served us, hardly another table was filled. Says something about a restaurant when on a Saturday night at peak dining hours the place is only about 30% full. 

I ordered a glass of cab and the bf got a Sapporo. So far so good.

We ordered edamame for an appetizer, and a Sunset Strip, and a Spicy Shrimp Tempura roll. Since both rolls were specialty rolls, which are generally larger, we thought this would be enough.

First major failure - the first item we got was the Sunset Strip. This was 5 pieces of small cubes of fish wrapped in cucumber. I thought this would come with some other filler, but no, it was glorified (expensive) nigiri. And only 5 small pieces.

After seeing this tragic roll and scarfing it down, we realized we would be starving without something else, so we quickly ordered a Spicy Tuna roll to supplement. 

Ordered after, the Spicy Tuna was the next thing to come out. It was ok, quite spicy, but overall just ok. 2.5 stars.

FINALLY, 2 out of 3 rolls down, our edamame comes out. Great, we finally get to snack on our appetizer.

Lastly, the Spicy Shrimp Tempura roll comes out. This is the only saving grace of this restaurant. It was good. 4 stars for this roll alone.

Thank god I had gotten an internet deal for $20 off our meal, cause had we paid full price for the worst service and food delivery I've ever experienced, I couldn't have given the saving grace extra star. 

I give this place 6 months, tops, before it's out of business. For the sake of all you nice diners out there, I hope it doesn't take that long.
author: Krista S.

description: If you have the option ask for Trang to be your server she is the very best I have ever come across. The sushi is fresh and tasty the view is wonderful so long as you get a table by the window. We sat for a couple hours and enjoyed the afternoon people watching and snacking while sipping on some wine. The place could use some good tea but other than that we enjoyed it because of Trang's service.
author: Paul W.

description:
Hanna Zen Pier--We visited the restaurant as our first stop on a nine-day trip to California. With a lot of great options in San Francisco, including many sushi restaurants, our expectations were high going into the meal and we were not disappointed.   

Hanna has two locations in the city and we visited the one on the end of Pier 39. The restaurant fit in the upscale casual market niche.  Our server, Sheryl, was doubling as hostess that evening, and immediately let us know that it was happy hour.  The bar was almost full, and she offered to let us have happy hour food and beverages at our table so we would not have to move.

We decided to go with a tapas style meal and choose different items to eat.  Our first three choices came off the happy hour menu and included traditional edammame ($4), a crunchy California roll ($6 for eight pieces) and a spicy tuna roll ($6 for six pieces). While all three were basic choices, the presentation of the two rolls showed the sushi chefs had some real skills.

They further showcased their abilities with our second course of sushi nigiri ($5.50-$8.50 for two pieces). All the fish was very fresh and perfectly sized.  We had yellowtail, white tuna belly and red snapper sashimi; with flying fish roe halibut and sea urchin sushi.  

Our final course included three items from the main menu appetizers section, Goma-ae ($4.95 Boiled Spinach Salad), Gyuhireniku Tataki ($7.95 Beef Carpaccio Japanese style) and Deep Fried Scallops($12).  Wow! The Carpaccio was presented in a mix of finely cut vegetable in a ponzu sauce that really popped in your mouth.  We wished there were more pieces to share.  The Goma-ae was served with a light sesame dressing with toasted sesame seeds on top.   The scallops  were a big surprise with the breading being a light Panko covering with a mild-spicy mayo on the side.  

Sheryl moved the meal along through each course which included wine and micro-brews from the bar.  She was great at balancing too much and too little attention to our experience.  There are no white table clothes on the table and you can dress evening casual to meals here.  The décor was more casual bar-like, but featured a quiet ambiance that allowed conversation at the table without raising your voice.  Oh yeah and the view, overlooks the San Francisco Bay.  We watched the sunset over the Golden Gate Bridge as the last boat chugged in from Alcatraz.  Give it a try you won't be disappointed.
author: Jon K.

description: Shortest line. Unfortunately understaffed. There's was a girl in white in the front who we thought was the hostess but she kind of just stood there and walked off without helping anyone. Then another girl came and attended us who said she was the hostess but since they were short staffed she was also a server. She was really nice. Not her fault the business looks a little discombobulated. The food was okay. The sushi was pretty small. Not the greatest. Nothing too amazing other than the view.
author: Brenda F.

description:
Incredible service, great sushi rolls, and a beautiful view.

Its located at the very end of the pier. A little hard to find but definately worth searching for. Its right on the water so you have an encridble view especially at sunset. If you love sushi and are looking for a relaxing dinner or lunch this is your place.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Great view and only reason we got here because other places were packed and our little toddler can't wait too long. 

Service was good. Food was so-so and not so impressive. Overpriced but not surprised at this location.
author: J G.

description: Horrible. This was the worst dinner we've had in SF. Seems like every possible thing they could mess up, they did. The rolls were pathetic. So small and missing rice in places. The seaweed looked old and the rolls even smelled funny. The size of the rolls is just embarassing. My son got chicken teriyaki that was so dry parts of it even were like charcoal. The rice tasted bad and was cold. How do you even mess up rice? I guess I shouldn't be surprised because they even managed to screw up WATER. Yeah. I was served a nice tall glass of warm water. Not room temputure. Actually warm. Seriously? Majorly regret ending our night with this place. Oh and the lady changing her kids diaper a few tables up really set the ambience. Who does that?
author: Andressa V.

description: This place is one of those tourist trap. The restaurant has a great view, you can see the alcatraz and golden gate bridge next to the window. sushi is alright, not the best, overpriced restaurant. I would recommend to go just for the view if you are a tourist, but if you want really good sushi go to other place.
author: Claire C.

description: Great Sushi.  Our Waitress Cheryl was amazing.  We were a good sized group of people and they handled us well.  Just make sure you call ahead to give them a chance to prep.  I highly recommend this restaurant for convention goers as the restaurant is right on the water with an amazing view of Alcatraz and the Bridge.  Try the Sweet Shrimp if you are a fan of Soft Shell Crabs.  The Pot Stickers were the best I've had, great appetizer.
author: Brian H.

description: I Will definitely recommend this place anyone who wants a great food,ambiance and service.
author: Erlyn R.

description:
Zen like.

Both the views out onto the bay and the minimalist Japanese accented bathroom.

Food was less so. Nothing memorable about the California or cucumber rolls. Crab meat with mayo in the former, namesake in the latter.

Reasonably priced at $6/roll. Service was quick and food came promptly.

Won't remember much about the meal. Impressed by everything else.
author: Jason B.

description: I came here for my birthday last year because the restaurant that I was supposed to eat at fell through. So my friend and I came here last minute at 7pm without a reservation, and there were hardly people in the restaurant. That should have told us to leave, but we were hungry. We were seated next to the window, and like many others have said, the view of the bay was beautiful. Other than that, there was nothing special about this restaurant. We ordered the soft shell crab tempura ($13.50), tempura udon ($14.50) , and a sushi combo ($28). The dinner came out to be $70. Very overpriced for the stuff we ordered. $14 for tempura udon??? -__- Everything was average tasting, but because the prices were so high, it made me dislike the place. Wouldn't come back here.. there are other places along the pier that are much more worth it for $70.
author: Amanda C.

description: I have high standards for sushi (I mean we all should, it's raw fish...)! My dad and I went to Hana Zen for his birthday. He happened to get a hotel in Fisherman's Wharf and we didn't want to pay for an Uber so we decided to eat close to his hotel. The main selling point of this place is the great view; you're basically sitting on top of the bay. However, the sushi was good, but not great. It's somewhere in between that regrettable sushi that spins around a bar on boats and a high-quality sushi restaurant. First of all, they put imitation crab in their rainbow roll....???? I am a sushi snob and I am going to judge any restaurant that condones that questionable, mayonnaisey, fish(?) mixture. Overall, the sushi was enjoyable, but I could tell it was not the highest quality of fish. My dad and I had a great time and between the two of us had 6 drinks (which were pretty tasty), but for the price, go somewhere else. Besides, if you want to experience the true flavor and culture of SF, stay far away from Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Nani S.

description: Sweet happy hour deals on the pier. Great views and awesome bartenders! Thanx for the sake bombs and sake guys.
author: Jenn R.

description:
I worked at peir 39 for about a month, and was able to receive discounts for lunch on almost all the restaurants here. So on one of the days I decided to come here. 

The waitress was super friendly. We chatted it up, and she gave me a few recommendations. For lunch, I ended up getting a teriyaki lunch set, which came with the soup and salad. I thought it was a good amount of food. Wasn't anything too special though. 

I haven't tried eating inside yet, but it seems like you would get a nice view. 

Overall the food is not too bad, I would probably try other restaurants around peir 39 though.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
I used to frequent the Wyland art gallery in this location on Pier 39.  They moved to another location, I was told by an employee, because the rent upstairs was so high.  Now if high-dollar art has trouble paying the bills, I was afraid to see the prices on this menu.

But I was pleasantly surprised!  NOT overpriced for the quality of food combined with the stellar view of San Francisco Bay.

This was our third stop for food of the day and I was not feeling particularly hungry, but I ate and ate because the quality of the food made my mouth so happy!

Hamachi collar with drinks were our starter.  The fish was tasty, though we have had better, we would order this item again.

Then we ordered a Lion King roll.  Four of us ate 2 bites each amid much appreciative moaning and demanded they bring us a second Lion King roll.

I tried to slow my bites on the second roll to extend the pleasure, but it went down just as quickly and deliciously as the first.

Japanese restaurants are not known for their dessert menu, but we ended our visit with 3 selections that the four of us shared and all three were good enough that I would order all of them again.

Ginger Crème brûlée was the crème de la crème!

Flourless chocolate cake was listed with coconut ice cream, but actually came with mango ice cream the night we were there - Oh Man!  ROCKED my chocolate loving heart.  The chocolate is decadent perfection married to the creamy mango goodness - LOVED this dessert!

Fried bananas were amazing.

Service was slow, but that gave us more time to enjoy the view and company.
author: Cyndi C.

description: Came here on Veterans Day as part of a group of roughly 100 or so & Alvin and his staff made sure we were taken care and give 5 star treatment! What an experience, thanks Alvin!
author: Dante M.

description: This place is really good! Close to some of the best I've ever had! Very fresh sushi and its nice to be able to have a good view of the bay. Unique rolls
author: Anne M.

description:
I gotta say - just based on the quality of food, I've NEVER liked this place.  I've been there about five times, though, because my co-workers seem to enjoy overpriced, ill-prepared, old fish.  But I digress. . . 

We were a party of four on our lunch break today.  Thursdays is supposed to be a 30% discount to other workers in the area at Hana Zen.  When we got there, I confirmed with the host that the 30% discount still applied.  Yes, it did.  First problem was the menu.  I had looked online beforehand and made this AWESOME spreadsheet.  When I say I looked online, I mean I looked on THEIR website.


Here is the contents of my spreadsheet:


Ika Maruyaka 12.00
Saba Nigiri  5.00
Tuna roll 5.75
Oshinko Moriawase 5.95
$28.70
FUN FACTOR: 10
BANG4BUK FACTOR: 4
$28.70 -  14 = 14.7
Conversion: 20 - 14.7 / 2 = 2.65  3/10

Vs

Chirashi Sushi 24.95
Oshinko Moriawase 5.95
$30.90
FUN FACTOR: 5
BANG4BUK FACTOR: 4
$30.90 - 9 = 21.9
Conversion: 20 - 21.9 / 2 =  -.95  0/10



Vs

Lunch menu: Zen's sushi combination (no avocado!) 16.95  
Oshinko Moriawase 5.95
$22.90
FUN FACTOR: 5
BANG4BUK FACTOR: 10
$22.90 - 15 = 7.9
Conversion: 20 - 7.9 / 2 =  6.05  6/10


Vs

Wakame Udon 9.50
Tuna roll 5.75
Oshinko Moriawase 5.95
$21.20
FUN FACTOR: 8
BANG4BUK FACTOR: 10
$21.20 - 18 = 3.2
Conversion: 20 - 3.2 / 2 =  8.4 = 8/10

When we got there, the waiter informed us that the menu had changed, so they didn't have the Oshinko Moriawase (mixed pickles) or the Ika Maruyaka (Squid skewers).  Actually, I don't think they menu has changed.  Now that I'm thinking about it, I think the waiter just wasn't familiar with the menu.  Also, there seemed to be a language barrier, but I'm not 100% sure.  Anyway, I ordered the Lunch menu: Zen's sushi combination and a seaweed salad.  

My co-workers ordered a few vegetarian sushi items from the menu.  One thing they ordered was two avocado rolls.  These are just like rice, seaweed, and avocado, and they're cheap.   

When our food came, their avocado rolls had magically morphed into salmon and avocado rolls.  They told the waiter they ordered just avocado, but the waiter didn't seem to understand at first, and then he didn't seem to know what to do, so as the situation got more and more of a hassle, they just said they would take the salmon/avocado rolls so to avoid wasting food.  I should add, one co-worker doesn't want to eat salmon for ethical reasons, but he'd rather eat it than have it thrown out.  The other co-worker doesn't like raw salmon.  

SO, they took the rolls.  The waiter seemed relieved.

The food was predictably dreadful.  (And the company was predictably delightful, THANK GOD FOR THAT).

When the bill came, we were noticed we weren't comped the 30% discount (a main factor in our deciding to go there, by the way), and my co-workers were surprised to see that they were charged for two salmon avocado rolls @ almost $7 dollars each rather than two of the cheaper $5 avocado rolls. (I think that's still too much, but whatever).  Taking the salmon was kind of a hardship for them.  They just ate it to make things easier.  No one thought they'd be charged a higher price on top of that.

I took the bill back to the waiter and explained to him that we should get a 30% discount on Thursdays due to a local merchant agreement. And I pointed on the bill where he'd billed us for the more expensive sushi we didn't order.  My co-workers didn't want to make a big deal out of it, so I just told him that they didn't really want the salmon, and they just took it as a favor, so it didn't seem fair to charge them for something more expensive than what they actually ordered, particularly since they only took it so it wouldn't go in the trash.  

He returned with the re-worded bill.  Still being charged for the choked-down salmon, and the discount? now upped from 0% to 15%.

We left because it was a pleasant lunch and we didn't want to ruin it by bickering over ten or twelve bucks.

I will probably avoid going back to this place.  There are three other sushi places in walking distance, and two of them are very good and good value for money with attentive service.
author: C S.

description:
Had our 25th wedding anniversary last Feb 2013 and my sister in law's 65th bday celebration here yesterday. We had the entire restaurant for our 25th anniversary for 130pp and it was everything we ever imagined. Buffet, wine, dance floor, video and cake.  Michael was the general manager and wonderful to work with.

MENU:
-Soup/Salad
-Chicken karaage
-Garlic noodles
-Salmon & Chicken teriyaki
--Tonkatsu
-Tofu Steak
-Steamed vegetables
-Mixed tempura
-Rice

For my sister in law's bday, we had a section reserved along the window views. Angie is  accommodating, patient and easy to work with. We couldn't have been more pleased with the level of service and quality of food. Of course, the location of the restaurant and views are phenomenal! 

Thank you to Angie and staff for a memorable celebration. Looking forward to dining here more often. Since Pier 39 is a very busy place, reservations ahead of time is highly recommended, especially for a big party. Otherwise, expect a wait. Enjoy your dining experience!
author: Josephine M.

description:
The view here is gorgeous! Inside and out. 

The ambiance inside the restaurant is very open, refined, zen like and sophisticated. One glance at this venue  and I imagined it to be an awesome location if it were to be converted to an upscale lounge after hours. The exterior displays a direct view of Alcatraz from afar and the Golden Gate bridge in the mist of  SF fog.

Compared to the Hana Zen in downtown, this venue is quite extravagant.  I favor the downtown Hana Zen because I frequent it after my shopping excursions and the staff is just amazing there. Arthur rocks!

My friend and I ordered the Kobe beef, sunrise roll, dragon roll, and a sashimi platter.  I noticed that the menu incorporated a few new rolls here. I highly recommend the dragon roll which is my all time favorite. If you like spicy, ask for a side of hot sauce. It makes a wonderful combination instead of wasabi. The price is also a tad bit higher but what do you expect for any restaurant at Pier 39. In terms of the quality of the food, it is comparable to the other Hana Zen which I very much enjoy. The sashimi was also very fresh. Bonus points! 

The service was superb and overall my first experience here was awesome. If anyone if seeking a top quality Japanese restaurant  with a beautiful view in the town of tourist, look no further! Clam chowder is good but miso is even better on a cold day.
author: Jeanne L.

description:
Really nice view.  Hana Zen is a good place to take your visiting cousin from Kansas, or, if you're feeling mean, your landlocked in-laws from Modesto, so you can show them what they're missing in the city.

The sushi and sashimi are fresh, as you would expect in San Francisco, but the rolls are uninspired and most of the rest of the food is mediocre or worse.  Tempura, fried oysters, etc. are unusually greasy here, dessert options are pretty limited, and...well, I guess coffee isn't really a Japanese thing, but then, neither is Hana Zen, so it'd be nice to be able to get a cup, you know?  My impression is that the dessert and coffee shortcomings are intentional, to help Hana Zen turn tables during the summer and on weekends.

The waitstaff is pleasant enough, but they're one of those groups that tries and fails to keep up on busy nights, and makes themselves scarce so they can BS in the back on slow nights.  Either way, you get lousy service.  They'd sell a lot more sake if they actually checked back with you once in a while.
author: Brian E.

description: I don't even like sushi...but here, omg, it is fantastic! My friends and I ordered the tempura dynamite, sunflower, & dragon rolls (as recommended by Bernie our server). Each one was so delicious! (Did I mention I don't like sushi?!) The location is really nice too! It overlooks the bay with the golden gate bridge. Its beautiful.
author: Alexis A.

description:
This place saved me when I was desperate for a warm place for my family to warm up and fill their tummies after exploring Fisherman's Wharf.

Would I go here otherwise? No. Food is over priced.
But did it work then? Yes, because we could continue to enjoy the view and get some hot tea and rice.
author: Theresa S.

description: From out of town and loved it! We just order sushi, but was delicious. Definitely try the Lion King and the Dynamite roll, both were exceptionally good. Have a lot of other options for those who don't do sushi, and have a lot of drink options. A good place for sushi on the pier.
author: Rachel F.

description: Really only wanted cokes, but got a radish roll, chicken karrage, and agadashi tofu.  Radish roll was okay.  Agadashi tofu had no broth (wtf) and too much bonito flakes.  Not good at all.  The karragge wasn't marinated, was tough, and I stopped eating it.  We had karragge at 3 different restaurants recently and all 3 were excellent. This was only basic fried chicken.  Not even remotely karragge.  Avoid.
author: Brandon H.

description:
Needed a quick bite to eat before an event. Looked around and found this place with almost no wait at lunch time. 

First off, pricey. The sushi itself was so so. Ordered mostly the rolls and tempura fish. 

Nice view too, plus one star for that. Service was also good and the food didn't take too long. 

Would I come back, yes if I am in a rush and don't feel like waiting.
author: John N.

description: I was rather disappointed and will not be back to Hana Zen. Although the view was extremely beautiful (right by the water front at the end of the dock, I could see Alcatraz Island) and the staff was very friendly, the food was below average tasting, was too expensive for how poor the food tasted, and we waited for over an hour before any of our food came out. When it did finally arrive, my "sautéed veggies" were crunchy and nearly cold, and my teriyaki chicken was almost cold as well.
author: Clifford T.

description:
Was here for my sis's bday in June of 2011. Food was just ok, looking at the price I expected excellent food. On food alone, I'd give them an average..2.5 stars. Not horrible but nothing great either. Def would not go back for the food tho considering the prices. So many cheap  Japanese restaurant with average food. 

They got 1 star b/c their service was terrible. This brought their 2.5 star down to a 1. I'd give them a negative if I could. Our server said he'd bring us tea, after 30 mins we had to ask for it. We had 8 ppl in our party and they only gave us one pot which he even mention earlier that he would give us two pots. So we had to ask for another pot which took another 10-15 to get a server's attention. The restaurant was not even half full. One person ordered a beer, after 20 mins we asked bout it and it finally came. After a while another person ordered a beer. This time we had ask about the beer 3x, then when it finally came...two server came to our table w a beer. So the second server said 'Oh it's ok. You can just have this one too.' But instead of leaving both cups there, he switch the beer in his hand for the beer that was on the table??? Didn't even touch the first cup. 

Dessert time! We decided to ordered 4 different dessert to share. They said that they were out of one, so we ordered something else. The dessert came in 10-15 mins which is fine. 5 mins into our dessert, I saw a server bringing out the dessert that they told us they were out of and served it to a couple that came in way after us! WTH??

Ok... Whatever! Let's just pay and get outta here! We pay with 2 credit cards. I looked at the server and said $75 on this card and the rest on this card. He barely even looked at me or the card I was talking about. Said 'YEA, YEA, YEA.' impatiently and rudely and took off. took 30 mins for them to charge the credit card and four guys surrounding the credit card machine. Turns out there was some malfunction with the machine. Looked @ the receipt and sure enough.. they charged the wrong card.  $75 was charged on CC#2 and the rest of the bill on CC#1. We left it the was it was, we did not want to stay there another 30 mins.

Finally left. We're outside and my friend realized she had given the busser her parking ticket for validation. She went back in and asked the busser for her parking ticket. He started to arguing with her telling her that he doesn't have it. That he had given it back to her. Then he finally he checked his pocket and it was in the chest pocket and not even validated. "Oh, sorry miss. Let me go validate it now.'

NEVER COMING BACK TO THIS PLACE!
author: Pampam W.

description: Came here for some drinks at the bar. I ordered a pomegranate Margarita, it was very good. My friend created her own cran vodka drink which she ended up not liking so she ordered what I had. She said mine was better. I was surprised to see tax on our margaritas from the bar, but overall it was a nice quiet spot to catch a quick drink.
author: Renee P.

description: I gave this place two stars because I have had much better sushi at a much better price.  I came here with my boyfriend and another couple.  We ordered the spicy tuna roll, hamaci scallop roll & dynamite roll.  All were extremely bland and without a lot of taste.  My friends got a rainbow roll, a spicy tuna crunch roll and two others I can't recall.  Typically the spicy tuna crunch I have had before is just rolled in panko.  The one at Hana Zen seemed to be deep fried.  The tuna was cooked - it just wasn't what we were expecting and again, was very bland.  Much better places in the city for the price.
author: Terri R.

description: Nice scenery of Alcatraz and Golden Gate bridge, friendly and professional service, and awesome chirashi. Also, the owner makes me feel so welcomed, she has a very pleasant personality. Yes, I'm a big fan! You have to walk down to the end of Pier 39 but that's no big deal and you get to see all of the shops.
author: Gerry T.

description: Looks can really be deceiving. They have amazing displays. The complete set up is nothing but stunning. I admire the modernity and neatness of this restaurant. Also I cannot complain about dining overlooking the waters. In spite its physical beauty, service is not the best. The guy that served us seemed lost when he was taking our orders. Also, our appetizers arrived the same time as our meals. Well, that's a shame. The calamari is probably good for half a person. Smallest portion I've ever encountered. As for my entree, I had their chicken teriyaki and tempura and hana zen roll. Honestly, I did not enjoy my food. They all lacked flavor, except for the chicken teriyaki. The chicken teriyaki is the only item I actually finished. Oh and the fresh vegetables. The sushi roll tasted really bland. No matter how much I hate putting expensive sushi to waste, I just couldn't finish it. I couldn't force myself to eat it anymore. This place is pretty expensive for their small portions and some unsatisfying food. It's a waste of money. Maybe they have better tasting food in their menu and I just got unlucky with my choices, but for now, I would just stay away from this place.
author: Maria M.

description:
I don't think people who are walking Pier 39 actually read Yelp reviews - they just walk around and stop where it sounds good.  That's what we did, and I regret it.  
Basically.... if you are reading this while you're meandering the Pier, contemplating coming here.... KEEP WALKING! 

We sat in the "bar" area for a quick drink and an appetizer.  After waiting for approx. 10 minutes, I walked 5 steps to the (very spacey and clueless) hostess and asked if there is a server or do I walk up to the bar to order.  She seemed confused by the question, then said someone will be with us.  Then we sat, and sat. FINALLY a guy out of nowhere comes up to take our two drink and one appetizer order. 
And we waited, and waited, AND waited.  By this point, we are both ready to just walk out. Since the bar is literally like 3 steps away, we could see all that was going on, and NOT going on as far as drink making.  They were so out of sync. Totally sloppy. It was like watching 3 brand new employees without any kind of direction. 
Our drinks finally came and they were AWFUL!!  But what are we going to do? Ask for something different and wait another 20 minutes?  So half way through our drinks, our appetizer comes.  Baked mussels.  Four of them.  They were delicious, but not worth the wait, and not at only have two each.  We got the bill and left - very disappointed!!
This place needs management!!  
The one star is for the mussels.  They were tasty.  But that's......about...... it!
author: L R.

description: Poor service and highly over priced for the amount of food you get. My sushi roll was a spider roll and tasted sour as if it had been coated in vinegar. Not sure what went wrong because I hear great things about this place but I've never had a spider roll that tasted this terrible. I will not be returning.
author: Jamie S.

description: I believe this place is new at pier 39.  My fiance and I wanted to eat some chicken teriyaki so we tried it.  I can say its a little over price and the food was not great.  The view is great and décor is wonderful, but I came for the food not the environment.
author: Trinh B.

description: Yummy food, and beautiful views of the water. A very romantic spot to take your honey. A little bit pricey, but hey, that's to be expected.
author: Monica F.

description:
Really amazing sushi!! Somewhat expensive but well worth the price if you are looking for quality sushi. I recommend the lion king, and the caterpillar rolls.

The service was a little slow because their was a large party a head of us but they made up for it by bringing us miso soup.
author: Kristin R.

description: Came in for happy hour with 3 other friends and it took at least twenty minutes to get our drinks. My lemon drop tasted like pure alcohol and I couldn't drink it.  We ordered the calamari appetizer which was small but good. I am not sure why the service was so slow because it was not that busy. Beautiful view though.
author: Trachelle H.

description: I wanted to love it - because it has a great name ;) - but it was just okay.  The service was extremely slow while we were there.  The food was fine but nothing out of this world.
author: Hana A.

description:
Price was medium for a Japanese cuisine place, but still high given the quality. 

I had the pork cutlet on rice. It was bland. I had to add a lot of soy sauce. I wasn't even sure it was pork. Could have been chicken. 

The miso soup was a little over salty. 

The salmon nigiri was pretty good: clean and fresh. Still, $5.50 for only two pieces. 

The view was cool so I guess it was alright of you're a tourist. 

Service was fine and place was clean. 

Overall, I wouldn't spend money here again.
author: Rico M.

description: Best thing on the menu was the apple sauce that came with the kids plate.  Fatty chicken, small portions and way over priced.  I know it's SF, but this is ridiculous.  One star for the view, that's about it.  I hate giving bad reviews, but this is my exception.
author: Marscelles R.

description: Wow.  Location, Location, Location.   Hana Zen has one of the best!  We had a wonderful time here at Hana Zen.  The food was delicious and the sake bombs were the best I've ever had - yes I said "EVER"!  The staff was also very accommodating to our unique requests too!!  Thanks Hana Zen!
author: Daniel H.

description: Yesterday while out in the city trying to beat the hot Sacramento weather, my boyfriend and I were looking for places to enjoy some sushi before we left. We called several different locations around 4:30 and nobody answered, so we decided to head home. Around 9:30 a lady gave us a call by the name of Angelita Louie. We have never heard of this person nor have we ever called her number before. When we answered the lady had nothing to say only "hello?" so we hung up and she had some guy call us back twice. When we did not answer, Angelita called back from her number again, we answered and it was a man calling us "F&^kers" and "a holes" and specifically told us not to call them again, we clarified that we never called them in the first place. I looked on Hana Zen's Facebook profile and it said the Angie Louie is the manager. So one, who is this controlling man calling us and yelling profanities and us, two, why did the manager call us back, and 3 why did she call us back from her personal cell 2?  We don't know how the food or service is and never will because we don't feel safe there after the experience we just had
author: Jaime C.

description: Bernie takes great care of his customers, excellent management. We had the 49er roll, Dynamite roll, Cali roll, and also got the highly recommended Lion King. Everything tasted fresh a awesome. We also had the house cold saki which was good. If your going to get dessert, do the ice cream and chocolate soufflé, super tasty! Overall great experience, glad we stumbled upon this place! (Great view of the bay too, what more could you ask for?)
author: Brock S.

description: This is a great place for groups. We had a very large party and the management provided a wonderful time.  The views of the bay were spectacular.
author: Matt L.

description:
A decent sushi spot on Pier 39.  It wasnt very busy for 2pm on a Saturday in the spring, which was a bit worrisome but we decided to try it anyway because of the incredible elevated views of the bay.

The food was good and the service was decent.
author: Mat B.

description: Went in for drinks and appetizers on 2/15/16. Service was slow even though there were maybe ten other people in the whole place. They were out of over half the things we ordered. and our waiter waited to tell us well after we ordered what they were out of, giving us no time to order anything else. Which was fine, because at that point we were over trying. The waiter gave us a discount, which would have been great, but then proceeded to charge my card nearly double what the actual total was and now the manager can't seem to manage to call me back. Avoid this place at all costs, absolutely terrible.
author: Thalia G.

description: Awesome food, awesome view, awesome sake selections and awesome service!  I eat here all the time especially when there are special events going on in the city.  Recently I was there to watch the GG Bridge 75th Anniversary fireworks and it was the perfect spot to be without having to deal with large crowds and trying to secure a spot out at Crissy Fields.
author: La Verne C.

description: My girlfriends and I went to Hana Zen for our friend's birthday and thought that it'd be a great place to go since the restaurant is pretty big, and everyone can usually find some sort of roll to share.  The window view we had was absolutely gorgeous, even with the fog.  We had 10 people at the table, and was pretty excited about the girly drinks they had on their cocktail menu.  We got our drink order in almost right when we sat down, but after about 20 minutes (and an almost empty restaurant) we still hadn't gotten our drinks.  We asked for waters early on, and those eventually came AFTER we got our cocktails.  Most of us got various rolls, my best friend and I shared the Lion King roll and the Crispy Spicy Tuna roll.  We also ordered two sides of Edamame for the table.  The rolls were pretty good, and we were all served at once despite there being only one guy manning the sushi bar.  We brought our own birthday desserts and provided our own candles.  Most of us had to order drinks two at a time since it was taking SO long to bring them out.  By the time we were done, it was almost 10pm (reservations were at 8:30) and the place was completely empty.  Overall, Hana Zen is really just OK.  I don't like that it's at Pier 39 or the fact that it's tucked away at the very end of the Pier.  The food was OK, the service was less than OK, but unless we have another birthday, I probably will not be coming back on my own choosing.
author: Lisa I.

description:
I went to this restaurant on a Tuesday just before 6PM for dinner.  Since I was by myself, I sat at the bar.  The music was very lounge-like and perhaps even close to nightclub music.  The view is beautiful.  OK, so the bartender was not particularly attentive but not particularly horrible either.  He simply showed no interest in small talk or suggestions.  I ordered the rainbow roll, edamame and asked if he had a side salad, since it was not on the menu.  He said yes, we have a small side salad.  

He brought the salad in a timely manner.  It was a field greens salad with carrots and italian dressing.  I have never had italian dressing on a salad at a Japanese restaurant.  It was cheap bottled italian dressing to boot.  Yuck.  I envisioned a nice ginger dressing of some sort.

The edamame followed.  It came in a piping hot bowl with not one grain of salt.  

The rainbow roll was simply mediocre.  The fish was slightly dry but tasty none the less.  

I was not thanked when the bill was brought.  I was not thanked nor acknowledged by the bartender nor hostess when I left.  

In my opinion, this is a beautiful spot to have a drink because of the view.  I would eat elsewhere next time I am in the area.
author: Gina V.

description:
I've always been afraid of tourists for 20 years in an attempt to go to the end of Pier 39.  One day a couple weeks ago, I just dared myself to go to the end and there was Hana Zen.  I came back the next day to have lunch and I've been back about 6 times in the last 2 weeks.  

The view is spectacular and anytime I am designated to give a visitor from church a tour, it will include lunch at Hana Zen.
author: Guillermo D.

description: View is GREAT but food was NOT. Midi soup was not live miso. Lion sushi roll was okay. Spicy tuna roll was below average. Server Aimee was not happy or distracted. The manager was nice and friendly.
author: Kyle B.

description: This place is set in the back of Pier 39 which makes it a fabulous location to enjoy a beautiful Golden Gate bridge view as well as the rest of the bay. It is also great for a variety of Japanese foods, including sushi. We especially liked the San Francisco roll and the Lion roll. We enjoyed dinner there and saw the Japanese Consul General eating with his guests. We saw several large parties yet the ambience remained pleasant and quiet enough for conversation.  Prices are reasonable, too.
author: Marietta B.

description: I like Hana zen but the guy who took our order for happy hour got our drinks and then never came back to us. Not even when we needed our check. I had to go to the bar. If he had told me I needed to go to the bar I would have been fine with it. But he kind of abandoned us. :( one bad experience doesn't make a bad restaurant. We shall try Again perhaps..
author: Chay T.

description: Sushi is ok and low inventory of Japan beer and fish. Not a lot of people but Good place for quick bit and beer with a fantastic view.
author: Chris G.

description: Great view, mediocre food, one waitress for entire restaurant. Not a great choice for vegetarian diet at all, I had vegetable tempura which consisted of broccoli, bell pepper and one slice of sweet potato.
author: Vicki C.

description:
