My wife and I tried Hana Zen with a Bloomspot deal; Chef's choice sushi and sake tasting.

The place is excellent! We went on a Thursday night in February. It is a short walk to the end of Pier 39 but worth it because there were no tourists and we had the place almost to ourselves. The restaurant has a great decor and beautiful views of the Bay (if you go during the day). The wait staff was friendly and very helpful, the service very good.

The sake flight consisted of three short glasses of crystal clear rice wine. Very interesting flavors, though personally, I've discovered that I prefer my sake hot.

The food was great! We started with Miso soup, which was served hot (not luke-warm as in some places) It had good proportions of kelp and tofu. The second course was Tempura prawns and veggies. They were done well, not greasy. My only critique of the Tempura was that the dipping sauce was bland, didn't add anything to the tempura. Then came the sashimi plate: What a delight! There were five kinds of fish in a classy presentation , the best being the Hamachi and Salmon, I've not had better cuts, they just melted in your mouth! We each had a small bowl of sushi sticky rice on the side and it was amazing in itself! Warm, perfect consistency, and with a mild vinegar fragrance that added a wonderful element to the flavor. I could have had a bowl of just the rice!

After all that food we didn't have much room for desert but couldn't resist the warm chocolate cake with coconut ice cream and fresh sliced strawberry. Another beautiful presentation, and flavors that are to die for. We left happy, though noting that it was the first time in memory we left a sushi place feeling stuffed. It was all so good we just couldn't stop ourselves!

I highly recommend Hana Zen at Pier 39.
author: Steve R.

description: My wife and I had a great time at Hana Zen. The food, the staff and and the service couldn't have been better.  We'll be going back for sure the next time we're in SF.
author: Gregg C.

description:
I just had lunch at Hana Zen and I would never make the walk through Pier 39 for it again. 

Working across the street from Pier 39 does not give you many choices for a good sit down lunch. I was craving some Udon so my co-worker and I decided to give it a shot. We arrived about 12:15 and were one of 5 tables seated.

He ordered the tonkatsu lunch which came with the tonkatsu a piece of broccoli a carrot and some rice. SERIOUS! I mean come on no soup or salad and this was for $14.50.  It seems to make sense that people say it is empty at nights in the other reviews.

I ordered a udon for $9.50 which was broth and noodles and paid $2.00 extra for chicken. It was not horrible but I've had much much better in the city. I also ordered two pieces of hamachi nigiri which was $5.25 and the fish slabs were small.

To top it off I understand this is a tourist place but we were on a work lunch and our waitress took her sweet ass time. For just those items it took us over an hour to get out. 

I'm sorry Hana Zen but San Francisco is filled with delicious authentic asian food especially good sushi and you just don't make the cut. Two starts for the view, the interior, and the cleanliness. I can't imagine any good concierge or local would reccomend this restaurant.
author: Jen C.

description: Best place to eat with awesome view with delicious food and great bar to drink. Highly recommend also a great place to do your special events!
author: Dean A.

description:
Was craving iced tea when I came upon this place, then thought, okay, I'll add a Japanese lunch; remembered that a previous restaurant at this location advertised "best view on Pier 39," yep, view can't be beat and I felt relaxed as a single diner, zen worked for me. The oolong iced tea came out fast and was excellent.  

The main course was bland and I had to ask for wasabi.  If I knew my order would come without the customary soup and salad, I would have ordered it, will next time, maybe the edamame, too.  

Dessert rivaled the view as best thing about the experience, I had the scorched meringue with ice cream which had a beautiful presentation, not too sweet which I appreciated, the meringue reminded me (in a good way) of roasted marshmallows, dessert for an adult pallet.  Five stars even though the main course seemed blanded down for a tourist crowd; how can I complain, that's where I was!
author: C J.

description: Wow, I just enjoyed another great meal of Japanese cuisine at Hana Zen. The owner, Angie is a fantastic host and her diverse staff were very tentative to all my request. The Lava Tuna was excellent and very sumptious. And after my dear friends enjoyed a Segway tour we came back and enjoyed very fresh Sashimi. Can't wait to bring my friends from the Philippines to show off this great dining establishment with the majestic view of the San Francisco bay--Golden Gate Bridge to my left and the Bay Bridge to my right. What a delicious experience.
author: Ben M.

description: Cute modern Japanese place. Hana Zen is in a really touristy area,  but don't let that fool you the cuisine is on point!
author: Lauren M.

description: I have been going to Hana Zen since they opened. There isn't anything bad I can say about it. Cutover service has always been great. Food? Very good. View? Spectacular. Right at the end and upstairs at Pier 39 with floor to ceiling windows you can watch the boats, look at the Bridges and Alcatraz Island.
author: Sharon S.

description: Came here on this past sunny Saturday to be a little touristy and check out the seals on the docks by the pier. We stumbled upon this place by the happy hour board posted outside of the restaurant. It had, what looked to be, floor to ceiling windows with great views of the ocean and Alcatraz inside so we agreed to have a few drinks as a break from being tourists. There was a  lot of variety/choices on the happy hour menu for drinks which was a big plus to us since we weren't starving for anything at the time. Our bartender was very attentive and kind as well. If I lived in the city I would def try and come back to see what it is like during the night because I am pretty sure I saw a karaoke setup but I could be wrong.
author: Adam G.

description: Zero stars if I had the option.Worst place ever!! We had to pay for gratuity even when we were only 4 people. When we asked the waiter what it is for she told us it's because it's a weekend and a bill over 100 bucks which by the way was not worth it. While we were leaving I asked the owner why we got charged and she said right away the waiter shouldn't have. Then she wanted to give us ONLY gratuity back although out of there mistake we should have get back more and on top of it when we complained she blamed it on her staff which is on her if she owns the restaurant. No matter what the restaurant charges it's on everyone who works there. All in all the owner did not react professional, gave us an attitude and all on top of a bad quality!!
author: Pegah H.

description:
Hana zen was reasonably priced for a restaurant on Pier 39. Space-wise, it's decently sized, so plenty of room. Great view of the bay. 

The service is a tad slow, as others mentioned by other yelpers.  I only had a tempura bento box, pretty tame. So I can't comment on the sushi, but the shrimp tempura was as expected. Overall worthy of a visit but not necessarily worthy of a trip.
author: Sandy C.

description:
If they allow me to rate a 0, I would, too bad this option isn't available.

I guess the 1 star would just go to the nice view of the wharf???
author: Gigi M.

description:
Everytime i go to Pier 39 the atmosphere of this place makes you want to go in and try it and the view to the bay looks so beautiful from there. So finally with my friends from out of town and I went to try it out one Saturday night. 

We got there at 6:30pm, there was only 3 or 4 other parties inside eating, which was kind of odd being a very nice beautiful packed sunny day at the Pier. We got seated right away and ordered our drinks and miso soups to start up, about 10 minutes after that  we were ready to order. We sat there and waited for about an additional 15 for our server to come back with our drinks (Too long). When we ordered we did not help but notice that there were only 2 servers for the whole place (not enough)! 
10 minutes later they bring out just ONE roll and the miso soups for everyone, kinda late since we ordered them right when we sat down! 

We were a party of six so it was so odd that they would only bring one of our orders before everyones, since in the majority of restaurants all the orders are brought together. No kidding 20 minutes later our server begins to bring out the rest of the orders ONE BY ONE as they are being made. One of us goes by the chef area and notices that there is ONLY ONE sushi chef!?!? To us that was just ridiculous, being that they are located right on Pier 39, its a weekend and to have only one chef 2 servers for the whole place. Our server was a very nice guy and understanding, he kept apologizing about the one chef situtation, so no wonder the place was practically empty but still we were there for a very long time (over an hour) and the majority of the time we were just waitng for our food. 
We did not get full of our food and we did not want to order more since we did not want to wait any longer than we already had. I ONLY recommend their desserts now those were really good!

The food was ok ive definately had better! Plus their rolls were TOO small and TOO expensive, our bill came out to $300 (wayyy too much) sooo NOT worth it!! 
I dont know if this was just a one day incident or if its always like that but i would not go back, I DO NOT RECOMMEND IT save your money cuz there are OTHER BETTER and affortable sushi places in the City!! 
Looks can be deceiving it looks SUPER nice the location and inside the restaurant but the service and food not quite so well.
author: Jess J.

description: My bf & I went in for lunch, around noon, hardly anyone else in the restaurant. We had great friendly service & the food was awesome! We had the Crunchy Spicy Tuna roll, Pork Cutlet Donburi, & Shrimp Tempura Udon bowl. Pretty big portions, we both couldn't finish our bowls. Server was always refilling our water & lemonade without being asked. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for good Japanese food. :)
author: Kauai H.

description:
The restaurant have a very nice view inside and out! 
I love their fresh oysters and the beef is melt in my mouth!! 5 stars!!  
Bento box is great
Creme brûlée : 4 stars
P.s: pretty spendy restaurant!!
author: Cindy L.

description:
So me and the gf went on a date to hana zen sushi because we got a discount coupon for its reopening or something. Its on pier 39 and usually my rule is no going to places that are tourist trap types, but I gave Hana Zen a shot. 


When we got there it seemed a bit empty and but overall the atmosphere was nice. The view is probably amazing during the day but it was a stormy night for us so all we say was blackness accented by little dots of light in the bay, with the occasional pedestrian scurrying by to avoid the rain. Not bad overall tho. 

The service seemed sluggish. If they had just opened or were reopening, its understandable that it could be a little slow but that wasn't the end of it. Our food came out in a very odd order. We ordered edamame  and 3 rolls. The rolls came out haphazardly with the edamame  coming out after a roll had already arrived. This was just odd. They must have forgotten about the edamame  and then brought it once they remembered. Kinda strange. So Slow and maybe forgetful, with very few checks ins. Not great traits. 

On to the food. Ok so first we ordered the Sunset Strip roll, a spicy tempura shrimp roll, and a spicy tuna. The spicy tuna roll was just what you would expect and was fine. Not great, but fine. The Sunset Strip roll was a special roll, so it was kinda pricey but not really that good. It had a lot of fish wrapped in cucumber, so it was unique, but lacked that special flavor combination that you expect when you order sushi. It was just various fish that melded to make generic fish flavor and lacked any sort of real depth. So it just seemed like a rip off. The spicy tempura roll however, was great. It had a nice crunch and good spice to it, with a good back of tuna flavor bringing up the rear, a good Crunch Spice Tuna combo that hit you satisfyingly. Quite good. In fact it was the restaurants saving grace. I mean without that roll, I would have been upset at the fact we ate here. But the combo of having the coupon and this roll saved my mood. Actually, come to think of it, the only reason I wasn't mad was that we had the discount coupon for it. This is important because I was going to go 2 stars for my experience, but for everyone else who didn't have the coupon, I am going to have to go 1 because the food and experience simply was not worth it. Again, this place reaffirms my rule, don't go to tourist trap places.
author: Tom O.

description: I ordered the lion king and hana Zen roll and they both were really good. Waitress was nice and atmosphere was pretty since you can see a nice view of the bridge and Alcatraz.
author: Mai T.

description: My wife and our 2 daughters were hanging out at Union Sq yesterday. It was past 6 pm and we were all hungry. Majority decided on Japanese and via Yelp a few restaurants popped up. Hana Zen was the closest to where we were and we decided to check it out. The menu is diverse, the service outstanding and the bottom line...food was excellent. We ordered sashimi, tempura, adegashi tofu, yak tori etc. I am a big sashimi and tempura fan. Having been to Japan a couple dozen times, sashimi before it tastes great has to look fresh. Also, the tempura should not look like "chicken fried steak " but must have a thin crisp coating that needs to be almost transparent. I must admit, this place is 5 stars on both of theses items. The tofu was great as well as the garlic pork yak tori. The scallop yak tori was slightly over cooked. Thus the 4 stars. Overall, a terrific place.
author: S P.

description:
A friend suggested this place for pre-party dinner in the city.  When we arrived at Pier 39, our first thought was "Ugh, really?!  Sushi in a tourist joint?"  This restaurant is hidden all the way in the very back of Fisherman's Wharf and you have to walk through the throngs of tourists and school field trips to get there.  Probably part of the reason it was half empty even on a Friday night.  But once you step in, you're in a different world, definitely unexpected nice decor and ambiance.  The sushi itself was just average, not bad, but definitely at a higher price point.  The service was friendly, maybe a little slow for being fairly empty.  

The view, though - wow!  I would come just to eat dinner at sunset, watching the colors hit the Bay, lighting up Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz in the distance.  Gorgeous!  

Definitely worth a stop if you're looking for a nice locale for dinner near Fisherman's Wharf.  (And if you're willing to push your way through the tourists...)
author: Heather s.

description: Great service .. the sushi was great the drinks were strong but not over whelming .. . Great happy hour menu ..
author: Gil C.

description:
Sadly, very much a disappointment. I got my order to-go so didn't get a chance to experience the nice interior/view or the presentation/plating (very nice from the pictures by kitchen's chef no doubt!)

California Roll & Crunchy California Roll - the basics.

California roll had no definitive taste. And it was missing the cucumber! I'm only now realizing that there was no crunch to the roll...just mushy with the crab & avocado. 

Crunch California roll was another mushy thing. The tempura part didn't translate well to the rest of the roll although it helped the roll from falling apart. It was also missing the green onions & barely was topped with eel sauce. 

The side of ginger was very nice. Didn't eat the wasabi - not a fan. Little packets of soy sauce & chopsticks are also provided. Forgot to ask if they had low-sodium soy sauce in packets so I used the regular version, which is too salty in my opinion but works in a pinch. 

For the price you pay, you expect more. Never mind it's in a tourist mecca, that's no excuse for low quality food. Thankfully it was a gorgeous day so my mood was enhanced by the sun. 

Good view, nice service, bad food. Not a good recipe for longevity.
author: Marissa H.

description:
A very large and impressive location. The place is towards the end of the pier so less people walking around and still has a great view of the boats coming in to dock. 

The prices and food quality is lacking.
author: M C.

description: If I could give zero star, I would totally do it. My sister came to town to visit and wanted to go to the pier for dinner and walk around and stumbled upon this place so we decided to walk in and try it. First off, we walked in and no one greeted us because the host was on her cellphone. Eventually we got her attention and was seated. Secondly, our server never came to greet our table or introduce herself so we never knew who our server was. After a while, someone came to our table and greeted us and she said she wasn't our server and was helping her coworker take cause of us, so we assumed her coworker was our server .. But she still hasn't come around to our table yet. So we ordered food and alcoholic drink. So this one server rudely dropped off our drinks without saying anything and turned around and walked away, we literally had no idea who dropped off the drinks for us because she disappeared that fast. Not only did we not know who our server was, the service was just a horrible experience. They were supposed to be 'really' busy but what kind of restaurant would only schedule 3 servers on a weekend night? Makes no sense .. And when the girl brought our food out, she literally dropped it off without saying anything and just left and didn't even tell us which dish was which. Literally, the whole night, we didn't know how our server was, up until this day, I still don't know who our server was. She never came out and introduce herself or anything like that at all. We got cold shoulder treatments throughout the whole dining experience, and that made our dining experience not enjoyable at all. Enough with the horrible service, now on to the food. It was ridiculously overpriced and super small portions. We got the garlic noodles and it tasted nothing like garlic noodles. It tasted like plain noodles with oil mixed in, we had to keep adding soy sauce in order for it to have to taste. Their udon came in a tiny little bowl with nothing in it except the udon noodles and soup, and trust me, it was over $10 for that bowl. I could easily get a bowl of flavorful pho that will actually fill me up for the same price or even less. Their sushi didn't taste fresh at all. I would not go back or recommend this place to anyone at all. We paid over $135 for a meal that didn't fill any of us up, not only that, service was horrible. This place is just poorly managed and servers are just rude overall. We even asked the host who our server was and she said she'd talk to our server and she still never came out to our table. Bottom line is, horrible service, overpriced meals, small portions, and not fresh and tasty at all. 0 or negative star would have been given if it was possible to do so.
author: Kaylee P.

description: Fantastic sushi, great view, attentive service. The server was a smidge pushy on the upsell for the sake (which is the sole reason for the 4, and not 5 stars), but overall it was great. We went at 7:30 and it was perfect to watch the sunset at Pier 39.
author: Christina M.

description: I went there a few days ago, and had the WORST food experience of my life. I got food poisoning to the extreme. I  personally ordered a caterpillar roll & cherry blossom roll. After about an hour or two, i started puking amongst other things. I have never got food poisoning so bad from a restaurant before, worst feeling ever. I will not be returning here. Becareful eating here.
author: Mike L.

description: Meh. It's okay definitely not the best Japanese food that I have ever had. Will probably not be back. The sushi was flavorless and the noodles were some how bland. It was definitely missing some element that made it taste Japanese.
author: Eboni T.

description: I went here while at pier 39 to have dinner. It is a cute place with a good view of the pier. The waiter was nice and the atmosphere was nice as well. I ordered the chicken teriyaki which came with rice and miso soup. The service was pretty fast even on a weekend which was nice. The food was ok, but nothing really special. Especially for the price. I guess everything on the pier is expensive. Overall, it is an ok restaurant with decent Japanese food. I just wish it was a little bit more affordable.
author: Katherine L.

description: Decent food; prices a little high but what you would expect on pier. No baby changer. Changed toddler on bathroom floor. Large drink menu. Great view.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Way overpriced.  I think it was a good idea to put some Asian cuisine on Pier 39 though.

The rolls are just your average rolls, nothing that makes me take a bite and nod your head.  If you're going to eat here anyway, try their lion king roll and the udon.  It's what I order for lunch when I do order from them.

*They have specials for Pier 39 employees.  
50% off on Thursdays
20% off everyday and 
California roll and miso soup for $5 everyday
author: Chai S.

description:
My new found love! Sushi! I loved sushi before but I could never get myself to enjoy anything that's not cooked... But after this restaurant I can say I love it all!

We came there around 6, and because it was winter the sun has already set. We got seated right away, we could have gotten the window, however there's no point since it's dark outside. Nevertheless we still enjoyed the experience anyways..

The service was great everything came out at a perfect timing, hardly any wait at all! We started out with some kind of seafood salad, it was pretty good! A perfect start to the meal. Then we had the Sashimi Deluxe, before this I have tried sashimi a few times and it was never my cup of tea...until now. That day I was able to try the different fishes, was able to distinguish them and actually appreciate them! I been loving Sashimi since. :) We did order a roll, it was something baked! I love all baked rolls, so this one did not disappoint. Starting to feel stuff we end the meal with a uni. First time trying an uni... odd texture kind of melt in your mouth. It was kind of good, but not something I am used to yet... maybe a couple of more tries at it... We didn't get dessert cause we had something else in mind.

Overall good meal, great service! Will be coming back if in that area and in the mood for sushi! And one more thing if you parked in the garage across the street from the pier, remember to get a stamp!!! I had to run all the way back for the darn stamp! The lady at the door remember me, and apologize for not asking.. Not making that mistake again :(
author: Sophia H.

description:
A visit to California without having sushi is not a complete visit, so we stopped into Hana Zen for our last lunch. Located right at the end of Pier 39, this place offers great views of the Bay, including Alcatraz  and the Golden Gate.

The food itself was excellent. We went with a starter of Edamame, which came out warm and nicely salted, not as much as it would be on the East Coast in places. We then ordered three rolls, these being the San Francisco roll, Sunset Blvd, and fried spicy tuna. All three were excellent, with the usual California combination of vegetables and fresh fish and the usual amazing flavor.

The dessert course too was good, with us ordering mochi on the recommendation of the waiter. This dessert, not offered on the actual menu, consists of ice cream wrapped in rice pastry. They brought out both coffee and green tea flavors, all of which were delicious.

While I am sure that there are cheaper good sushi places in SF, the location and the food make it well worth a visit during a soujourn to Pier 39.
author: Jan T.

description: Worst meal I've had in many years! Poor quality food and sushi. Also did not even warm the Unagi.
author: M B.

description:
I was quite surprised about the food at this location. We went for a late lunch and it was not busy at all. Knowing this is their second location, I would have expected that the food would be quite exceptional. This was not the case. First, let me start with the location. It's awesome. At the end of Pier 39, and on the top level, you have a view of the golden gate bridge, and Alcatraz. The restaurant is clean and provides a nice dining atmosphere. Service was a bit slow, and the only time we saw our sever was at the start of the meal, and at the end when I called for a check. 

For the food, my wife had the teriyaki salmon bento plate. The salmon was a small piece, and the rice was overcooked (mushy). We were also surprised at getting charged $5 for a bowl of green tea that was not even loose leave (a cheap brand tea bag just dropped into it). I suppose they had to make up the cost of the rent some how. The rest was just OK, nothing to write home about. 

I ordered sushi. First off, the soft shell crab was chilled, meaning it had been fried earlier, and sat around until they made it to order. Not very appealing at all. Second, many of the lighter sushi should be served with a vinegar based sauce as the heaver soy sauce will overwhelm the taste of the fish. They did not provide the sauce on the side nor did they make the sushi with this. However, there was very little flavor to the sushi in any case. It didn't taste old, just not much flavor at all to the fish. The saba did have a very strong vinegar taste and at $5 was quite expensive for a cut of fish that's easily the cheapest on any sushi menu (I wonder now why I even ordered it at that price). 

I only give it 2 stars (and not 1) because they didn't do anything really so bad. I think you have to expect this kind of quality from a tourist location such as Pier 39. Won't go back, but we were curious about this location as it's a well known name for sushi, I'm disappointed they would associate their name with this establishment.
author: Tadas P.

description: This is some of the best sushi we have ever had hands down! The rolls were tight came exactly the way we ordered it with the soy wraps. Amazing is all we have to say about this place plus u can't beat the view of the bay and Alcatraz!
author: Cody K.

description:
Fantastic view at sunset.  

Friendly albeit slow service.  The food took a long time to come out even though they weren't very busy.  Unfortunately when the food came, it was unremarkable.

You can find street parking if you're determined.  Or, be prepared to pay hefty pier 39 parking prices.

Come for the view, not the food.
author: H C.

description: OK, I am not a eater of Sushi, but I am an avid Rum drinker.  I found the bar here to have Havana Club straight from Cuba. Knowing I will never probably own a bottle of rum from Cuba I had to stop in and give it a try.
author: PhilnDebb L.

description: Two stars because they have a great location but there was a bug in our salad - ugh!
author: Joyce K.

description: Food was okay. Nothing to write home about. We came here looking for sushi but their options weren't that great. I prefer creative rolls that don't all include crab or shrimp. My mom is a vegetarian and wasn't able to get an order of noodles with vegetables. She ended up getting an order of plain noodles and an order of vegetables but they couldn't be added together in the kitchen. We also had two orders of teriyaki chicken. Very fatty and not fresh tasting. The place has an awesome view but the service is mediocre and food isn't great.
author: R C.

description:
Such a great place from a long day of traveling to San Francisco! I arrived at Pier 39 and was so desperately hungry for healthy food and decided to try out Hana Zen. My crave lead to this amazing sushi restaurant. As my friends and I were looking at what kind of sushi they had in store and the pricing provided outside of the restaurant. It was perfect. It was a good pricing for a great restaurant. You are greeted with wonderful hostess and they took you into this beautiful restaurant. The restaurant had a really nice view because you're at the edge of the pier and you can see The Golden Gate bridge and the beautiful seals. It's a really nice view and you can see the beautiful sunset over the bridge. The restaurant designs and placing of the tables and chairs also made the view better. It was a contemporary restaurant. 

Now onto the food. It was really good my friends agree that this place was good and worth your taste buds. I ordered a Hana Zen roll and a Kamikaze roll. Both of them were delicious and it didn't take long for both of them to arrive. We were a group of about 8 people and the food didn't take long to come out. It was about a 10-15 minute wait. The owner was really nice too. He would come by and check on us if we needed something. 

Overall a wonderful experience! A great view, spectacular service, and good sushi!
author: Maivy N.

description:
The view from our table was probably the best part of our meal. We made it just before sunset and admired Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz from our seats. I don't actually think there is a really bad seat in the whole place, as each table faces the windows for a panoramic view of the bay. 

Like other reviewers, I have to agree that the service was a little sluggish. However, the service we did receive was exceptional. Each person was nice and polite, visiting each time with a smile and ready to provide what you need. 

The hot food seemed way overpriced, so we opted for a few basic and special rolls and vegetable tempura. At first glance, every thing on the sushi menu seemed to be fried, crunchy, or covered in something fried. We ordered the kamikaze roll with yellowtail, rock n' roll, Lion King roll (with raw salmon, instead of baked salmon on top), and the Hana Zen roll. Each were well-rolled, a good ratio of each ingredient (i.e. not a mouthful of rice), and fresh. The tempura was alright. The batter wasn't crispy enough, but there was a good variety of veggies. 

The owners were actually Japanese, which is a good sign. I was disappointed that we were charged $3.50 for green tea from a tea bag. For a legitimate Japanese restaurant, I would expect that they could provide real green tea brewed from real green tea leaves. They wouldn't be breaking the bank if they brewed tea right. Even worse, we were charged for "Numi Organic" tea, when we were actually served something cheap. 

This place could have five stars if they didn't skimp on the brewing proper tea that they charge for and if they could pick up the service.
author: NickJess S.

description: Horrible service! There was only 5 other tables and we never once got a drink in the 15 minutes we sat there! Horrible!
author: Tami V.

description:
We just had our Xmas party here last night. Service was EXCELLENT and the Sashimi / Sushi were EXTREMELY FRESH!!!

For Japanese food it is quite expensive, but the ambiance, location, and VIEW, it was well worth it. 

The alcohol selection was superb.
author: Scott L.

description: Best. Miso. Soup. Ive. Ever. Had!  I used to hate miso soup until i came here.  I wasnt even going to try it since ive been to a ton of japanese restaurants and never liked the miso.  I decided to give it a try and im glad i did!  The food was really good and fresh.  I ordered a bento box, loved it.  We went to pier 39 for my birthday and this place was such a great choice to eat at.  The waitress was very nice and even sat us by the window so we can see the water and alcatraz!  I loved it, it made this place that much better!  Food with a view ! No complaints about this place.  I will for sure go back again this year for my birthday weekend, hopefully sooner!
author: Shawna P.

description: One of those restaurants on the wharf so I expected to spend more $$$ however when you spend more money you also except better food and service. The food was mehhh and service was quite slow. One of the girls had a drink sauce spilled on her. Not water...but SAUCE...and we planned to go out dancing that night. Did not act very sorry about it. I do not think I'll be back again.
author: Judie H.

description:
Went here for a friend of a friend's birthday party. Nice decor with an extremely friendly staff. Ordered some sushi rolls, edamame, and chicken karage... The rolls were ok. Not the biggest cuts of sushi, with a little too much rice going on here. The chicken karage was good and how can you really mess up on edamame. 

One thing I must say, I ordered a few of their specialty drinks. I think the geisha and the pomerita or something like that. The drink menu had mentioned using Herradura, but we got house tequila instead. It was pretty packed and so I guess he didn't hear me when I mentioned that he didn't use the right tequila. So we just stuck to sake after that. 

I might try it again on a less busy night...
author: Minh V.

description: My boyfriend and I went to try this place out this past weekend. When we walked in we asked to be seated at the sushi bar (I like to watch them make it) but the hostess told us that there were only 3 seats and they were taken so we took a table instead. The table they sat us at was ok it was by the empty sushi bar that the hostess just told me was full. The view are beautiful from this restaurant but the service is just way to slow. It took about 15 mins to get my cocktail and for our rolls it took about 30 mins to receive. Mind you this place was not busy at all. As for the food, the presentation was nice but I've tasted better sushi else where. When the waitress finally came to our table to ask if we would like anything else we told her we would like to order more rolls. almost 45 mins goes by before she brought us one of the 2 rolls we ordered, we waited and waited for the 2nd roll until I finally was just ready to leave. As we flag her down for our bill she brings us the 2nd roll expecting us to eat it and pay for it. I asked her to just take it off and return the roll were ready to leave. To get the final bill took 20 mins. The restaurant itself is really nice and the views are so beautiful but the service is just not up to par. You can go down to the Players Bar and have the same beautiful views with better food service and drinks. I wont be going back.
author: Tracey P.

description:
My wife and our 3 kids tried Hana Zen Friday the 14th of July at 7:30 pm.

First of all, fantastic location at the end of pier 39 with view over the bay. (including Alcatraz and the Golden Gate)

Quick friendly service, we got a table for 5 within 3min

We started with Edamame for Appetizers.

Then we ordred a kids menu for our 7 year old who is not into Sushi. (Kids Chicken Katsu)

Then we ordered the following sushi roll and special roll's:

Crunchy California Roll - Tempura fried California roll topped with sweet eel sauce and green onion

Lion King Roll - Crab Meat, Avocado. Topped with Baked Salmon, Spicy Japanese Mayonnaise Sauce

Spicy Shrimp Tempura Roll - Shrimp tempura roll topped with spicy tuna and tobiko

Golden Roll - Maine Lobster, Mango, Jalapeno,Salad, wrapped in Hamachi, with Spicy Sesame Sauce

Rainbow Roll - 5 kinds of fish outside with avocado and crab inside

The service was quick, we had all our food within 10-15min, we spent the time looking at the amazing view.

The Sushi was excellent served with decoration on plates. Especially the golden roll with lobster.

A fantastic place with great food and really good service.

We highly recommend Hana Zen at Pier 39.
author: Martin D.

description: My boyfriend and I really enjoyed the food and sake here. We went for the Californian options offered on the menu (Californian rolls etc) and were pleased with what we got. The views were excellent, especially at sunset and the restaurant wasn't at all busy (perhaps because it's a little expensive).
author: Emily S.

description:
Elegent, superbly fresh sushi, beautiful location, high priced.  

SF has amazing sushi and this place does not disappoint.  Among the freshest Uni (sea urchin) I have ever had.

The rolls are robust in portion and beautifully presented.  

For dessert, try the tempura banana with ice cream. very nice.

Location is in a super cheesy tourist area on a pier.  The restaurant itself is beautiful and overlooks the water.

Prices are med-high, with rolls ranging from $6 to $15, but I guess you're paying for the location.
author: Cyrus T.

description: This was a great place. Service was excellent.  We ended up here after walking around and decided to experience dinner before we looked at the yelp score and we were surprised to see that it only had 3 stars.  My friends had some sushi and we each had a  hot lava rock dish (tuna, filet & scallops)  This was a great experience.  I am not a fan of sushi but my friends are so if you are with a person who does not like Sushi this is the place as there is still plenty to like.
author: Kimberly R.

description: I ate here on a Saturday night and the food rivaled the best Sea food in town, but must say their menu carried a conglomeration of culture food's which is always a plus. The service was great and prompt and the food was on time and priced very affordably. The decor was the impeccable part of the experience, but what can you expect from a small town boy. Everything was clean and orderly. We will definitely be back for more.
author: Christopher S.

description: We had a party of four adults and two children, and only two adults liked sushi.  Though the food was a bit pricey for lunch, the portions were good and the flavors were wonderful.  The bentos were huge.  It was strange, though, that the place was pretty empty on a Friday afternoon.  Also, the restaurant charged us 18% gratuity.
author: Julia L.

description: When we walked in on our recent trip to San Francisco, we were told it would be about 5 minutes. I saw a table by the window (which we requested) and were told that was for a reservation. OK. Then we saw other parties come behind us and were told the same thing. (that it would be about 5 Minutes). OK. But when I saw they took the people who came behind us I questioned the hostess who lied and said they were already there. Again we were told it would be about 5 more  minutes and saw more people being seated before us. We left the restaurant  and ate at another place. When I called the manager he said its because they want to utilize the tables and would take a larger party before us. WT? I don't think that is fair. The manager acted like oh well. Places like that will not get my business nor will I recommend a place like that.
author: Louise R.

description: Great view, great service, but the worst food I've ever had. I love Japanese restaurants, but this was terrible. My chicken wasn't cooked, I think they just covered raw vegetables with sauce and sent it out. I understand you're busy, but at least take a little pride in your grossly overpriced food. There wasn't a wait and I should have waited at literally any other restaurant. I'll never be back until this place closes.
author: Kelli F.

description: The service is awesome. We came for sake, and it's bomb dot com. The waitress helped us so much for finding the best sake, we end up got a fancy sake. It came with lychee, mango, and raspberry concentrate. I totally recommend this place if you guys are thirsty.
author: Samantha R.

description: Only good thing was the view. Everything was small and overpriced. There was no miso soup or salad included. Complete mistake going here.
author: Ricardo C.

description:
My husband and i went here for lunch during happy hour. The appearance of the restaurant was really nice and the view was amazing. As far as the food and service goes, not so good. We sat at one of the tables in the bar area just a few feet from the front door. To start off, the hostess did not even walk us to the table she just pointed. And we had to ask for a menu from our waiter. My husband ordered garlic fries which came out fast because when we received them they were just regular fries with nothing on them. I ordered one philly roll which was about the circumference of a quarter. The avocado in the role was already brown! My husband being the champ that he is, ate the roll and ordered me another one because he didn't want to make a fuss about it. And the same thing with the second order small and browned avocado. During this time the waiter never came and asked us how we were doing or if the food was ok. He also didn't fill our waters once the whole time we were there. It was like finding waldo just to order four items on the happy hour menu. 
For the location that this restaurant is at I would expect better service and better food. Happy to say we will not be returning to this place.
author: Jane D.

description: Best sushi I've tried, very good service
author: Lia M.

description: We came in this restaurant because we wanted something lite and the restaurant also had a great view of all the boats and scenery. The service isn't all that great and the food was average. The decor is simple. The restaurant is very open with full bodied windows. The best part is watching the speed boats making waves that day, but I can enjoy the view somewhere else. I probably wouldn't come back here again if I didn't have to. Luckily, I had great company.
author: Anji W.

description: Happy hour here from 2-7. We had a couple of beers ($4 each) and the garlic fries (also $4). Fries and service were only okay, but the view was fabulous. Good for a break from exploring the city.
author: Aaron L.

description: Really good happy hour specials and our server, Arthur, was very helpful and knowledgable with answering any questions we had about the menu. Good view of the ocean as well.
author: David M.

description:
This is a nice restaurant to visit if you are looking for some sushi and a nice view of the bay.
I had the sushi combination and the food was good. Nice decor, great view, good service and reasonable price, I would come back another day for lunch.
author: Michelle N.

description: Sushi was HORRIBLE.  Sure the place was pretty and it has a great view but the food was disgusting and ridiculously expensive, what a RIP OFF. They should forget the decor and spend the money on quality fish! Not to mention the waitress was very rude and cold. The food did not come with everything that it was supposed to come with like it showed on the menu and was quite cheaply served as well. All of the fish on my rainbow roll were pale and dry. It tasted like sh*t. I'm so glad in all the years I've had sushi that I didn't get sick from this place. We paid so much for just 3 rolls and some drinks, we never would have thought it would be this bad from a place like this on a pier.
author: Y. T.

description: Whatcha expect eating at a tourist trap. A friend wanted to eat here and it was what I expected (overpriced)...service was excellent though.
author: Dan P.

description: Amazing sushi but not so great with cooked meals.  Go for the sushi and it's easily a 5.  Great location as well and surprisingly quiet for the location (pier 39).
author: Casey F.

description: This place was AMAZING. My friend came to visit from Dallas, and we decided to look for sushi around downtown SF. We ended up on the pier, and found Hana Zen right by the ocean. It was a Thursday late afternoon, the whole city was swarming with an unusual amount of people for that day of the week, but there were few people inside of the restaurant. We could see Alcatraz from the window next to our table, and the staff was very professional and courteous. The sushi was excellent, and fairly priced. No complaints!
author: Jennifer H.

description: This was my first time eating at this restaurant and it was pretty good. I met a friend whom I used to work with who I haven't seen in about 4 years. It was really good to catch up with her. We ordered an array of food starting with edamame and Calamari and then went on to a couple of rolls. I also ordered a bento box with Chicken and Tempura. It was actually quite good. We finished the meal with desert...I had mochi and my guest had creme bruele. I really loved the location of the restaurant which gives the diner an awesome view of he bay. I definitely would come back when I'm up in the bay area again
author: Jim A.

description: Don't be fooled by the term happy hour. I don't think $1 off should be considered happy hour. We ordered saki bombs and sushi and were disappointed by both. A saki bomb should consist of a beer and a small carafe of saki however it came with a glass filled 1/4 of the way with beer and a shot of saki. The sushi was overpriced and tasteless. Id never go back. (Location was prime and view was amazing)
author: Gloria H.

description: me and my friend went to check out this sushi place 2 weeks ago, we thought it would taste just like the one in downtown. It turned out to be full of disappointment, We will never go back to this place again. We order  a few rolls and sashimi, and for the price they charge for it, the taste of their sushi doesn't worth that price at all! and they even charge for tea ? That's ridiculous for Japanese food in Sf !!! And their services not that great too, maybe they expect most of their customers are tourists, so they don't expect their customers to return. Overall, this place is sucks, not even worth to try, there are so many sushi place that taste so much better than this one in sf!!!!
author: caroline L.

description:
Looks can be deceiving here. The decor is very nice, modern and sleek. I came here with my bf to celebrate our 4 year anniversary at the Pier and he wanted to try this place out. The hostess greeted us immediately and we were seated at a table for two next to a window looking out at the ocean and Alcatraz. Everything seemed to go very well until moments later. Our table wasn't leveled; making it rock a little back and forth between us, but we didn't think it was a big deal.

Then our server came and she seemed very nice. I ordered the lunch special of chicken teriyaki w/ tempura and he had the beef teriyaki and we both had a sprite. Some minutes went by and we were given our miso soup and it was quite nice. It was warm; which I found odd because I'm used to my miso soup being piping hot =T Then the entree seemed to take so much longer and were finally given our plates. Sadly, the proportions on my plate were so off. I've ordered this dish countless times at other places and received way more chicken pieces for so much cheaper! I was only given 5-6 small pieces and way more tempura. The rice in the bowl was white and fluffy; just enough stickiness for my liking and the dipping on the side for the tempura was unmemorable. I think it was overpriced for what you should get. My bf had way more meat on his plate and he thought it was just ok.
Even my sprite had an odd aftertaste after some time went by -_-"

Finally we were done and wanted to leave asap to explore the pier and waited until our server came by to check up on us. I realized that our server never came by to check how we were doing unless we called her or to drop off something. The restaurant wasn't busy at all. There were maybe 5 other tables eating and 3-4 people on staff. I think that's pretty reasonable balance to cater to each table equally, don't you? The servers were clearly bored by just standing around the bar chatting it up when finally one of them saw me raise my hand and told our server to come over -_-"

I asked for the check and minutes later delivered it. I brought out my card and put it in the folder and waited AGAIN for her to pick it up. 5 minutes roll by and I told my bf to call her over so that I can wash my hands in the bathroom and freshen up. I spent a few minutes in there and came back seeing our bill STILL on the table. We had enough and he eventually GOT UP AND GAVE HER THE BILL. She dropped out a few minutes later and I laughed when I saw the "recommended tip" of 15%! In my opinion, she didn't deserve anywhere close to what was recommended, but just gave $3.

Lousy service, raise your game up Hana Zen! I've received WAY more out of my money at my local sushi joint that is EXCELLENT in food, service, and price!
author: Terry N.

description: Beautiful setting with a fantastic view!! The cherry blossom roll is my favorite. Service was great and the atmosphere pleasant and warm. Loved it!
author: Michelle T.

description: Went here with 9 other friends on July 11, 2014 for dinner. We made reservations ahead of time and even confirmed the day before. Worst service ever! The waitress was very incompetent and messed every one of our order. When we asked about the sashimi or a roll, she always said "it's coming" and 30 minutes later, we still didn't get it. Food was okay, it was hard to enjoy it having to wait so long for the next food to come in. One of our friends waited 30 minutes and watched everyone eat while he was waiting for his food. When it comes to paying the bill, she put wrong items in the wrong bill and took a long time to pay.
author: Tricia C.

description:
3 stars at normal times, 4 stars at happy hour times, which ran until 7:00 I think. 

The view was amazing, we watched the sunset over the water and alcatraz, so could not be beat. The happy hour specials were very good and generous, and also fairly priced. The food was only average, dont come looking for amazing sushi or anything like that. Come here for the view and convenience of being by the pier. Woth it to go for the atmosphere , location and view, and you get decent food at decent prices (good prices at happy hour).
author: Ben S.

description: on the pier ! beautiful. great food. nice staff. amazing presentation! next time in in SF, going there more often!
author: Cecily B.

description: I truly enjoyed my experience at Hana Zen on Pier 39! I'm not a sushi person, so I can't account for that, but because of that I wanted to write a review from a non-sushi person's perspective.  Their chicken teriyaki dinner was delicious! Reminded me of a hometown favorite so I savored every bite. Their drink menu is extensive & yummy and their flourless chocolate cake was the perfect way to wrap up our dinner!  We visited on a Tuesday night, January 3rd after most NYE tourists had gone home, so it wasn't very busy but I'd expect the same excellent service no matter which night we visited. This quaint restaurant with a superb view at the end of the pier overlooking Alkatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge made a fantastic dining location for my hubby's first time in San Francisco!
author: Crystal R.

description: The view is fantastic, but the food is mediocre at best.
author: Lauri H.

description: Party for 70 people went without a hitch with everyone at Hana Zen paying close attention to every detail. The manager, the bartender, the staff, the floor director and the food were all superb, my guests were impressed and I'm one happy customer!
author: vix t.

description: We stopped there again over the weekend and it was just as great as the first time, only better since they now served alcohol.  All I can say is I'm glad they got their liquor license issue sorted out! I love, love, love this place...wish it were closer to home.
author: Ashley F.

description: We've been here 3 times now and enjoyed ourselves each time.  Yes, it is a pretty conventional Japanese American restaurant.  Yes, you should only order dishes that are "safe" (don't get the chawanmushu, for example, it was prepared entirely wrong).  But if you understand where you are, in the heart of tourist central, with a view that mesmerizes, the price of their dishes are really quite reasonable, considering how much they probably have to pay to rent there.  Factor in absolutely friendly servers and perfectly decent and fresh food (their lamb "popsicles" and negihama were the standouts from our meal tonight) and they got just the right combination for us.  Yes, we're fans!!
author: Yvette F.

description: We stopped in for an early dinner. The food was FABULOUS! We have absolutely no complaints at all. The waitress was very friendly and brought us whatever we needed. It has an amazing view and is perfect for lunch or dinner. We all loved and enjoyed this place and would definitely go back again!
author: Youcantsitwithus A.

description: Came here for their grand opening party and really enjoyed my experience there. I've always loved pier39, so the location of this place is definitely good. Has an awesome view of the bay, and the ambiance inside the restaurant is modern and stylish. I like the bar area where u can order all sorts of drinks. The sushi are relatively fresh, and I love the taste of their edamame! The owners are also very nice, as well as the waiters. Definitely going to come back for a full mull later =)
author: Louisa L.

description:
I am leaving the country and my parents came to visit and take me out to dinner. We decided to come here because it has great views (I live here, they don't) and we love sushi. We were immediately greeted and given a table by the window, which we had requested via OpenTable. Our server Miguel was very knowledgable and quick to serve, always with a smile. And the food was absolutely delicious, my favorites being the Dragon & Lion King rolls. 
This restaurant has amazing food, friendly staff and unbeatable views. If only they weren't in the thick of Pier 39! But that won't stop me from returning before I go of referring friends and family. Thanks for the great experience!! :)
author: Lauren K.

description: Great bartender, friendly staff, amazing view, above avg food quality and a decent price.
author: Luckie D.

description:
Really nice view! had a wonderful window seat. Great atmosphere. Had good, spicy wasabi.
 Just a bit pricey.
author: Amanda J.

description: Excellent food.  The best Japanese vegetarian dinner I have ever experienced, and I've been eating vegetarian in Japanese restaurants since 1968.  This is now my favorite restaurant in San Francisco.
author: Titania B.

description: So if I could give this place a zero I would but since that's not a choice a one it is. Yesterday I had a party of 11 come in for my birthday. My birthday dinner was ruined, first of all it took an hour  and a half for most of our food to come. Once we finally got our food those of us who did get our food it was cold. Second of all my husband and two of my friends never even got their food. Third: our waitress did not even check in with us at all we had to track her down to ask about the 3 orders missing. She apologized and said that the cooks forgot... Really? And let me tell you that when we got seated and ordered it wasn't busy in there at all! So we ended up canceling those orders that never came. We will never ever go back and I do not recommend this place to anyone. And apparently we weren't the only ones waiting long.... A couple sitting next to our group I over heard them saying it was taking so long for something so simple that they had ordered.  they gave us a "discount" which was basically no tax.
author: Adela R.

description: We eat here mostly for the view and the convenience. The rolls arent very creative but the fish is always good. Its not fusion enough for my taste but its definitely worth a stop if you are at pier 39.
author: Megan W.

description: Let's just say I'm never coming back! But, the employees were nice!!
author: Sweet P.

description: This is a great spot for a cold beer, good sushi, and a magnificent view of Alcatraz, Golden Gate Bridge, and Angel Island. It's a little tucked away but sooo worth it!!
author: Aurora O.

description: Here is my review in a nutshell - If you want good sushi - Do not come here. The rainbow roll is filled with fake crab and the shrimp tempera roll is over cooked and teeny tinny. Not worth the money or the time. I am sure there are a million and one other Sushi places that are better. Too bad I didn't stumbled onto one of those places instead.
author: Crissy H.

description: Horrible service! We ordered they took over 40 minutes to bring the food forgot half the things we ordered and took very long to give us our card back after we paid. Even worse they overcharged us by $70 and when we called there was not even an apology! Never going there again! Server was Aimee and the manager who dealt with our issue was Michael.
author: Fred C.

description: came here on a trip to the city. me and boyfriend both love sushi..but this place was not that great. i did the lava rock and i was concerned the whole time that i wouldnt cook my seafood enough and end up sick. thank god i didnt! the waitress was nice but she didnt give use the coupon we had so she went and redid it and never refunded my boyfriend! now we have to go through all this crap because they tried to pull a fast one! dissapointed in that a lot. ruined the experience. also the owner came over and told me if i liked the lava rock to put it on yelp... i thought that was rude and tells me they probably need help bringing their reviews up. it was also the first really hot day of the year and they had no ice cream. i was pretty devastated. wish i had had a better experience
author: Annie P.

description:
If only for its amazing views, this new restaurant (just opened last year) is a must-try. You get full view of the Golden Gate and the Alcatraz. Went there for lunch, view was amazing. I can only imagine how it looks at night.

The food was great, service was pretty quick and very friendly. Price was reasonable. Try the fun martini scallops. Will definitely be back.
author: Ryan M.

description: Wife and I loved this place. Food very good, tempura awesome. MyLe was an incredible server and we will definitely be back. Most windows have view of Alcatraz and SFO bay shipping channel - very fun and reasonably priced for Pier 39.
author: Chuck H.

description: I wrote a review of this place a couple of years ago when it was fairly new. I gave it four stars then. I don't know if this "update" will replace my original review. I'd taken exception then to the deployment of numerous flatscreen TV's mounted around the room, suggesting that maybe Hana Zen wanted to be a Sports Bar. But the food was excellent then and I've dined there several times in the meantime. But I really need to write about this most recent visit. I arranged a friend's birthday luncheon ( party of ten) with manager Fusai who really did a bang-up job. A couple of ladies have ambulation problems (walker, cane) and Fusai was able to arrange for us to have our cab drive us through security and drop us off at the restaurant. The restaurant, you may know, is located all the way at the back of Pier 39. It's got to be a quarter mile from the front curb. And Fusai arranged for a lovely birthday dessert for the birthday girl. Additionally, Fusai personally greeted our group very graciously. We were all impressed. Good job, Fusai!
author: Paula H.

description: Pier 39 is one of those monumental tourist traps where bad restaurants can stay in business for a long time because they don't have to worry about that pesky problem of getting repeat business. There are always new unsuspecting tourists ready to take the bait. Well, with that in mind, Hana Zen is above average. The view is fantastic. This restaurant has the best perch on the end of Pier 39, with the best views of Alcatraz and Angel Island. I happen to work in the area, and I've gone a few times with coworkers. Fortunately they have a 30% discount for locals on Thursdays, which brings their prices down to reasonable. The food is below average for Japanese food in SF - uninspired, inauthentic, but still completely edible. It's the kind of place where  tourists from Flyover Country would go, and proudly report that they've had "real Japanese food". We locals know we can do better. I'll probably be back sometime with my coworkers, but only on discount day.
author: Aaron F.

description: Beautiful view - by far the best from Pier 39! Alacatraz seems "swimable" from the establishment. :) The food is amazing as well. PERFECT setting for date night!
author: Desiree A.

description:
Good Sushi, great service.  

SO, the first time I wanted to come here, it was for my date's birthday.  I called and made reservations about a week in advance for a Saturday night.  They called me back during the week to let me know that they were having a 100 person party that night, and to see if i still wanted to keep my reservations.  I said Yes, oblivious to the obvious hinting that she wanted my ass out of there.  But, we wanted sushi that night, and it was the only sushi spot at the pier, it was perfect, so i was adamant about that reservation, and kept it .  She called me back a couple days later to tell me that the 100 person party was a private party and that we wouldn't be able to eat there that night.  I was kind of annoyed because the previous call I had asked her questions like "yea, we'll keep it.. do u think it will affect our service?"  and , "Is it OK with you guys?"  , which in hindsight i realize she was totally passive aggressive about.  Anyways, i was like "thanks"... for nothing, but didn't say that, and I had to make new reservations a couple of days before her birthday at a different spot--- ZUSHI PUZZLE, which btw was amazing.  Even though i was super stoked to try out Hana Zen, i had made the decision to never go there after they kinda P***ed out on telling me that I couldn't hold my reservations.  

However, they took the initiative to call me back, and tell me they were very sorry, and that if i ever went back there they would "definitely treat us to something special" and give 20% off.  20% off!!!! That was awesome because it totally made me want to go there now.  

SO, my date and I went there on New Year's Eve (we had reservations again, in which I explained to them about my 20% deal), and we were seated next to the window.  Great view!! 

Now onto the food... we ordered a dragon roll (pretty good), the 49er roll (topped with salmon and lemon slices)  -- i thought this one was excellent, and the cherry blossom roll which was also very good.
The best roll by far was the Sunset Strip (albacore tuna, tuna, and salmon wrapped in cucumber!!)  It was super fresh, and light, and just damn tasty.  I like that kind of stuff.  Our waitress was very courteous... great service over all.  The lady i talked to when i called in and explained the whole part of this story to said she would leave a note next to our reservation, so i was kinda banking on that fact, so i wouldnt have to ask for the 20% discount again.  

However, when we got our bill, they didn't take the 20% discount off.  ahh... so i walked up to the front and asked them again, she was super sorry blah blah blah, and they got me a new bill.  20% off!! cool!! ... except i pretty much had to beg them for that ish.    I probably would give one more star if they would have remembered, and really given me that "special treatment", we were expecting some dessert or something bc they offered that when i first made reservations for the birthday.  Still good deal though for both sides.  Because they got a sale from someone who wouldn't have gone there, and I got a cool 20% off.  Safe to say, I won't be going back there, but i had a good experience.  I won't be going back there because the sushi was just pretty good.. nothing great or worth going back imo.  Great service, nice waitresses.
author: Steve K.

description:
Great location with views of both Alcatraz and golden gate bridge. 

The service is average, it took 45 mins to deliver 2 special rolls, an Udon, a rice bowl, an appetizer when the restaurant is barely 1/5 full.  the worst part is when I asked for an extra bowl, the waitress came back in 5 mins with a bowl and the cash bills hanging all over the bowl.  (cash bills are the changes for the table next to ours.) 

The food is slightly above-average, comparing to Japantown, definitely not the best Japanese food in town.  Not sure if it is worth 5-star like most previous reviews.  Would recommend deep-fried oyster, $12 for half a dozen, a good buy.  The hot tea is not cheap, $4 something for a pot.

The price is about 10~20% higher than Japantown but not completely out of whack.  

The bottom-line is nothing special except for the view.
author: Ying L.

description: I love this place the view is really nice looking out to the bay. Very nice decor and really modern. food is excellent even though there inside pier 39 the price is really not too bad. I tried the tuna rolls, cucumber roll, salmon rolls,California rolls and the gyoza. everything was yummy! I can't wait to go back.
author: TC C.

description: I've lived in San Francisco for over 25 years and know to avoid Pier 39 unless I'm looking for mediocre tourist fare.  I couldn't have been more wrong after eating at Hana Zen this afternoon for lunch.  You'd probably have to travel to Japan to get better Japanese food.  Amazing view of the Bay, great service, and expertly prepared food.  I couldn't recommend this restaurant higher and I'm quite the foodie.
author: Noreen Cooper H.

description:
Hana Zen has amazing food and the Pier 39 location just makes it that much better. The restaurant is beautiful, service is great! Had the opportunity to meet the owner and his wonderful family and it made the experience that much more enjoyable! 

Food is fresh and there is variety to choose from. Everything we tried tasted as good as it looked! Everything was seasoned perfect!

With views of the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz  makes it great if you have family or business people in town. When ever I am back home in San Francisco I make it a point to stop in for dinner!
author: Nichole B.

description:
An oasis in the midst of the chaos of Pier 39.  You have to walk through the mayhem all the way to the end of the pier to get there, but it's worth it.  Once inside, there weren't any kids crying or parents yelling, just simple ambiance and killer views of the bay, Golden Gate Bridge, and Alcatraz.  Folks at the bar were watching the game and others were enjoying lunch.  We had a lunch of the Zen's Sushi Combo and the Ten Zaru Soba.  Both were good.  Nothing remarkable.  Until dessert.  We had the flourless chocolate cake with coconut ice cream and the green tea ice cream.  Both were incredible!  Killer chocolate cake and the coconut ice cream was rich and creamy.  Green tea ice cream is a passion for me and this one was unique.  Very floral and creamy.  Prices seemed a little high, but the view made it worth it.
A great place to some have drinks and watch the game with a (protected)view of the bay.
author: Monica S.

description: Bought the kron 4 deal for half off dining experience. Thought to give it a try given the 4 star reviews on yelp. The location is on pier 39 & the view from where we sat was wonderful. The decoration was modern & nice. The service was a little below average. The server came to our table twice, to take our orders & to serve our food. He never came by to ask for drink refills and the restaurant was not that busy at all. The food was average, salmon teriyaki was a little fishy & their tempura batter was not crispy at all. It was a little soft & cold when served.  I hate to be critical, but their rice was a little too soggy. I mean, how can a Japanese restaurant mess up the simplest item. Their price is definitely above the average & BTW, they charge for a green tea by the pot. Their description of the tea sounds wonderful, making you think that you are getting loose tea leaves, but instead, they serve you tea packet where you can purchase at store for $2.00 a box versus $4.75 for 1 tea packet in a pot. On the up note, their california roll was good. My husband had their sashimi & he said that their raw fish was not as fresh as he hoped & compared to other sushi restaurants.
author: Jackie D.

description: For a place with easy access to fresh sea food the meal I had here was very disappointing. They had quite a few more tempura rolls than anything else, which in my experience means the sushi is sub-par and they are trying to cover it up by frying it.  I was with a friend who is a sushi newbie so I tried to order some easy rolls.  We ordered potstickers, a crunchy California roll,  a kamikaze roll, a spicy tuna roll and a lion king roll. Although the menu states crab as an ingredient in many of the rolls, our server informed us that they actually had imitation crab in them and that it was a 3 dollar upcharge for real crab. We upgraded the lion king and crunchy California rolls. This meant that we ended up paying $13 for the crunchy California which was basically a deep fried California roll, the lion king roll ended up being almost $17.  I will say that these were the best of the rolls but the fact that both had some part of them deep fried and lots of special sauces made the actual sushi indistinguishable. We got the kamikaze roll roll with yellow tail, it and the spicy tuna were both not great to put it nicely. The potstickers were decent but it is kinda difficult to mess those up. The best thing about the place was its view of the bay. All in all I regretted wasting a vacation lunch on this restaurant when there was such great seafood and sushi at other restaurants nearby. We didn't finish everything we ordered because it was just not good, so when we left we were still hungry and ended up getting some clam chowder at fisherman's wharf.
author: Ashley L.

description: New restaurant, incredible sushi, incredible service!  Can't beat the location; far end of Pier 39 overlooking Alcatraz and Golden Gate Bridge.  Some of the best sushi I have ever eaten, and I just returned from 6 months in Japan.  They top it off with incredible presentations.
author: Vanessa P.

description: Hana Zen's billing lived up to it.  Great view of GG bridge and Alcatraz.  Sushi rolls were great.  But what really stood out was the Saba.  I had the salted saba and it was perfect.  Fresh, generous portions of the best tasting mackerel I ever had.  The owner happened to be there and was nice enough  to spend some time to chat.
author: Fernando S.

description: The food was good and plentiful. The service was superb. I had Teriyaki Chicken and Tempura Combo, my husband had Teriyaki Steak and Tempura Combo. Both were good. With all the soup and salad that came with it, I could barely eat my dinner and had to take it with me.
author: Karen T.

description: Authentic Japanese Restaurant and Bar with a breath taking view of the Bay. We hosted our event here and enjoyed our picks of season Sashimi, Martini Scallops, O-Toro, and pure rice sake. Our guest enjoyed event. With attentive service and spectacular view, and it's reasonably price. Recommend this highly.
author: andy w.

description: Best restaurant on Pier 39...Sushi was so flavorful and delicious! Lamp chops succulent..noodles wonderful...and the view, breathtaking...living in SF, I never go to Pier 39, thinking it is only for tourists, not so...validated parking! Staff warm and knowledge...we will be back! We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and left completely satisfied!
author: Nancy H.
